verses.sanskrit: सोमस्य मा तवसं वक्ष्यग्ने वह्निं चकर्थ विदथे यजध्यै देवानछा दीद्यद युञ्जे अद्रिं शमाये अग्ने तन्वंजुषस्व |||
verses.transliteration: somasya mā tavasaṃ vakṣyaghne vahniṃ cakartha vidathe yajadhyai devānachā dīdyad yuñje adriṃ śamāye aghne tanvaṃjuṣasva

translations.griffith: THOU, Agni, who wilt have the strong, hast made me the Soma's priest, to worship in assembly.  Thou shinest to the Gods, I set the press-stones. I toil; be joyful in thyself, O Agni.

verses.sanskrit: पराञ्चं यज्ञं चक्र्म वर्धतां गीः समिद्भिरग्निं नमसा दुवस्यन दिवः शशासुर्विदथा कवीनां गर्त्साय चित तवसे गातुमीषुः |||
verses.transliteration: prāñcaṃ yajñaṃ cakṛma vardhatāṃ ghīḥ samidbhiraghniṃ namasā duvasyan divaḥ śaśāsurvidathā kavīnāṃ ghṛtsāya cit tavase ghātumīṣuḥ

translations.griffith: East have we turned the rite; may the hymn aid it. With wood and worship shall they honour Agni.  From heaven the synods of the wise have learnt it: e’en for the quick and strong they seek advancement.

verses.sanskrit: मयो दधे मेधिरः पूतदक्षो दिवः सुबन्धुर्जनुषा पर्थिव्याः अविन्दन्नु दर्शतमप्स्वन्तर्देवासो अग्निमपसि सवसॄणाम |||
verses.transliteration: mayo dadhe medhiraḥ pūtadakṣo divaḥ subandhurjanuṣā pṛthivyāḥ avindannu darśatamapsvantardevāso aghnimapasi svasṝṇām

translations.griffith: The Prudent, he whose will is pure, brought welfare, allied by birth to Heaven and Earth in kinship.  The Gods discovered in the midst of waters beautiful Agni with the Sisters' labour.

verses.sanskrit: अवर्धयन सुभगं सप्त यह्वीः शवेतं जज्ञानमरुषम्महित्वा शिशुं न जातमभ्यारुरश्वा देवासो अग्निंजनिमन वपुष्यन |||
verses.transliteration: avardhayan subhaghaṃ sapta yahvīḥ śvetaṃ jajñānamaruṣammahitvā śiśuṃ na jātamabhyāruraśvā devāso aghniṃjaniman vapuṣyan

translations.griffith: Him, Blessed One, the Seven strong Floods augmented, him white at birth and red when waxen mighty.  As mother mares run to their new-born you ling, so at his birth the Gods wondered at Agni.

verses.sanskrit: शुक्रेभिरङगै रज आततन्वान करतुं पुनानः कविभिः पवित्रैः शोचिर्वसानः पर्यायुरपां शरियो मिमीते बर्हतीरनूनाः |||
verses.transliteration: śukrebhiraṅghai raja ātatanvān kratuṃ punānaḥ kavibhiḥ pavitraiḥ śocirvasānaḥ paryāyurapāṃ śriyo mimīte bṛhatīranūnāḥ

translations.griffith: Spreading with radiant limbs throughout the region, purging his power with wise purifications,  Robing himself in light, the life of waters, he spreads abroad his high and perfect glories.

verses.sanskrit: वव्राजा सीमनदतीरदब्धा दिवो यह्वीरवसाना अनग्नाः सना अत्र युवतयः सयोनीरेकं गर्भं दधिरे सप्त वाणीः |||
verses.transliteration: vavrājā sīmanadatīradabdhā divo yahvīravasānā anaghnāḥ sanā atra yuvatayaḥ sayonīrekaṃ gharbhaṃ dadhire sapta vāṇīḥ

translations.griffith: He sought heaven's Mighty Ones, the unconsuming, the unimpaired, not clothed and yet not naked.  Then they, ancient and young, who dwell together, Seven sounding Rivers, as one germ received him.

verses.sanskrit: सतीर्णा अस्य संहतो विश्वरूपा घर्तस्य योनौ सरवथे मधूनाम अस्थुरत्र धेनवः पिन्वमाना मही दस्मस्य मातरा समीची |||
verses.transliteration: stīrṇā asya saṃhato viśvarūpā ghṛtasya yonau sravathe madhūnām asthuratra dhenavaḥ pinvamānā mahī dasmasya mātarā samīcī

translations.griffith: His piles, assuming every form, are scattered where flow sweet waters, at the spring of fatness;  There stood the milch-kine with full-laden udders, and both paired Mighty Mothers of the Wondrous.

verses.sanskrit: बभ्राणः सूनो सहसो वयद्यौद दाधानः शुक्रा रभसा वपूंषि शचोतन्ति धारा मधुनो घर्तस्य वर्षा यत्र वाव्र्धे काव्येन |||
verses.transliteration: babhrāṇaḥ sūno sahaso vyadyaud dādhānaḥ śukrā rabhasā vapūṃṣi ścotanti dhārā madhuno ghṛtasya vṛṣā yatra vāvṛdhe kāvyena

translations.griffith: Carefully cherished, Son of Strength, thou shoncst assuming lasting and refulgent beauties.  Full streams of fatness and sweet juice descended, there where the Mighty One grew strong by wisdom.

verses.sanskrit: पितुश्चिदूधर्जनुषा विवेद वयस्य धारा अस्र्जद वि धेनाः गुहा चरन्तं सखिभिः शिवेभिर्दिवो यह्वीभिर्नगुहा बभूव |||
verses.transliteration: pituścidūdharjanuṣā viveda vyasya dhārā asṛjad vi dhenāḥ ghuhā carantaṃ sakhibhiḥ śivebhirdivo yahvībhirnaghuhā babhūva

translations.griffith: From birth he knew even his Father's bosom, he set his voices and his streams in motion;  Knew him who moved with blessed Friends in secret, with the young Dames of heaven. He stayed not hidden.

verses.sanskrit: पितुश्च गर्भं जनितुश्च बभ्रे पूर्वीरेको अधयत पीप्यानाः वर्ष्णे सपत्नी शुचये सबन्धू उभे अस्मै मनुष्येनि पाहि |||
verses.transliteration: pituśca gharbhaṃ janituśca babhre pūrvīreko adhayat pīpyānāḥ vṛṣṇe sapatnī śucaye sabandhū ubhe asmai manuṣyeni pāhi

translations.griffith: He nursed the Infant of the Sire and Maker: alone the Babe sucked many a teeming bosom.  Guard, for the Bright and Strong, the fellow-spouses friendly to men and bound to him in kinship.

verses.sanskrit: उरौ महाननिबाधे ववर्धापो अग्निं यशसः सं हि पूर्वीः रतस्य योनावशयद दमूना जामीनामग्निरपसिस्वसॄणाम |||
verses.transliteration: urau mahānanibādhe vavardhāpo aghniṃ yaśasaḥ saṃ hi pūrvīḥ ṛtasya yonāvaśayad damūnā jāmīnāmaghnirapasisvasṝṇām

translations.griffith: The Mighty One increased in space unbounded; full many a glorious flood gave strength to Agni.  Friend of the house, within the lap of Order lay Agni, in the Sister Rivers' service.

verses.sanskrit: अक्रो न बभ्रिः समिथे महीनां दिद्र्क्षेयः सूनवे भार्जीकः उदुस्रिया जनिता यो जजानापां गर्भो नर्तमो यह्वो अग्निः |||
verses.transliteration: akro na babhriḥ samithe mahīnāṃ didṛkṣeyaḥ sūnave bhāṛjīkaḥ udusriyā janitā yo jajānāpāṃ gharbho nṛtamo yahvo aghniḥ

translations.griffith: As keen supporter where great waters gather, light-shedder whom the brood rejoice to look on;  He who begat, and will beget, the dawnlights, most manly, Child of Floods, is youthful Agni.

verses.sanskrit: अपां गर्भं दर्शतमोषधीनां वना जजान सुभगा विरूपम देवासश्चिन मनसा सं हि जग्मुः पनिष्ठं जातं तवसं दुवस्यन |||
verses.transliteration: apāṃ gharbhaṃ darśatamoṣadhīnāṃ vanā jajāna subhaghā virūpam devāsaścin manasā saṃ hi jaghmuḥ paniṣṭhaṃ jātaṃ tavasaṃ duvasyan

translations.griffith: Him, varied in his form, the lovely Infant of floods and plants the blessed wood hath gendered.  Gods even, moved in spirit, came around him, and served him at his birth, the Strong, the Wondrous.

verses.sanskrit: बर्हन्त इद भानवो भार्जीकमग्निं सचन्त विद्युतो न शुक्राः गुहेव वर्द्धं सदसि सवे अन्तरपार ऊर्वे अम्र्तन्दुहानाः |||
verses.transliteration: bṛhanta id bhānavo bhāṛjīkamaghniṃ sacanta vidyuto na śukrāḥ ghuheva vṛddhaṃ sadasi sve antarapāra ūrve amṛtanduhānāḥ

translations.griffith: Like brilliant lightnings, mighty luminaries accompany the light-diffusing Agni,  Waxen, as ’twere in secret, in his dwelling, while in the boundless stall they milk out Amṛta.

verses.sanskrit: ईळे च तवा यजमानो हविर्भिरीळे सखित्वं सुमतिं निकामः देवैरवो मिमीहि सं जरित्रे रक्षा च नो दम्येभिरनीकैः |||
verses.transliteration: īḷe ca tvā yajamāno havirbhirīḷe sakhitvaṃ sumatiṃ nikāmaḥ devairavo mimīhi saṃ jaritre rakṣā ca no damyebhiranīkaiḥ

translations.griffith: I sacrificing serve thee with oblations and crave with longing thy good-will and friendship.  Grant, with the Gods, thy grace to him who lauds thee, protect us with thy rays that guard the homestead.

verses.sanskrit: उपक्षेतारस्तव सुप्रणीते.अग्ने विश्वानि धन्या दधानाः सुरेतसा शरवसा तुञ्जमाना अभि षयाम पर्तनायून्रदेवान |||
verses.transliteration: upakṣetārastava supraṇīte.aghne viśvāni dhanyā dadhānāḥ suretasā śravasā tuñjamānā abhi ṣyāma pṛtanāyūnradevān

translations.griffith: May we, O Agni, thou who leadest wisely, thy followers and masters of all treasures,  Strong in the glory of our noble offspring, subdue the godless when they seek the battle.

verses.sanskrit: आ देवानामभवः केतुरग्ने मन्द्रो विश्वानि काव्यानि विद्वान परति मर्तानवासयो दमूना अनु देवान रथिरो यासिसाधन |||
verses.transliteration: ā devānāmabhavaḥ keturaghne mandro viśvāni kāvyāni vidvān prati martānavāsayo damūnā anu devān rathiro yāsisādhan

translations.griffith: Ensign of Gods hast thou become, O Agni, joy-giver, knower of all secret wisdom.  Friend of the homestead, thou hast lightened mortals: carborne thou goest to the Gods, fulfilling.

verses.sanskrit: नि दुरोणे अम्र्तो मर्त्यानां राजा ससाद विदथानि साधन घर्तप्रतीक उर्विया वयद्यौदग्निर्विश्वानि काव्यानि विद्वान |||
verses.transliteration: ni duroṇe amṛto martyānāṃ rājā sasāda vidathāni sādhan ghṛtapratīka urviyā vyadyaudaghnirviśvāni kāvyāni vidvān

translations.griffith: Within the house hath sate the King immortal of mortals, filling full their sacred synods.  Bedewed with holy oil he shineth widely, Agni, the knower of all secret wisdom.

verses.sanskrit: आ नो गहि सख्येभिः शिवेभिर्महान महीभिरूतिभिः सरण्यन अस्मे रयिं बहुलं सन्तरुत्रं सुवाचं भागं यशसं कर्धी नः |||
verses.transliteration: ā no ghahi sakhyebhiḥ śivebhirmahān mahībhirūtibhiḥ saraṇyan asme rayiṃ bahulaṃ santarutraṃ suvācaṃ bhāghaṃ yaśasaṃ kṛdhī naḥ

translations.griffith: Come unto us with thine auspicious friendship, come speeding, Mighty, with thy mighty succours.  Grant us abundant wealth that saves from danger, that brings a good repute, a glorious portion.

verses.sanskrit: एता ते अग्ने जनिमा सनानि पर पूर्व्याय नूतनानि वोचम महान्ति वर्ष्णे सवना कर्तेमा जन्मञ-जन्मन निहितो जातवेदाः |||
verses.transliteration: etā te aghne janimā sanāni pra pūrvyāya nūtanāni vocam mahānti vṛṣṇe savanā kṛtemā janmañ-janman nihito jātavedāḥ

translations.griffith: To thee who art of old these songs, O Agni, have I declared, the ancient and the later.  These great libations to the Strong are offiered: in every birth is Jātavedas stablished.

verses.sanskrit: जन्मञ-जन्मन निहितो जातवेदा विश्वामित्रेभिरिध्यते अजस्रः तस्य वयं सुमतौ यज्ञियस्यापि भद्रे सौमनसे सयाम |||
verses.transliteration: janmañ-janman nihito jātavedā viśvāmitrebhiridhyate ajasraḥ tasya vayaṃ sumatau yajñiyasyāpi bhadre saumanase syāma

translations.griffith: Stablished in every birth is Jātavedas, kindled perpetual by the Viśvāmitras.  May we rest ever in the loving-kindness, in the auspicious grace of him the Holy.

verses.sanskrit: इमं यज्ञं सहसावन तवं नो देवत्रा धेहि सुक्रतो रराणः पर यंसि होतर्ब्र्हतीरिषो नो.अग्ने महि दरविनमा यजस्व |||
verses.transliteration: imaṃ yajñaṃ sahasāvan tvaṃ no devatrā dhehi sukrato rarāṇaḥ pra yaṃsi hotarbṛhatīriṣo no.aghne mahi dravinamā yajasva

translations.griffith: This sacrifice of ours do thou, O Mighty, O truly Wise, bear to the Gods rejoicing.  Grant us abundant food, thou priestly Herald, vouchsafe to give us ample wealth, O Agni.

verses.sanskrit: इळामग्ने पुरुदंसं सनिं गोः शश्वत्तमं हवमानायसाध सयान नः सूनुस्तनयो विजावाग्ने सा ते सुमतिर्भुत्वस्मे |||
verses.transliteration: iḷāmaghne purudaṃsaṃ saniṃ ghoḥ śaśvattamaṃ havamānāyasādha syān naḥ sūnustanayo vijāvāghne sā te sumatirbhutvasme

translations.griffith: As holy food, Agni, to thine'invoker give wealth in cattle, lasting, rich in marvels.  To us he born a son, and spreading offspring. Agni, be this thy gracious will to us-ward.

verses.sanskrit: वैश्वानराय धिषणां रताव्र्धे घर्तं न पूतमग्नयेजनामसि दविता होतारं मनुषश्च वाघतो धिया रथंन कुलिशः सं रण्वति |||
verses.transliteration: vaiśvānarāya dhiṣaṇāṃ ṛtāvṛdhe ghṛtaṃ na pūtamaghnayejanāmasi dvitā hotāraṃ manuṣaśca vāghato dhiyā rathaṃna kuliśaḥ saṃ ṛṇvati

translations.griffith: To him, Vaiśvānara, who strengthens Holy Law, to Agni we present our praise like oil made pure.  With thoughtful insight human priests bring him anear, our Herald from of old, as an axe forms a car.

verses.sanskrit: स रोचयज्जनुषा रोदसी उभे स मात्रोरभवत पुत्र ईड्यः हव्यवाळ अग्निरजरश्चनोहितो दूळभो विशामतिथिर्विभावसुः |||
verses.transliteration: sa rocayajjanuṣā rodasī ubhe sa mātrorabhavat putra īḍyaḥ havyavāḷ aghnirajaraścanohito dūḷabho viśāmatithirvibhāvasuḥ

translations.griffith: He made the heaven and earth resplendent by his birth: Child of two Mothers he was meet to be implored,  Agni, oblation-bearer, gracious, ever-young, infallible, rich in radiant light, the guest of men.

verses.sanskrit: करत्वा दक्षस्य तरुषो विधर्मणि देवासो अग्निं जनयन्त चित्तिभिः रुरुचानं भानुना जयोतिषा महामत्यं न वाजं सनिष्यन्नुप बरुवे |||
verses.transliteration: kratvā dakṣasya taruṣo vidharmaṇi devāso aghniṃ janayanta cittibhiḥ rurucānaṃ bhānunā jyotiṣā mahāmatyaṃ na vājaṃ saniṣyannupa bruve

translations.griffith: Within the range of their surpassinq power, by might, the Gods created Agni with inventive thought.  I, eager to win strength, address him, like a steed, resplendent with his brilliance, with his ample light.

verses.sanskrit: आ मन्द्रस्य सनिष्यन्तो वरेण्यं वर्णीमहे अह्रयं वाजम्र्ग्मियम रातिं भर्गूणामुशिजं कविक्रतुमग्निं राजन्तं दिव्येन शोचिषा |||
verses.transliteration: ā mandrasya saniṣyanto vareṇyaṃ vṛṇīmahe ahrayaṃ vājamṛghmiyam rātiṃ bhṛghūṇāmuśijaṃ kavikratumaghniṃ rājantaṃ divyena śociṣā

translations.griffith: Eager to gain, we crave from him the friendly God strength confident, choiceworthy meet to be extolled:  The Bhṛgus' bounty, willing, strong with sages' lore, even Agni shining forth with light that comes from heaven.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निं सुम्नाय दधिरे पुरो जना वाजश्रवसमिह वर्क्तबर्हिषः यतस्रुचः सुरुचं विश्वदेव्यं रुद्रं यज्ञानांसाधदिष्टिमपसाम |||
verses.transliteration: aghniṃ sumnāya dadhire puro janā vājaśravasamiha vṛktabarhiṣaḥ yatasrucaḥ surucaṃ viśvadevyaṃ rudraṃ yajñānāṃsādhadiṣṭimapasām

translations.griffith: For happiness, men, having trimmed the sacred grass, set Agni glorious for his strength before them here;  Yea, with raised ladles, him bright, dear to all the Gods, perfecting aims of works, Rudra of solemn rites.

verses.sanskrit: पावकशोचे तव हि कषयं परि होतर्यज्ञेषु वर्क्तबर्हिषो नरः अग्ने दुव इछमानास आप्यमुपासते दरविणं धेहि तेभ्यः |||
verses.transliteration: pāvakaśoce tava hi kṣayaṃ pari hotaryajñeṣu vṛktabarhiṣo naraḥ aghne duva ichamānāsa āpyamupāsate draviṇaṃ dhehi tebhyaḥ

translations.griffith: Around thy dwelling-place, O brightly-shining Priest, are men at sacrifice, whose sacred grass is trimmed.  Wishing to do thee service, Agni, they are there, desirous of thy friendship grant them store of wealth.

verses.sanskrit: आ रोदसी अप्र्णदा सवर्महज्जातं यदेनमपसो अधारयन सो अध्वराय परि णीयते कविरत्यो न वाजसातयेचनोहितः |||
verses.transliteration: ā rodasī apṛṇadā svarmahajjātaṃ yadenamapaso adhārayan so adhvarāya pari ṇīyate kaviratyo na vājasātayecanohitaḥ

translations.griffith: He hath filled heaven and earth and the great realm of light, when at his birth the skilful held him in their hold.  He like a horse is led forth to the sacrifice Sage, graciously inclined, that he may win us strength.

verses.sanskrit: नमस्यत हव्यदातिं सवध्वरं दुवस्यत दम्यं जातवेदसम रथीर्र्तस्य बर्हतो विचर्षणिरग्निर्देवानामभवत पुरोहितः |||
verses.transliteration: namasyata havyadātiṃ svadhvaraṃ duvasyata damyaṃ jātavedasam rathīrṛtasya bṛhato vicarṣaṇiraghnirdevānāmabhavat purohitaḥ

translations.griffith: Honour the oblation-bearer, him who knows fair rites, serve ye the Household Friend who knows all things that be.  He drives the chariot of the lofty ordinance: Agni most active, is the great High Priest of Gods.

verses.sanskrit: तिस्रो यह्वस्य समिधः परिज्मनो.अग्नेरपुनन्नुशिजो अम्र्त्यवः तासामेकामदधुर्मर्त्ये भुजमु लोकमु दवे उप जामिमीयतुः |||
verses.transliteration: tisro yahvasya samidhaḥ parijmano.aghnerapunannuśijo amṛtyavaḥ tāsāmekāmadadhurmartye bhujamu lokamu dve upa jāmimīyatuḥ

translations.griffith: They who are free from death, fain for him, purified three splendours of the mighty Agni, circling all.  To man, for his enjoyment, one of these they gave: the other two have passed into the sister sphere.

verses.sanskrit: विशां कविं विश्पतिं मानुषीरिषः सं सीमक्र्ण्वन सवधितिं न तेजसे स उद्वतो निवतो याति वेविषत स गर्भमेषु भुवनेषु दीधरत |||
verses.transliteration: viśāṃ kaviṃ viśpatiṃ mānuṣīriṣaḥ saṃ sīmakṛṇvan svadhitiṃ na tejase sa udvato nivato yāti veviṣat sa gharbhameṣu bhuvaneṣu dīdharat

translations.griffith: Man's sacrificial food hath sharpened like an axe, for brightness, him the Sage of men, the people's Lord,  Busied with sacred rites he mounts and he descends. He hath laid down his vital germ within these worlds.

verses.sanskrit: स जिन्वते जठरेषु परजज्ञिवान वर्षा चित्रेषु नानदन न सिंहः वैश्वानरः पर्थुपाजा अमर्त्यो वसु रत्ना दयमानो वि दाशुषे |||
verses.transliteration: sa jinvate jaṭhareṣu prajajñivān vṛṣā citreṣu nānadan na siṃhaḥ vaiśvānaraḥ pṛthupājā amartyo vasu ratnā dayamāno vi dāśuṣe

translations.griffith: He stirs with life in wombs dissimilar in kind, born as a Lion or a loudly-bellowing Bull:  Vaiśvānara immortal with wide-reaching might, bestowing goods and wealth on him who offiers gifts.

verses.sanskrit: वैश्वानरः परत्नथा नाकमारुहद दिवस पर्ष्ठं भन्दमानः सुमन्मभिः स पूर्ववज्जनयञ जन्तवे धनं समानमज्मं पर्येति जाग्र्विः |||
verses.transliteration: vaiśvānaraḥ pratnathā nākamāruhad divas pṛṣṭhaṃ bhandamānaḥ sumanmabhiḥ sa pūrvavajjanayañ jantave dhanaṃ samānamajmaṃ paryeti jāghṛviḥ

translations.griffith: Vaiśvānara, as of old, mounted the cope of heaven, heaven's ridge, well greeted, by those skilled in noble songs.  He, as of old, producing riches for the folk, still watchful, traversesthe common way again.

verses.sanskrit: रतावानं यज्ञियं विप्रमुक्थ्यमा यं दधे मातरिश्वा दिवि कषयम तं चित्रयामं हरिकेशमीमहे सुदीतिमग्निं सुविताय नव्यसे |||
verses.transliteration: ṛtāvānaṃ yajñiyaṃ vipramukthyamā yaṃ dadhe mātariśvā divi kṣayam taṃ citrayāmaṃ harikeśamīmahe sudītimaghniṃ suvitāya navyase

translations.griffith: For new prosperity we seek to Agni, him whose course is splendid, gold-haired, excellently bright,  Whom Mātariśvan stablished, dweller in the heaven, meet for high praise and holy, sage and true to Law.

verses.sanskrit: शुचिं न यामन्निषिरं सवर्द्र्शं केतुं दिवो रोचनस्थामुषर्बुधम अग्निं मूर्धानं दिवो अप्रतिष्कुतं तमीमहे नमसा वाजिनं बर्हत |||
verses.transliteration: śuciṃ na yāmanniṣiraṃ svardṛśaṃ ketuṃ divo rocanasthāmuṣarbudham aghniṃ mūrdhānaṃ divo apratiṣkutaṃ tamīmahe namasā vājinaṃ bṛhat

translations.griffith: As pure and swift of course, beholder of the light, who stands in heaven's bright sphere a sign, who wakes at dawn,  Agni, the head of heaven, whom none may turn aside-to him the Powerful with mighty prayer we seek.

verses.sanskrit: मन्द्रं होतारं शुचिमद्वयाविनं दमूनसमुक्थ्यं विश्वचर्षणिम रथं न चित्रं वपुषाय दर्शतं मनुर्हितं सदमिद राय ईमहे |||
verses.transliteration: mandraṃ hotāraṃ śucimadvayāvinaṃ damūnasamukthyaṃ viśvacarṣaṇim rathaṃ na citraṃ vapuṣāya darśataṃ manurhitaṃ sadamid rāya īmahe

translations.griffith: The cheerful Priest, the pure, in whom no guile is found, Friend of the House, praise-worthy, dear to all mankind,  Fair to behold for beauty like a splendid car,—Agni the Friend of men we ever seek for wealth.

verses.sanskrit: वैश्वानराय पर्थुपाजसे विपो रत्ना विधन्त धरुणेषु गातवे अग्निर्हि देवानम्र्तो दुवस्यत्यथा धर्माणि सनता न दूदुषत |||
verses.transliteration: vaiśvānarāya pṛthupājase vipo ratnā vidhanta dharuṇeṣu ghātave aghnirhi devānamṛto duvasyatyathā dharmāṇi sanatā na dūduṣat

translations.griffith: To him who shines afar, Vaiśvānara, shall bards give precious things that he may go on certain paths:  For Agni the Immortal serves the Deities, and therefore never breaks their everlasting laws.

verses.sanskrit: अन्तर्दूतो रोदसी दस्म ईयते होता निषत्तो मनुषः पुरोहितः कषयं बर्हन्तं परि भूषति दयुभिर्देवेभिरग्निरिषितो धियावसुः |||
verses.transliteration: antardūto rodasī dasma īyate hotā niṣatto manuṣaḥ purohitaḥ kṣayaṃ bṛhantaṃ pari bhūṣati dyubhirdevebhiraghniriṣito dhiyāvasuḥ

translations.griffith: He, wondrous envoy, goes between the earth and heaven, firm seated as the Herald, great High Priest of men.  He compassethwith rays the lofty dwelling-place, Agni, sent forward by the Gods, enriched with piayer.

verses.sanskrit: केतुं यज्ञानां विदथस्य सा धनं विप्रासो अग्निं महयन्त चित्तिभिः अपांसि यस्मिन्नधि सन्दधुर्गिरस्तस्मिन सुम्नानि यजमान आ चके |||
verses.transliteration: ketuṃ yajñānāṃ vidathasya sā dhanaṃ viprāso aghniṃ mahayanta cittibhiḥ apāṃsi yasminnadhi sandadhurghirastasmin sumnāni yajamāna ā cake

translations.griffith: Sages shall glorify Agni with earnest thoughts, ensign of sacrifice, who fills the synod full:  In whom the singers have stored up their holy acts to him the worshipper looks for joy and happiness.

verses.sanskrit: पिता यज्ञानामसुरो विपश्चितां विमानमग्निर्वयुनं च वाघताम आ विवेश रोदसी भूरिवर्पसा पुरुप्रियो भन्दते धामभिः कविः |||
verses.transliteration: pitā yajñānāmasuro vipaścitāṃ vimānamaghnirvayunaṃ ca vāghatām ā viveśa rodasī bhūrivarpasā purupriyo bhandate dhāmabhiḥ kaviḥ

translations.griffith: The Sire of sacrifice, great God of holy bards, Agni, the measure and the symbol of the priests,  Hath entered heaven and earth that show in varied form: the Sage whom many love rejoiceth in his might.

verses.sanskrit: चन्द्रमग्निं चन्द्ररथं हरिव्रतं वैश्वानरमप्सुषदं सवर्विदम विगाहं तूर्णिं तविषीभिराव्र्तं भूर्णिं देवास इह सुश्रियं दधुः |||
verses.transliteration: candramaghniṃ candrarathaṃ harivrataṃ vaiśvānaramapsuṣadaṃ svarvidam vighāhaṃ tūrṇiṃ taviṣībhirāvṛtaṃ bhūrṇiṃ devāsa iha suśriyaṃ dadhuḥ

translations.griffith: Bright Agni with the bright car, Lord of green domains, Vaiśvānara dweller in the floods, who finds the light,  Pervading, swift and wild, encompassed round with powers, him very glorious have the Gods established here.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निर्देवेभिर्मनुषश्च जन्तुभिस्तन्वानो यज्ञं पुरुपेशसं धिया रथीरन्तरीयते साधदिष्टिभिर्जीरो दमूना अभिशस्तिचातनः |||
verses.transliteration: aghnirdevebhirmanuṣaśca jantubhistanvāno yajñaṃ purupeśasaṃ dhiyā rathīrantarīyate sādhadiṣṭibhirjīro damūnā abhiśasticātanaḥ

translations.griffith: Agni, together with the Gods and Manu's folk by thought extending sacrifice in varied form,  Goes, car-borne, to and fro with those who crown each rite, the fleet, the Household Friend, who turns the curse aside.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने जरस्व सवपत्य आयुन्यूर्जा पिन्वस्व समिषो दिदीहि नः वयांसि जिन्व बर्हतश्च जाग्र्व उशिग देवानामसि सुक्रतुर्विपाम |||
verses.transliteration: aghne jarasva svapatya āyunyūrjā pinvasva samiṣo didīhi naḥ vayāṃsi jinva bṛhataśca jāghṛva uśigh devānāmasi sukraturvipām

translations.griffith: Sing, Agni, for long life to us and noble sons: teem thou with plenty, shine upon us store of food.  Increase the great man's strength, thou ever-vigilant: thou, longing for the Gods, knowest their hymns full well.

verses.sanskrit: विश्पतिं यह्वमतिथिं नरः सदा यन्तारं धीनामुशिजं च वाघताम अध्वराणां चेतनं जातवेदसं पर शंसन्ति नमसा जूतिभिर्व्र्धे |||
verses.transliteration: viśpatiṃ yahvamatithiṃ naraḥ sadā yantāraṃ dhīnāmuśijaṃ ca vāghatām adhvarāṇāṃ cetanaṃ jātavedasaṃ pra śaṃsanti namasā jūtibhirvṛdhe

translations.griffith: The Mighty One, Lord of the people and their guest, the leader of their thoughts, devoted Friend of priests,  Our solemn rites' announcer, Jātavedas, men with worship ever praise, with urgings for their weal.

verses.sanskrit: विभावा देवः सुरणः परि कषितीरग्निर्बभूव शवसासुमद्रथः तस्य वरतानि भूरिपोषिणो वयमुप भूषेमदम आ सुव्र्क्तिभिः |||
verses.transliteration: vibhāvā devaḥ suraṇaḥ pari kṣitīraghnirbabhūva śavasāsumadrathaḥ tasya vratāni bhūripoṣiṇo vayamupa bhūṣemadama ā suvṛktibhiḥ

translations.griffith: Agni the God resplendent, giver of great joy, hath on his lovely car compassed the lands with, might.  Let us with pure laudations in his house approach the high laws of the nourisher of multitudes.

verses.sanskrit: वैश्वानर तव धामान्या चके येभिः सवर्विदभवो विचक्षण जात आप्र्णो भुवनानि रोदसी अग्ने ता विस्वा परिभूरसि तमना |||
verses.transliteration: vaiśvānara tava dhāmānyā cake yebhiḥ svarvidabhavo vicakṣaṇa jāta āpṛṇo bhuvanāni rodasī aghne tā visvā paribhūrasi tmanā

translations.griffith: I celebrate thy glories, O Vaiśvānara, wherewith thou, O farsighted God, has found the light.  Thou filledst at thy birth both worlds, the earth and heaven: all this, O Agni, hast thou compassed of thyself.

verses.sanskrit: वैश्वानरस्य दंसनाभ्यो बर्हदरिणादेकः सवपस्यया कविः उभा पितरा महयन्नजायताग्निर्द्यावाप्र्थिवी भूरिरेतसा |||
verses.transliteration: vaiśvānarasya daṃsanābhyo bṛhadariṇādekaḥ svapasyayā kaviḥ ubhā pitarā mahayannajāyatāghnirdyāvāpṛthivī bhūriretasā

translations.griffith: By his great skill the Sage alone hath brought to pass a great deed, mightier than Vaiśvānara's wondrous acts.  Agni sprang into being, magnifying both his Parents, Heaven and Earth, rich in prolific seed.

verses.sanskrit: समित-समित सुमना बोध्यस्मे शुचा-शुचा सुमतिं रासि वस्वः आ देव देवान यजथाय वक्षि सखा सखीन सुमना यक्ष्यग्ने |||
verses.transliteration: samit-samit sumanā bodhyasme śucā-śucā sumatiṃ rāsi vasvaḥ ā deva devān yajathāya vakṣi sakhā sakhīn sumanā yakṣyaghne

translations.griffith: BE friendly with each kindled log of fuel, with every flash bestow the boon of riches.  Bring thou the Gods, O God, unto our worship: serve, well-inclined, as Friend thy friends, O Agni.

verses.sanskrit: यं देवासस्त्रिरहन्नायजन्ते दिवे-दिवे वरुणो मित्रो अग्निः सेमं यज्ञं मधुमन्तं कर्धी नस्तनूनपाद घर्तयोनिं विधन्तम |||
verses.transliteration: yaṃ devāsastrirahannāyajante dive-dive varuṇo mitro aghniḥ semaṃ yajñaṃ madhumantaṃ kṛdhī nastanūnapād ghṛtayoniṃ vidhantam

translations.griffith: Agni whom daily Varuṇa and Mitra the Gods bring thrice a day to this our worship,  Tanūnapāt, enrich with meath our service that dwells with holy oil, that offers honour.

verses.sanskrit: पर दीधितिर्विश्ववारा जिगाति होतारमिळः परथमं यजध्यै अछा नमोभिर्व्र्षभं वन्दध्यै स देवान यक्षदिषितो यजीयान |||
verses.transliteration: pra dīdhitirviśvavārā jighāti hotāramiḷaḥ prathamaṃ yajadhyai achā namobhirvṛṣabhaṃ vandadhyai sa devān yakṣadiṣito yajīyān

translations.griffith: The thought that bringeth every boon proceedeth to worship first the Priest of the libation,  That we may greet the Strong One with our homage. Urged, may he bring the Gods, best Sacrificer.

verses.sanskrit: ऊर्ध्वो वां गातुरध्वरे अकार्यूर्ध्वा शोचींषि परस्थिता रजांसि दिवो वा नाभा नयसादि होता सत्र्णीमहि देवव्यचा वि बर्हिः |||
verses.transliteration: ūrdhvo vāṃ ghāturadhvare akāryūrdhvā śocīṃṣi prasthitā rajāṃsi divo vā nābhā nyasādi hotā stṛṇīmahi devavyacā vi barhiḥ

translations.griffith: On high your way to sacrifice was made ready; the radiant flames went upward to the regions.  Full in the midst of heaven the Priest is seated: sirew we the sacred grass where Gods may rest them.

verses.sanskrit: सप्त होत्राणि मनसा वर्णाना इन्वन्तो विश्वं परति यन्न्र्तेन नर्पेशसो विदथेषु पर जाता अभीमं यज्ञं वि चरन्त पूर्वीः |||
verses.transliteration: sapta hotrāṇi manasā vṛṇānā invanto viśvaṃ prati yannṛtena nṛpeśaso vidatheṣu pra jātā abhīmaṃ yajñaṃ vi caranta pūrvīḥ

translations.griffith: Claiming in mind the seven priests' burntoblations, inciting all, they came in settled order.  To this our sacrifice approach the many who show in hero beauty at assemblies.

verses.sanskrit: आ भन्दमाने उषसा उपाके उत समयेते तन्वा विरूपे यथा नो मित्रो वरुणो जुजोषदिन्द्रो मरुत्वानुत वा महोभिः |||
verses.transliteration: ā bhandamāne uṣasā upāke uta smayete tanvā virūpe yathā no mitro varuṇo jujoṣadindro marutvānuta vā mahobhiḥ

translations.griffith: Night and Dawn, lauded, hither come together, both smiling, different are their forms in colour,  That Varuṇa and Mitra may accept us, and Indra, girt by Maruts, with his glories.

verses.sanskrit: दैव्या होतारा परथमा नय रञ्जे सप्त पर्क्षासः सवधयामदन्ति रतं शंसन्त रतमित त आहुरनु वरतं वरतपा दीध्यानाः |||
verses.transliteration: daivyā hotārā prathamā ny ṛñje sapta pṛkṣāsaḥ svadhayāmadanti ṛtaṃ śaṃsanta ṛtamit ta āhuranu vrataṃ vratapā dīdhyānāḥ

translations.griffith: I crave the grace of heaven's two chief Invokers: the seven swift steeds joy in their wonted manner.  These speak of truth, praising the truth eternal, thinking on Order as the guards of Order.

verses.sanskrit: आ भारती भारतीभिः सजोषा इळा देवैर्मनुष्येभिरग्निः सरस्वती सारस्वतेभिरर्वाक तिस्रो देवीर्बर्हिरेदं सदन्तु |||
verses.transliteration: ā bhāratī bhāratībhiḥ sajoṣā iḷā devairmanuṣyebhiraghniḥ sarasvatī sārasvatebhirarvāk tisro devīrbarhiredaṃ sadantu

translations.griffith: May Bhāratī with all her Sisters, Iḷā accordant with the Gods, with mortalls Agni,  Sarasvatī with all her kindred Rivers, come to this grass, Three Goddesses, and seat them.

verses.sanskrit: तन नस्तुरीपमध पोषयित्नु देव तवष्टर्वि रराणः सयस्व यतो वीरः कर्मण्यः सुदक्षो युक्तग्रावा जायते देवकामः |||
verses.transliteration: tan nasturīpamadha poṣayitnu deva tvaṣṭarvi rarāṇaḥ syasva yato vīraḥ karmaṇyaḥ sudakṣo yuktaghrāvā jāyate devakāmaḥ

translations.griffith: Well pleased with us do thou O God, O Tvaṣṭar, give ready issue to our procreant vigour,  Whence springs the hero, powerful, skilled in action, lover of Gods, adjuster of the press-stones.

verses.sanskrit: वनस्पते.अव सर्जोप देवानग्निर्हविः शमिता सूदयाति सेदु होता सत्यतरो यजाति यथा देवानां जनिमानि वेद |||
verses.transliteration: vanaspate.ava sṛjopa devānaghnirhaviḥ śamitā sūdayāti sedu hotā satyataro yajāti yathā devānāṃ janimāni veda

translations.griffith: Send to the Gods the oblation, Lord of Forests; and let the Immolator, Agni, dress it.  He as the truer Priest shall offer worship, for the Gods’ generations well he knoweth.

verses.sanskrit: आ याह्यग्ने समिधानो अर्वां इन्द्रेण देवैः सरथं तुरेभिः बर्हिर्न आस्तामदितिः सुपुत्रा सवाहा देवा अम्र्तामादयन्ताम |||
verses.transliteration: ā yāhyaghne samidhāno arvāṃ indreṇa devaiḥ sarathaṃ turebhiḥ barhirna āstāmaditiḥ suputrā svāhā devā amṛtāmādayantām

translations.griffith: Come thou to us, O Agni, duly kindled, together with the potent Gods and Indra.  On this our grass sit Aditi, happy Mother, and let our Hail delight the Gods Immortal.

verses.sanskrit: परत्यग्निरुषसश्चेकितानो.अबोधि विप्रः पदवीः कवीनाम पर्थुपाजा देवयद्भिः समिद्धो.अप दवारा तमसो वह्निरावः |||
verses.transliteration: pratyaghniruṣasaścekitāno.abodhi vipraḥ padavīḥ kavīnām pṛthupājā devayadbhiḥ samiddho.apa dvārā tamaso vahnirāvaḥ

translations.griffith: AGNI who shines against the Dawns is wakened. The holy Singer who precedes the sages.  With far-spread lustre, kindled by the pious, the Priest hath thrown both gates of darkness open.

verses.sanskrit: परेद वग्निर्वाव्र्धे सतोमेभिर्गीर्भि सतोतॄणां नमस्य उक्थैः पूर्वीर्र्तस्य सन्द्र्शश्चकानः सं दूतो अद्यौदुषसो विरोके |||
verses.transliteration: pred vaghnirvāvṛdhe stomebhirghīrbhi stotṝṇāṃ namasya ukthaiḥ pūrvīrṛtasya sandṛśaścakānaḥ saṃ dūto adyauduṣaso viroke

translations.griffith: Agni hath waxen mighty by laudations, to be adored with hymns of those who praise him.  Loving the varied shows of holy Order at the first flush of dawn he shines as envoy.

verses.sanskrit: अधाय्यग्निर्मानुषीषु विक्ष्वपां गर्भो मित्र रतेन साधन आ हर्यतो यजतः सान्वस्थादभूदु विप्रो हव्योमतीनाम |||
verses.transliteration: adhāyyaghnirmānuṣīṣu vikṣvapāṃ gharbho mitra ṛtena sādhan ā haryato yajataḥ sānvasthādabhūdu vipro havyomatīnām

translations.griffith: Amid men's homes hath Agni been established, fulfilling with the Law, Friend, germ of waters.  Loved and adored, the height he hath ascended, the Singer, object of our invocations.

verses.sanskrit: मित्रो अग्निर्भवति यत समिद्धो मित्रो होता वरुणो जातवेदाः मित्रो अध्वर्युरिषिरो दमूना मित्रः सिन्धूनामुत पर्वतानाम |||
verses.transliteration: mitro aghnirbhavati yat samiddho mitro hotā varuṇo jātavedāḥ mitro adhvaryuriṣiro damūnā mitraḥ sindhūnāmuta parvatānām

translations.griffith: Agni is Mitra when enkindled duly, Mitra as Priest, Varuṇa, Jātavedas;  Mitra as active minister, and House-Friend, Mitra of flowing rivers and of mountains.

verses.sanskrit: पाति परियं रिपो अग्रं पदं वेः पाति यज्वश्चरञंसूर्यस्य पाति नाभा सप्तशीर्षाणमग्निः पाति देवानामुपमादं रष्वः |||
verses.transliteration: pāti priyaṃ ripo aghraṃ padaṃ veḥ pāti yajvaścarañaṃsūryasya pāti nābhā saptaśīrṣāṇamaghniḥ pāti devānāmupamādaṃ ṛṣvaḥ

translations.griffith: The Earth's, the Bird's dear lofty place he guardeth, he guardeth in his might the course of Sūrya,  Guardeth the Seven-headed in the centre, guardeth sublime the Deities enjoyment.

verses.sanskrit: रभुश्चक्र ईड्यं चारु नाम विश्वानि देवो वयुनानि विद्वान ससस्य चर्म घर्तवत पदं वेस्तदिदग्नी रक्षत्यप्रयुछन |||
verses.transliteration: ṛbhuścakra īḍyaṃ cāru nāma viśvāni devo vayunāni vidvān sasasya carma ghṛtavat padaṃ vestadidaghnī rakṣatyaprayuchan

translations.griffith: The skilful God who knows all forms of knowledge made for himself a fair form, meet for worship.  This Agni guards with care that never ceases the Soma's skin, the Bird's place rich in fatness.

verses.sanskrit: आ योनिमग्निर्घ्र्तवन्तमस्थात पर्थुप्रगाणमुशन्तमुशानः दीद्यानः शुचिर्र्ष्वः पावकः पुनः-पुनर्मातरा नव्यसी कः |||
verses.transliteration: ā yonimaghnirghṛtavantamasthāt pṛthupraghāṇamuśantamuśānaḥ dīdyānaḥ śucirṛṣvaḥ pāvakaḥ punaḥ-punarmātarā navyasī kaḥ

translations.griffith: Agni hath entered longingly the longing shrine rich with fatness, giving easy access.  Resplendent, pure, sublime and purifying, again, again he renovates his Mothers.

verses.sanskrit: सद्यो जात ओषधीभिर्ववक्षे यदी वर्धन्ति परस्वो घर्तेन आप इव परवता शुम्भमाना उरुश्यदग्निः पित्रोरुपस्थे |||
verses.transliteration: sadyo jāta oṣadhībhirvavakṣe yadī vardhanti prasvo ghṛtena āpa iva pravatā śumbhamānā uruśyadaghniḥ pitrorupasthe

translations.griffith: Born suddenly, by plants he grew to greatness, when tender shoots with holy oil increased him,  Like waters lovely when they hasten downward may Agni in his Parents' lap protect us.

verses.sanskrit: उदु षटुतः समिधा यह्वो अद्यौद वर्ष्मन दिवो अधि नाभा पर्थिव्याः मित्रो अग्निरीड्यो मातरिश्वा दूतो वक्षद यजथाय देवान |||
verses.transliteration: udu ṣṭutaḥ samidhā yahvo adyaud varṣman divo adhi nābhā pṛthivyāḥ mitro aghnirīḍyo mātariśvā dūto vakṣad yajathāya devān

translations.griffith: Extolled, the Strong shone forth with kindled fuel to the earth's centre, to the height of heaven.  May Agni, Friend, adorable Mātariśvan, as envoy bring the Gods unto our worship.

verses.sanskrit: उदस्तम्भीत समिधा नाकं रष्वो.अग्निर्भवन्नुत्तमो रोचनानाम यदी भर्गुभ्यः परि मातरिश्वा गुहा सन्तं हव्यवाहं समीधे |||
verses.transliteration: udastambhīt samidhā nākaṃ ṛṣvo.aghnirbhavannuttamo rocanānām yadī bhṛghubhyaḥ pari mātariśvā ghuhā santaṃ havyavāhaṃ samīdhe

translations.griffith: Best of all luminaries lofty Agni supported with his flame the height of heaven,  When, far from Bhṛgus, Mātariśvan kindled the oblation-bearer where he lay in secret.

verses.transliteration: iḷāmaghne ...

translations.griffith: As holy food, Agni to thine invoker give wealth in cattle, lasting, rich in marvels.  To us be born a son and spreading offspring. Agni, be this thy gracious will to us-word.

verses.sanskrit: पर कारवो मनना वच्यमाना देवद्रीचीं नयत देवयन्तः दक्षिणावाड वाजिनी पराच्येति हविर्भरन्त्यग्नये घर्ताची |||
verses.transliteration: pra kāravo mananā vacyamānā devadrīcīṃ nayata devayantaḥ dakṣiṇāvāḍ vājinī prācyeti havirbharantyaghnaye ghṛtācī

translations.griffith: URGED on by deep devotion, O ye singers, bring, pious ones, the God-approaching ladle.  Borne onward to the right it travels eastward, and, filled with oil, to Agni bears oblation.

verses.sanskrit: आ रोदसी अप्र्णा जायमान उत पर रिक्था अध नु परयज्यो दिवश्चिदग्ने महिना पर्थिव्या वच्यन्तां ते वह्नयः सप्तजिह्वाः |||
verses.transliteration: ā rodasī apṛṇā jāyamāna uta pra rikthā adha nu prayajyo divaścidaghne mahinā pṛthivyā vacyantāṃ te vahnayaḥ saptajihvāḥ

translations.griffith: Thou at thy birth didst fill both earth and heaven, yea, Most Adorable, thou didst exceed them.  Even through the heaven's and through the earth's expanses let thy swift seventongued flames roll on, O Agni.

verses.sanskrit: दयौश्च तवा पर्थिवी यज्ञियासो नि होतारं सादयन्ते दमाय यदी विशो मानुषीर्देवयन्तीः परयस्वतीरीळते शुक्रमर्चिः |||
verses.transliteration: dyauśca tvā pṛthivī yajñiyāso ni hotāraṃ sādayante damāya yadī viśo mānuṣīrdevayantīḥ prayasvatīrīḷate śukramarciḥ

translations.griffith: Both Heaven and Earth and Gods who should be worshipped establish thee as Priest for every dwelling,  Whenever human families, God-devoted, bringing oblations; laud thy splendid lustre.

verses.sanskrit: महान सधस्थे धरुव आ निषत्तो.अन्तर्द्यावा माहिने हर्यमाणः आस्क्रे सपत्नी अजरे अम्र्क्ते सबर्दुघे उरुगायस्यधेनू |||
verses.transliteration: mahān sadhasthe dhruva ā niṣatto.antardyāvā māhine haryamāṇaḥ āskre sapatnī ajare amṛkte sabardughe urughāyasyadhenū

translations.griffith: Firm in the Gods’ home is the Mighty seated, between vast Heaven and Earth the well-beloved-  Those Cows who yield, unharmed, their nectar, Spouses of the Far-Strider, everyoung, united.

verses.sanskrit: वरता ते अग्ने महतो महानि तव करत्वा रोदसी आ ततन्थ तवं दूतो अभवो जायमानस्त्वं नेता वर्षभ चर्षणीनाम |||
verses.transliteration: vratā te aghne mahato mahāni tava kratvā rodasī ā tatantha tvaṃ dūto abhavo jāyamānastvaṃ netā vṛṣabha carṣaṇīnām

translations.griffith: Great are the deeds of thee, the Great, O Agni: thou by thy power hast spread out earth and heaven.  As soon as thou wast born thou wast an envoy, thou, Mighty One, was Leader of the people.

verses.sanskrit: रतस्य वा केशिना योग्याभिर्घ्र्तस्नुवा रोहिता धुरि धिष्व अथा वह देवान देव विश्वान सवध्वरा कर्णुहि जातवेदः |||
verses.transliteration: ṛtasya vā keśinā yoghyābhirghṛtasnuvā rohitā dhuri dhiṣva athā vaha devān deva viśvān svadhvarā kṛṇuhi jātavedaḥ

translations.griffith: Bind to the pole with cords of holy Order the long-maned ruddy steeds who sprinkle fatness.  Bring hithier, O thou God, all Gods together: provide them noble worship, Jātavedas.

verses.sanskrit: दिवश्चिदा ते रुचयन्ते रोका उषो विभातीरनु भासि पूर्वीः अपो यदग्न उशधग वनेषु होतुर्मन्द्रस्य पनयन्त देवाः |||
verses.transliteration: divaścidā te rucayante rokā uṣo vibhātīranu bhāsi pūrvīḥ apo yadaghna uśadhagh vaneṣu hoturmandrasya panayanta devāḥ

translations.griffith: Even from the sky thy brilliant lights shone hither: still hast thou beamed through many a radiant morning,  That the Gods praised their joyous Herald's labour eagerly burning, Agni, in the forests.

verses.sanskrit: उरौ वा ये अन्तरिक्षे मदन्ति दिवो वा ये रोचने सन्ति देवाः ऊमा वा ये सुहवासो यजत्रा आयेमिरे रथ्यो अग्ने अश्वाः |||
verses.transliteration: urau vā ye antarikṣe madanti divo vā ye rocane santi devāḥ ūmā vā ye suhavāso yajatrā āyemire rathyo aghne aśvāḥ

translations.griffith: The Gods who take delight in air's wide region, or those the dwellers in heaven's realm of brightness,  Or those, the Holy, prompt to hear, our helpers, who, carborne, turn their horses hither, Agni—-

verses.sanskrit: ऐभिरग्ने सरथं याह्यर्वां नानारथं वा विभवो हयश्वाः पत्नीवतस्त्रिंशतं तरींश्च देवाननुष्वधमा वह मादयस्व |||
verses.transliteration: aibhiraghne sarathaṃ yāhyarvāṃ nānārathaṃ vā vibhavo hyaśvāḥ patnīvatastriṃśataṃ trīṃśca devānanuṣvadhamā vaha mādayasva

translations.griffith: With these, borne on one ear, Agni, approach us, or borne on many, for thy steeds are able.  Bring, witb their Dames, the Gods, the Three and-Thirty, after thy Godlike nature, and be joyful.

verses.sanskrit: स होता यस्य रोदसी चिदुर्वी यज्ञं-यज्ञमभि वर्धे गर्णीतः पराची अध्वरेव तस्थतुः सुमेके रतावरी रतजातस्य सत्ये |||
verses.transliteration: sa hotā yasya rodasī cidurvī yajñaṃ-yajñamabhi vṛdhe ghṛṇītaḥ prācī adhvareva tasthatuḥ sumeke ṛtāvarī ṛtajātasya satye

translations.griffith: He is the Priest at whose repeated worship even wide Heaven and Earth sing out for increase.  They fair and true and holy coming forward stand at his sacrifice who springs from Order.

verses.transliteration: iḷāmaghne ...

translations.griffith: As holy food, Agni, to thine invoker give wealth in cattle, lasting, rich in marvels.  To us be born a son and spreading offspring. Agni, be this thy gracious will to usward.

verses.sanskrit: पर य आरुः शितिप्र्ष्ठस्य धासेरा मातरा विविशुः सप्त वाणीः परिक्षिता पितरा सं चरेते पर सर्स्राते दीर्घमायुः परयक्षे |||
verses.transliteration: pra ya āruḥ śitipṛṣṭhasya dhāserā mātarā viviśuḥ sapta vāṇīḥ parikṣitā pitarā saṃ carete pra sarsrāte dīrghamāyuḥ prayakṣe

translations.griffith: THE seven tones risen from the whitebacked viand have made their way between the pair of Mothers.  Both circumjacent Parents come together to yield us length of days they hasten forward.

verses.sanskrit: दिवक्षसो धेनवो वर्ष्णो अश्वा देवीरा तस्थौ मधुमद वहन्तीः रतस्य तवा सदसि कषेमयन्तं पर्येका चरति वर्तनिं गौः |||
verses.transliteration: divakṣaso dhenavo vṛṣṇo aśvā devīrā tasthau madhumad vahantīḥ ṛtasya tvā sadasi kṣemayantaṃ paryekā carati vartaniṃ ghauḥ

translations.griffith: The Male who dwells in heaven hath Mares and Milchkine: he came to Goddesses who bring sweet treasure.  To thee safe resting in the seat of Order the Cow alone upon her way proceedeth.

verses.sanskrit: आ सीमरोहत सुयमा भवन्तीः पतिश्चिकित्वान रयिविद रयीणाम पर नीलप्र्ष्ठो अतसस्य धासेस्ता अवासयत पुरुधप्रतीकः |||
verses.transliteration: ā sīmarohat suyamā bhavantīḥ patiścikitvān rayivid rayīṇām pra nīlapṛṣṭho atasasya dhāsestā avāsayat purudhapratīkaḥ

translations.griffith: Wise Master, wealthy finder-out of riches, he mounted those who may with case be guided.  He, dark-backed, manifold with varied aspect, hath made them burst forth from their food the brush-wood.

verses.sanskrit: महि तवाष्ट्रमूर्जयन्तीरजुर्यं सतभूयमानं वहतो वहन्ति वयङगेभिर्दिद्युतानः सधस्थ एकामिव रोदसी आ विवेश |||
verses.transliteration: mahi tvāṣṭramūrjayantīrajuryaṃ stabhūyamānaṃ vahato vahanti vyaṅghebhirdidyutānaḥ sadhastha ekāmiva rodasī ā viveśa

translations.griffith: Strength-giving streams bear hither him eternal, fain to support the mighty work. of Tvaṣṭar.  He, flashing in his home with all his members, hath entered both the worlds as they were single.

verses.sanskrit: जानन्ति वर्ष्णो अरुषस्य शेवमुत बरध्नस्य शासने रणन्ति दिवोरुचः सुरुचो रोचमाना इळा येषां गण्या माहिना गीः |||
verses.transliteration: jānanti vṛṣṇo aruṣasya śevamuta bradhnasya śāsane raṇanti divorucaḥ suruco rocamānā iḷā yeṣāṃ ghaṇyā māhinā ghīḥ

translations.griffith: They know the red Bull's blessing, and are joyful under the flaming-coloured Lord's dominion:  They who give shine from heavenwith fair effulgence, whose lofty song like Iḷā must be honoured.

verses.sanskrit: उतो पित्र्भ्यां परविदानु घोषं महो महद्भ्यामनयन्त शूषम उक्षा ह यत्र परि धानमक्तोरनु सवं धाम जरितुर्ववक्ष |||
verses.transliteration: uto pitṛbhyāṃ pravidānu ghoṣaṃ maho mahadbhyāmanayanta śūṣam ukṣā ha yatra pari dhānamaktoranu svaṃ dhāma jariturvavakṣa

translations.griffith: Yea, by tradition from the ancient sages they brought great strength from the two mighty Parents,  To where the singer's Bull, the night's dispeller, after his proper law hath waxen stronger.

verses.sanskrit: अध्वर्युभिः पञ्चभिः सप्त विप्राः परियं रक्षन्ते निहितं पदं वेः पराञ्चो मदन्त्युक्षणो अजुर्या देवा देवानामनु हि वरता गुः |||
verses.transliteration: adhvaryubhiḥ pañcabhiḥ sapta viprāḥ priyaṃ rakṣante nihitaṃ padaṃ veḥ prāñco madantyukṣaṇo ajuryā devā devānāmanu hi vratā ghuḥ

translations.griffith: Seven holy singers guard with five Adhvaryus the Bird's beloved firmly-settled station.  The willing Bulls, untouched by old, rejoice them: as Gods themselves the ways of Gods they follow.

verses.sanskrit: दैव्या होतारा परथमा ... ||
verses.transliteration: daivyā hotārā prathamā ...

translations.griffith: I crave the grace of heaven's two chief Invokers: the seven swift steeds joy in their wonted manner.  These speak of truth, praising the Truth Eternal, thinking on Order as the guards of Order.

verses.sanskrit: वर्षायन्ते महे अत्याय पूर्वीर्व्र्ष्णे चित्राय रश्मयः सुयामाः देव होतर्मन्द्रतरश्चिकित्वान महो देवान रोदसी एह वक्षि |||
verses.transliteration: vṛṣāyante mahe atyāya pūrvīrvṛṣṇe citrāya raśmayaḥ suyāmāḥ deva hotarmandrataraścikitvān maho devān rodasī eha vakṣi

translations.griffith: The many seek the great Steed as a stallion: the reins obey the Lord of varied colour.  O heavenly Priest, most pleasant, full of wisdom, bring the great Gods to us, and Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit: पर्क्षप्रयजो दरविणः सुवाचः सुकेतव उषसो रेवदूषुः उतो चिदग्ने महिना पर्थिव्याः कर्तं चिदेनः सं महे दशस्य |||
verses.transliteration: pṛkṣaprayajo draviṇaḥ suvācaḥ suketava uṣaso revadūṣuḥ uto cidaghne mahinā pṛthivyāḥ kṛtaṃ cidenaḥ saṃ mahe daśasya

translations.griffith: Rich Lord, the Mornings have gleamed forth in splendour, fair-rayed, fair-speaking, worshipped with all viands,  Yea, with the glory of the earth, O Agni. Forgive us, for our weal, e’en sin cornmitted.

verses.transliteration: iḷāmaghne ...

translations.griffith: As holy food, Agni, to thine invoker, give wealth in cattle, lasting, rich in marvels.  To us be born a son, and spreading offspring Agni, be this thy gracious will to usward.

verses.sanskrit: अञ्जन्ति तवामध्वरे देवयन्तो वनस्पते मधुना दैव्येन यदूर्ध्वस्तिष्ठा दरविणेह धत्ताद यद वा कषयो मातुरस्या उपस्थे |||
verses.transliteration: añjanti tvāmadhvare devayanto vanaspate madhunā daivyena yadūrdhvastiṣṭhā draviṇeha dhattād yad vā kṣayo māturasyā upasthe

translations.griffith: GOD-SERVING men, O Sovran of the Forest, with heavenly meath at sacrifice anoint thee.  Grant wealth to us when thou art standing upright as when reposing on this Mother's bosom.

verses.sanskrit: समिद्धस्य शरयमाणः पुरस्ताद बरह्म वन्वानो अजरं सुवीरम आरे अस्मदमतिं बाधमान उच्छ्रयस्व महते सौभगाय |||
verses.transliteration: samiddhasya śrayamāṇaḥ purastād brahma vanvāno ajaraṃ suvīram āre asmadamatiṃ bādhamāna ucchrayasva mahate saubhaghāya

translations.griffith: Set up to eastward of the fire enkindled, accepting prayer that wastes not, rich in hero.  Driving far from us poverty and famine, lift thyself up to bring us great good fortune.

verses.sanskrit: उच्छ्रयस्व वनस्पते वर्ष्मन पर्थिव्या अधि सुमिती मीयमानो वर्चो धा यज्ञवाहसे |||
verses.transliteration: ucchrayasva vanaspate varṣman pṛthivyā adhi sumitī mīyamāno varco dhā yajñavāhase

translations.griffith: Lord of the Forest, raise. thyself up on the loftiest spot of earth.  Give splendour, fixt and measured well, to him who brings the sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: युवा सुवासाः परिवीत आगात स उ शरेयान भवति जायमानः तं धीरासः कवय उन नयन्ति सवाध्यो मनसा देवयन्तः |||
verses.transliteration: yuvā suvāsāḥ parivīta āghāt sa u śreyān bhavati jāyamānaḥ taṃ dhīrāsaḥ kavaya un nayanti svādhyo manasā devayantaḥ

translations.griffith: Well-robed, enveloped he is come, the youthful: springing to life his glory waxeth greater.  Contemplative in mind and God-adoring, sages of high intelligence upraise him.

verses.sanskrit: जातो जायते सुदिनत्वे अह्नां समर्य आ विदथे वर्धमानः पुनन्ति धीरा अपसो मनीषा देवया विप्र उदियर्ति वाचम |||
verses.transliteration: jāto jāyate sudinatve ahnāṃ samarya ā vidathe vardhamānaḥ punanti dhīrā apaso manīṣā devayā vipra udiyarti vācam

translations.griffith: Sprung up he rises in the days' fair weather, increasing in the men-frequented synod.  With song the wise and skilful consecrate him: his voice the God-adoring singer utters.  6, Ye whom religious men have firmly planted; thou Forest Sovran whom the axe hath fashioned,—  Let those the Stakes divine which here are standing be fain to grant us wealth with store of children.

verses.sanskrit: यान वो नरो देवयन्तो निमिम्युर्वनस्पते सवधितिर्वा ततक्ष ते देवासः सवरवस्तस्थिवांसः परजावदस्मे दिधिषन्तु रत्नम |||
verses.transliteration: yān vo naro devayanto nimimyurvanaspate svadhitirvā tatakṣa te devāsaḥ svaravastasthivāṃsaḥ prajāvadasme didhiṣantu ratnam

translations.griffith: O men who lift the ladles up, these hewn and planted in the ground,  Bringing a blessing to the field, shall bear our precious gift to Gods.

verses.sanskrit: ये वर्क्णासो अधि कषमि निमितासो यतस्रुचः ते नो वयन्तु वार्यं देवत्रा कषेत्रसाधसः |||
verses.transliteration: ye vṛkṇāso adhi kṣami nimitāso yatasrucaḥ te no vyantu vāryaṃ devatrā kṣetrasādhasaḥ

translations.griffith: Ādityas, Rudras, Vasus, careful leaders, Earth, Heaven, and Prthivi and Air's mid-region,  Accordant Deities shall bless our worship and make our sacrifice's ensign lofty.

verses.sanskrit: आदित्या रुद्रा वसवः सुनीथा दयावाक्षामा पर्थिवी अन्तरिक्षम सजोषसो यज्ञमवन्तु देवा ऊर्ध्वं कर्ण्वन्त्वध्वरस्य केतुम |||
verses.transliteration: ādityā rudrā vasavaḥ sunīthā dyāvākṣāmā pṛthivī antarikṣam sajoṣaso yajñamavantu devā ūrdhvaṃ kṛṇvantvadhvarasya ketum

translations.griffith: Like swan's that flee in lengthened line, the Pillars have come to us arrayed in brilliant coIour.  They, lifted up on high, by sages, eastward, go forth as Gods to the God's dwelling-places.

verses.sanskrit: हंसा इव शरेणिशो यतानाः शुक्रा वसानाः सवरवो नागुः उन्नीयमानाः कविभिः पुरस्ताद देवा देवानामपि यन्ति पाथः |||
verses.transliteration: haṃsā iva śreṇiśo yatānāḥ śukrā vasānāḥ svaravo naāghuḥ unnīyamānāḥ kavibhiḥ purastād devā devānāmapi yanti pāthaḥ

translations.griffith: Those Stakes upon the earth with rings that deck them seem to the eye like horns of horned creatures;  Or, as upraised by priests in invocation, let them assist us in the rush to battle.

verses.sanskrit: शर्ङगाणीवेच्छ्र्ङगिणां सं दद्र्श्रे चषालवन्तः सवरवः पर्थिव्याम वाघद्भिर्वा विहवे शरोषमाणा अस्मानवन्तु पर्तनाज्येषु |||
verses.transliteration: śṛṅghāṇīvecchṛṅghiṇāṃ saṃ dadṛśre caṣālavantaḥ svaravaḥ pṛthivyām vāghadbhirvā vihave śroṣamāṇā asmānavantu pṛtanājyeṣu

translations.griffith: Lord of the Wood, rise with a hundred branches. with thousand branches may we rise to greatness,  Tlou whom this hatchct, with an edge well whetted for great felicity, hath brought before us.

verses.sanskrit: वनस्पते शतवल्शो वि रोह सहस्रवल्शा वि वयं रुहेम यं तवामयं सवधितिस्तेजमानः परणिनाय महते सौभगाय |||
verses.transliteration: vanaspate śatavalśo vi roha sahasravalśā vi vayaṃ ruhema yaṃ tvāmayaṃ svadhitistejamānaḥ praṇināya mahate saubhaghāya

translations.griffith: Missing line from Griffith.

verses.sanskrit: सखायस्त्वा वव्र्महे देवं मर्तास ऊतये अपां नपातंसुभगं सुदीदितिं सुप्रतूर्तिमनेहसम |||
verses.transliteration: sakhāyastvā vavṛmahe devaṃ martāsa ūtaye apāṃ napātaṃsubhaghaṃ sudīditiṃ supratūrtimanehasam

translations.griffith: WE as thy friends have chosen thee, mortals a God, to be our help,  The Waters’ Child, the blessed, the resplendent One, victorious and beyond compare.

verses.sanskrit: कायमानो वना तवं यन मातॄरजगन्नपः न तत तेग्ने परम्र्षे निवर्तनं यद दूरे सन्निहाभवः |||
verses.transliteration: kāyamāno vanā tvaṃ yan mātṝrajaghannapaḥ na tat teaghne pramṛṣe nivartanaṃ yad dūre sannihābhavaḥ

translations.griffith: Since thou delighting in the woods hast gone unto thy mother streams,  Not to be scorned, Agni, is that return of thine when from afar thou now art here.

verses.sanskrit: अति तर्ष्टं ववक्षिथाथैव सुमना असि पर-परान्ये यन्ति पर्यन्य आसते येषां सख्ये असि शरितः |||
verses.transliteration: ati tṛṣṭaṃ vavakṣithāthaiva sumanā asi pra-prānye yanti paryanya āsate yeṣāṃ sakhye asi śritaḥ

translations.griffith: O'er pungent smoke host thou prevailed, and thus art thou benevolent.  Some go before, and others round about thee sit, they in whose friendship thou hast place.

verses.sanskrit: ईयिवांसमति सरिधः शश्वतीरति सश्चतः अन्वीमविन्दन निचिरासो अद्रुहो.अप्सु सिंहमिव शरितम |||
verses.transliteration: īyivāṃsamati sridhaḥ śaśvatīrati saścataḥ anvīmavindan nicirāso adruho.apsu siṃhamiva śritam

translations.griffith: Him who had passed beyond his foes, beyond continual pursuits, Him the unerring Ones, observant, found in floods, couched like a lion in his lair.

verses.sanskrit: सस्र्वांसमिव तमनाग्निमित्था तिरोहितम ऐनं नयन मातरिश्वा परावतो देवेभ्यो मथितं परि |||
verses.transliteration: sasṛvāṃsamiva tmanāghnimitthā tirohitam ainaṃ nayan mātariśvā parāvato devebhyo mathitaṃ pari

translations.griffith: Him wandering at his own free will, Agni here hidden from our view,  Him Mātariśvan brought to us from far away produced by friction, from the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: तं तवा मर्ता अग्र्भ्णत देवेभ्यो हव्यवाहन विश्वान यद्यज्ञानभिपासि मानुष तव करत्वा यविष्ठ्य |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ tvā martā aghṛbhṇata devebhyo havyavāhana viśvān yadyajñānabhipāsi mānuṣa tava kratvā yaviṣṭhya

translations.griffith: O Bearer of Oblations, thus mortals received thee from the Gods,  Whilst thou, the Friend of man, guardest each sacrifice with thine own power, Most Youthful One.

verses.sanskrit: तद भद्रं तव दंसना पाकाय चिच्छदयति तवां यदग्ने पशवः समासते समिद्धमपिशर्वरे |||
verses.transliteration: tad bhadraṃ tava daṃsanā pākāya cicchadayati tvāṃ yadaghne paśavaḥ samāsate samiddhamapiśarvare

translations.griffith: Amid thy wonders this is good, yea, to the simple is it clear,  When gathered round about thee, Agni, lie the herds where thou art kindled in the morn.

verses.sanskrit: आ जुहोता सवध्वरं शीरं पावकशोचिषम आशुं दूतमजिरं परत्नमीड्यं शरुष्टी देवं सपर्यत |||
verses.transliteration: ā juhotā svadhvaraṃ śīraṃ pāvakaśociṣam āśuṃ dūtamajiraṃ pratnamīḍyaṃ śruṣṭī devaṃ saparyata

translations.griffith: Offer to him who knows fair rites, who burns with purifying glow,  Swift envoy, active, ancient, and adorable: serve ye the God attentively.

verses.sanskrit: तरीणि शता तरी सहस्राण्यग्निं तरिंशच्च देवा नवचासपर्यन औक्षन घर्तैरस्त्र्णन बर्हिरस्मा आदिद धोतारं नयसादयन्त |||
verses.transliteration: trīṇi śatā trī sahasrāṇyaghniṃ triṃśacca devā navacāsaparyan aukṣan ghṛtairastṛṇan barhirasmā ādid dhotāraṃ nyasādayanta

translations.griffith: Three times a hundred Gods and thrice a thousand, and three times ten and nine have worshipped Agni,  For him spread sacred grass, with oil bedewed him, and stablished him as Priest and Sacrificer.

verses.sanskrit: तवामग्ने मनीषिणः सम्राजं चर्षणीनाम देवं मर्तास इन्धते समध्वरे |||
verses.transliteration: tvāmaghne manīṣiṇaḥ samrājaṃ carṣaṇīnām devaṃ martāsa indhate samadhvare

translations.griffith: THEE Agni, God, Imperial Lord of all mankind, do mortal men  With understanding kindle at the sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: तवां यज्ञेष्व रत्विजमग्ने होतारमीळते गोपा रतस्य दीदिहि सवे दमे |||
verses.transliteration: tvāṃ yajñeṣv ṛtvijamaghne hotāramīḷate ghopā ṛtasya dīdihi sve dame

translations.griffith: They laud thee in their solemn rites, Agni, as Minister and Priest,  Shine forth in thine own home as guardian of the Law.

verses.sanskrit: स घा यस्ते ददाशति समिधा जातवेदसे सो अग्ने धत्तेसुवीर्यं स पुष्यति |||
verses.transliteration: sa ghā yaste dadāśati samidhā jātavedase so aghne dhattesuvīryaṃ sa puṣyati

translations.griffith: He, verily, who honours thee with fuel, Knower of all life,  He, Agni! wins heroic might, he prospers well.

verses.sanskrit: स केतुरध्वराणामग्निर्देवेभिरा गमत अञ्जानः सप्त होत्र्भिर्हविष्मते |||
verses.transliteration: sa keturadhvarāṇāmaghnirdevebhirā ghamat añjānaḥ sapta hotṛbhirhaviṣmate

translations.griffith: Ensign of sacrifices, he, Agni, with Gods is come to us,  Decked by the seven priests, to him who bringeth gifts.

verses.sanskrit: पर होत्रे पूर्व्यं वचो.अग्नये भरता बर्हत विपां जयोतींषि बिभ्रते न वेधसे |||
verses.transliteration: pra hotre pūrvyaṃ vaco.aghnaye bharatā bṛhat vipāṃ jyotīṃṣi bibhrate na vedhase

translations.griffith: To Agni, the Invoking Priest, offer your best, your lofty speech,  To him Ordainer-like who brings the light of songs.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निं वर्धन्तु नो गिरो यतो जायत उक्थ्यः महे वाजायद्रविणाय दर्शतः |||
verses.transliteration: aghniṃ vardhantu no ghiro yato jāyata ukthyaḥ mahe vājāyadraviṇāya darśataḥ

translations.griffith: Let these our hymns make Agni grow, whence, meet for laud, he springs to life,  To mighty strength and great possession, fair to see.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने यजिष्ठो अध्वरे देवान देवयते यज होता मन्द्रो विराजस्यति सरिधः |||
verses.transliteration: aghne yajiṣṭho adhvare devān devayate yaja hotā mandro virājasyati sridhaḥ

translations.griffith: Best Sacrificer, bring the Gods, O Agni, to the pious man:  A joyful Priest, thy splendour drive our foes afar

verses.sanskrit: स नः पावक दीदिहि दयुमदस्मे सुवीर्यम भवा सतोत्र्भ्योन्तमः सवस्तये |||
verses.transliteration: sa naḥ pāvaka dīdihi dyumadasme suvīryam bhavā stotṛbhyoantamaḥ svastaye

translations.griffith: As such, O Purifier, shine on us heroic glorious might:  Be nearest Friend to those who laud thee, for their weal.

verses.sanskrit: तं तवा विप्रा विपन्यवो जाग्र्वांसः समिन्धते हव्यवाहममर्त्यं सहोव्र्धम |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ tvā viprā vipanyavo jāghṛvāṃsaḥ samindhate havyavāhamamartyaṃ sahovṛdham

translations.griffith: So, wakeful, versed in sacred hymns, the holy singers kindly thee.  Oblation-bearer, deathless, cherisher of strength.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निर्होता पुरोहितो.अध्वरस्य विचर्षणिः स वेद यज्ञमानुषक |||
verses.transliteration: aghnirhotā purohito.adhvarasya vicarṣaṇiḥ sa veda yajñamānuṣak

translations.griffith: AGNI is Priest, the great High Priest of sacrifice, most swift in act:  He knows the rite in constant course.

verses.sanskrit: स हव्यवाळ अमर्त्य उशिग दूतस चनोहितः अग्निर्धिया सं रण्वति |||
verses.transliteration: sa havyavāḷ amartya uśigh dūtas canohitaḥ aghnirdhiyā saṃ ṛṇvati

translations.griffith: Oblation-bearer, deathless, well inclined, an eager messenger,  Agni comes nigh us with the thought.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निर्धिया स चेतति केतुर्यज्ञस्य पूर्व्यः अर्थं हयस्य तरणि |||
verses.transliteration: aghnirdhiyā sa cetati keturyajñasya pūrvyaḥ arthaṃ hyasya taraṇi

translations.griffith: Ensign of sacrifice from of old, Agni well knoweth with his thought  To prosper this man's aim and hope.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निं सूनुं सनश्रुतं सहसो जातवेदसम वह्निं देवाक्र्ण्वत |||
verses.transliteration: aghniṃ sūnuṃ sanaśrutaṃ sahaso jātavedasam vahniṃ devāakṛṇvata

translations.griffith: Agni, illustrious from old time, the Son of Strength who knows all life,  The Gods have made to their Priest.

verses.sanskrit: अदाभ्यः पुरेता विशामग्निर्मानुषीणाम तूर्णी रथः सदा नवः |||
verses.transliteration: adābhyaḥ puraetā viśāmaghnirmānuṣīṇām tūrṇī rathaḥ sadā navaḥ

translations.griffith: Infallible is Agni, he who goes before the tribes of men,  A chariot swift and ever new.

verses.sanskrit: साह्वान विश्वा अभियुजः करतुर्देवानामम्र्क्तः अग्निस्तुविश्रवस्तमः |||
verses.transliteration: sāhvān viśvā abhiyujaḥ kraturdevānāmamṛktaḥ aghnistuviśravastamaḥ

translations.griffith: Strength of the Gods which none may harm, subduing all his enemies,  Agni is mightiest in fame.

verses.sanskrit: अभि परयांसि वाहसा दाश्वानश्नोति मर्त्यः कषयं पावकशोचिषः |||
verses.transliteration: abhi prayāṃsi vāhasā dāśvānaśnoti martyaḥ kṣayaṃ pāvakaśociṣaḥ

translations.griffith: By offering sacred food to him the mortal worshipper obtains.  A home from him whose light makes pure.

verses.sanskrit: परि विश्वानि सुधिताग्नेरश्याम मन्मभिः विप्रासो जातवेदसः |||
verses.transliteration: pari viśvāni sudhitāghneraśyāma manmabhiḥ viprāso jātavedasaḥ

translations.griffith: From Agni, by our hymns, may we gain all things that bring happiness,  Singers of him who knows all life.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने विश्वानि वार्या वाजेषु सनिषामहे तवे देवास एरिरे |||
verses.transliteration: aghne viśvāni vāryā vājeṣu saniṣāmahe tve devāsa erire

translations.griffith: O Agni, in our deeds of might may we obtain all precious things:  Tle Gods are centred all in thee.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्राग्नी आ गतं सुतं गीर्भिर्नभो वरेण्यम अस्य पातं धियेषिता |||
verses.transliteration: indrāghnī ā ghataṃ sutaṃ ghīrbhirnabho vareṇyam asya pātaṃ dhiyeṣitā

translations.griffith: MOVED, Indra-Agni, by our hymn, come to the juice, the precious dew:  Drink ye thereof, impelled by song.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्राग्नी जरितुः सचा यज्ञो जिगाति चेतनः अया पातमिमं सुतम |||
verses.transliteration: indrāghnī jarituḥ sacā yajño jighāti cetanaḥ ayā pātamimaṃ sutam

translations.griffith: O Indra-Agni, with the man who lauds you comes the wakening rite:  So drink ye both this juice assured.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रमग्निं कविछदा यज्ञस्य जूत्या वर्णे ता सोमस्येह तर्म्पताम |||
verses.transliteration: indramaghniṃ kavichadā yajñasya jūtyā vṛṇe tā somasyeha tṛmpatām

translations.griffith: Through force of sacrifice I choose Indra-Agni who love the wise:  With Soma let these sate them here.

verses.sanskrit: तोशा वर्त्रहणा हुवे सजित्वानापराजिता इन्द्राग्नी वाजसातमा |||
verses.transliteration: tośā vṛtrahaṇā huve sajitvānāparājitā indrāghnī vājasātamā

translations.griffith: Indra and Agni I invoke, joint-victors, bounteous, unsubdued,  Foe-slayers, best to win the spoil.

verses.sanskrit: पर वामर्चन्त्युक्थिनो नीथाविदो जरितारः इन्द्राग्नी इष आ वर्णे |||
verses.transliteration: pra vāmarcantyukthino nīthāvido jaritāraḥ indrāghnī iṣa ā vṛṇe

translations.griffith: Indra and Agni, singers skilled in melody hymn you, bringing lauds:  I choose you for the sacred food.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्राग्नी नवतिं पुरो दासपत्नीरधूनुतम साकमेकेन कर्मणा |||
verses.transliteration: indrāghnī navatiṃ puro dāsapatnīradhūnutam sākamekena karmaṇā

translations.griffith: Indra and Agni, ye cast down the ninety forts which Dāsas held,  Together, with one mighty deed.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्राग्नी अपसस पर्युप पर यन्ति धीतयः रतस्य पथ्या अनु |||
verses.transliteration: indrāghnī apasas paryupa pra yanti dhītayaḥ ṛtasya pathyā anu

translations.griffith: To Indra-Agni reverent thoughts go forward from the holy task  Along the path of sacred Law.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्राग्नी तविषाणि वां सधस्थानि परयांसि च युवोरप्तूर्यं हितम |||
verses.transliteration: indrāghnī taviṣāṇi vāṃ sadhasthāni prayāṃsi ca yuvoraptūryaṃ hitam

translations.griffith: O Indra-Agni, powers are yours, and dwellings and delightful food  Good is your readiness to act.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्राग्नी रोचना दिवः परि वाजेषु भूषथः तद वांचेति पर वीर्यम |||
verses.transliteration: indrāghnī rocanā divaḥ pari vājeṣu bhūṣathaḥ tad vāṃceti pra vīryam

translations.griffith: Indra and Agni, in your deeds of might ye deck heaven's lucid realms:  Famed is that hero strength of yours.

verses.sanskrit: पर वो देवायाग्नये बर्हिष्ठमर्चास्मै गमद देवेभिरास नो यजिष्ठो बर्हिरा सदत |||
verses.transliteration: pra vo devāyāghnaye barhiṣṭhamarcāsmai ghamad devebhirāsa no yajiṣṭho barhirā sadat

translations.griffith: To Agni, to this God of yours I sing aloud with utmost power.  May he come to us with the Gods, and sit, best Offerer, on the grass.

verses.sanskrit: रतावा यस्य रोदसी दक्षं सचन्त ऊतयः हविष्मन्तस्तमीळते तं सनिष्यन्तो.अवसे |||
verses.transliteration: ṛtāvā yasya rodasī dakṣaṃ sacanta ūtayaḥ haviṣmantastamīḷate taṃ saniṣyanto.avase

translations.griffith: The Holy, whose are earth and heaven, and succour waits upon his strength;  Him men who bring oblations laud, and they who wish to gain, for grace.

verses.sanskrit: स यन्ता विप्र एषां स यज्ञानामथा हि षः अग्निं तं वो दुवस्यत दाता यो वनिता मघम |||
verses.transliteration: sa yantā vipra eṣāṃ sa yajñānāmathā hi ṣaḥ aghniṃ taṃ vo duvasyata dātā yo vanitā magham

translations.griffith: He is the Sage who guides these men, Leader of sacred rites is he.  Him your own Agni, serve ye well, who winneth and bestoweth wealth.

verses.sanskrit: स नः शर्माणि वीतये.अग्निर्यछतु शन्तमा यतो नःप्रुष्णवद वसु दिवि कषितिभ्यो अप्स्वा |||
verses.transliteration: sa naḥ śarmāṇi vītaye.aghniryachatu śantamā yato naḥpruṣṇavad vasu divi kṣitibhyo apsvā

translations.griffith: So may the gracious Agni grant most goodly shelter for our use;  Whence in the heavens or in the floods he shall pour wealth upon our lands.

verses.sanskrit: दीदिवांसमपूर्व्यं वस्वीभिरस्य धीतिभिः रक्वाणो अग्निमिन्धते होतारं विश्पतिं विशाम |||
verses.transliteration: dīdivāṃsamapūrvyaṃ vasvībhirasya dhītibhiḥ ṛkvāṇo aghnimindhate hotāraṃ viśpatiṃ viśām

translations.griffith: The singers kindle him, the Priest, Agni the Lord of tribes of men,  Resplendent and without a peer through his own excellent designs.

verses.sanskrit: उत नो बरह्मन्नविष उक्थेषु देवहूतमः शं नः शोचामरुद्व्र्धो.अग्ने सहस्रसातमः |||
verses.transliteration: uta no brahmannaviṣa uktheṣu devahūtamaḥ śaṃ naḥ śocāmarudvṛdho.aghne sahasrasātamaḥ

translations.griffith: Help us, thou Brahman, best of all invokers of the Gods in song.  Beam, Friend of Maruts, bliss on us, O Agni, a most liberal God.

verses.sanskrit: नू नो रास्व सहस्रवत तोकवत पुष्टिमद वसु दयुमदग्ने सुवीर्यं वर्षिष्थमनुपक्षितम |||
verses.transliteration: nū no rāsva sahasravat tokavat puṣṭimad vasu dyumadaghne suvīryaṃ varṣiṣthamanupakṣitam

translations.griffith: Yea, grant us treasure thousandfold with children and with nourishment,  And, Agni, splendid hero strength, exalted, wasting not away.

verses.sanskrit: आ होता मन्द्रो विदथान्यस्थात सत्यो यज्वा कवितमः सवेधाः विद्युद्रथः सहसस पुत्रो अग्निः शोचिष्केशः पर्थिव्यां पाजो अश्रेत |||
verses.transliteration: ā hotā mandro vidathānyasthāt satyo yajvā kavitamaḥ savedhāḥ vidyudrathaḥ sahasas putro aghniḥ śociṣkeśaḥ pṛthivyāṃ pājo aśret

translations.griffith: THE pleasant Priest is come into the synod, true, skilled in sacrifice, most wise, Ordainer.  Agni, the Son of Strength, whose car is lightning, whose hair is flame, hath shown on earth his lustre.

verses.sanskrit: अयामि ते नमौक्तिं जुषस्व रतावस्तुभ्यं चेतते सहस्वः विद्वाना वक्षि विदुषो नि षत्सि मध्य आ बर्हिरूतये यजत्र |||
verses.transliteration: ayāmi te namauktiṃ juṣasva ṛtāvastubhyaṃ cetate sahasvaḥ vidvānā vakṣi viduṣo ni ṣatsi madhya ā barhirūtaye yajatra

translations.griffith: To thee I offer reverent speech: accept it: to thee who markest it, victorious, faithful!  Bring, thou who knowest, those who know, and seat thee amid the sacred grass, for help, O Holy.

verses.sanskrit: दरवतां त उषसा वाजयन्ती अग्ने वातस्य पथ्याभिरछ यत सीमञ्जन्ति पूर्व्यं हविर्भिरा वन्धुरेव तस्थतुर्दुरोणे |||
verses.transliteration: dravatāṃ ta uṣasā vājayantī aghne vātasya pathyābhiracha yat sīmañjanti pūrvyaṃ havirbhirā vandhureva tasthaturduroṇe

translations.griffith: The Two who show their vigour, Night and Morning, by the wind's paths shall haste to thee O Agni.  When men adorn the Ancient with oblations, these seek, as on two chariot-seats, the dwelling.

verses.sanskrit: मित्रश्च तुभ्यं वरुणः सहस्वो.अग्ने विश्वे मरुतः सुम्नमर्चन यच्छोचिषा सहसस पुत्र तिष्ठा अभि कषितीः परथयन सूर्यो नॄन |||
verses.transliteration: mitraśca tubhyaṃ varuṇaḥ sahasvo.aghne viśve marutaḥ sumnamarcan yacchociṣā sahasas putra tiṣṭhā abhi kṣitīḥ prathayan sūryo nṝn

translations.griffith: To thee, strong Agni! Varuṇa and Mitra and all the Maruts sang a song of triumph,  What time unto the people's lands thou camest, spreading them as the Sun of men, with lustre.

verses.sanskrit: वयं ते अद्य ररिमा हि काममुत्तानहस्ता नमसोपसद्य यजिष्ठेन मनसा यक्षि देवानस्रेधता मन्मना विप्रो अग्ने |||
verses.transliteration: vayaṃ te adya rarimā hi kāmamuttānahastā namasopasadya yajiṣṭhena manasā yakṣi devānasredhatā manmanā vipro aghne

translations.griffith: Approaching with raised hands and adoration, we have this day fulfilled for thee thy longing.  Worship the Gods with most devoted spirit, a Priest with no unfriendly thought, O Agni.

verses.sanskrit: तवद धि पुत्र सहसो वि पूर्वीर्देवस्य यन्त्यूतयो वि वाजाः तवं देहि सहस्रिणं रयिं नो.अद्रोघेण वचसा सत्यमग्ने |||
verses.transliteration: tvad dhi putra sahaso vi pūrvīrdevasya yantyūtayo vi vājāḥ tvaṃ dehi sahasriṇaṃ rayiṃ no.adrogheṇa vacasā satyamaghne

translations.griffith: For, Son of Strength, from thee come many succours, and powers abundant that a God possesses.  Agni, to us with speech that hath no falsehood grant riches, real, to be told in thousands.

verses.sanskrit: तुभ्यं दक्ष कविक्रतो यानीमा देव मर्तासो अध्वरे अकर्म तवं विश्वस्य सुरथस्य बोधि सर्वं तदग्ने अम्र्त सवदेह |||
verses.transliteration: tubhyaṃ dakṣa kavikrato yānīmā deva martāso adhvare akarma tvaṃ viśvasya surathasya bodhi sarvaṃ tadaghne amṛta svadeha

translations.griffith: Whatever, God, in sacrifice we mortals have wrought is all for thee, strong, wise of purpose!  Be thou the Friend of each good chariot's master. All this enjoy thou here, immortal Agni.

verses.sanskrit: वि पाजसा पर्थुना शोशुचानो बाधस्व दविषो रक्षसो अमीवाः सुशर्मणो बर्हतः शर्मणि सयामग्नेरहं सुहवस्य परणीतौ |||
verses.transliteration: vi pājasā pṛthunā śośucāno bādhasva dviṣo rakṣaso amīvāḥ suśarmaṇo bṛhataḥ śarmaṇi syāmaghnerahaṃ suhavasya praṇītau

translations.griffith: RESPLENDENT with thy wide-extending lustre, dispel the terrors of the fiends who hate us  May lofty Agni be my guide and shelter, the easily-invoked, the good Protector.

verses.sanskrit: तवं नो अस्या उषसो वयुष्टौ तवं सूर उदिते बोधि गोपाः जन्मेव नित्यं तनयं जुषस्व सतोमं मे अग्ने तन्वा सुजात |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ no asyā uṣaso vyuṣṭau tvaṃ sūra udite bodhi ghopāḥ janmeva nityaṃ tanayaṃ juṣasva stomaṃ me aghne tanvā sujāta

translations.griffith: Be thou To us, while now the morn is breaking, be thou a guardian when the Sun hath mounted..  Accept, as men accept a true-born infant, my laud, O Agni nobly born in body.

verses.sanskrit: तवं नर्चक्षा वर्षभानु पूर्वीः कर्ष्णास्वग्ने अरुषो विभाहि वसो नेषि च पर्षि चात्यंहः कर्धी नो राय उशिजो यविष्ठ |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ nṛcakṣā vṛṣabhānu pūrvīḥ kṛṣṇāsvaghne aruṣo vibhāhi vaso neṣi ca parṣi cātyaṃhaḥ kṛdhī no rāya uśijo yaviṣṭha

translations.griffith: Bull, who beholdest men, through many mornings, among the dark ones shine forth red, O Agni.  Lead us, good Lord, and bear us over trouble: Help us who long, Most Youthful God, to riches.

verses.sanskrit: अषाळ्हो अग्ने वर्षभो दिदीहि पुरो विश्वाः सौभगा संजिगीवान यज्ञस्य नेता परथमस्य पायोर्जातवेदो बर्हतः सुप्रणीते |||
verses.transliteration: aṣāḷho aghne vṛṣabho didīhi puro viśvāḥ saubhaghā saṃjighīvān yajñasya netā prathamasya pāyorjātavedo bṛhataḥ supraṇīte

translations.griffith: Shine forth, a Bull invincible, O Agni, winning by conquest all the forts and treasures,  Thou Jātavedas who art skilled in guiding, the chief high saving sacrifice's Leader.

verses.sanskrit: अछिद्रा शर्म जरितः पुरूणि देवानछा दीद्यानः सुमेधाः रथो न सस्निरभि वक्षि वाजमगने तवं रोदसीनः सुमेके |||
verses.transliteration: achidrā śarma jaritaḥ purūṇi devānachā dīdyānaḥ sumedhāḥ ratho na sasnirabhi vakṣi vājamaghne tvaṃ rodasīnaḥ sumeke

translations.griffith: Lighting Gods hither, Agni, wisest Singer, bring thou to us many and flawless shelters.  Bring vigour, like a car that gathers booty: bring us, O Agni, beauteous Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit: पर पीपय वर्षभ जिन्व वाजानग्ने तवं रोदसी नः सुदोघे देवेभिर्देव सुरुचा रुचानो मा नो मर्तस्य दुर्मतिः परि षठात |||
verses.transliteration: pra pīpaya vṛṣabha jinva vājānaghne tvaṃ rodasī naḥ sudoghe devebhirdeva surucā rucāno mā no martasya durmatiḥ pari ṣṭhāt

translations.griffith: Swell, O thou Bull and give those powers an impulse, e’en Earth and Heaven who yield their milk in plenty,  Shining, O God, with Gods in clear effulgence. Let not a mortal's evil will obstruct us.

verses.transliteration: iḷāmaghne ...

translations.griffith: Agni, as holy food to thine invoker, give wealth in cattle, lasting, rich in marvels.  To us be born a son and spreading offspring. Agni, be this thy gracious will to us-ward.

verses.sanskrit: अयमग्निः सुवीर्यस्येशे महः सौभगस्य राय ईशे सवपत्यस्य गोमत ईशे वर्त्रहथानाम |||
verses.transliteration: ayamaghniḥ suvīryasyeśe mahaḥ saubhaghasya rāya īśe svapatyasya ghomata īśe vṛtrahathānām

translations.griffith: THIS Agni is the Lord of great felicity and hero Strength;  Lord of wealth in herds of kine; Lord of the battles with the foe.

verses.sanskrit: इमं नरो मरुतः सश्चता वर्धं यस्मिन रायः शेव्र्धासः अभि ये सन्ति पर्तनासु दूढ्यो विश्वाहा शत्रुमादभुः |||
verses.transliteration: imaṃ naro marutaḥ saścatā vṛdhaṃ yasmin rāyaḥ śevṛdhāsaḥ abhi ye santi pṛtanāsu dūḍhyo viśvāhā śatrumādabhuḥ

translations.griffith: Wait, Maruts, Heroes, upon him the Prosperer in whom is bliss-increasing wealth;  Who in fights ever conquer evil-hearted men, who overcome the enemy.

verses.sanskrit: स तवं नो रायः शिशीहि मीढ्वो अग्ने सुविर्यस्य तुविद्युम्न वर्षिष्ठस्य परजावतो.अनमीवस्य शुष्मिणः |||
verses.transliteration: sa tvaṃ no rāyaḥ śiśīhi mīḍhvo aghne suviryasya tuvidyumna varṣiṣṭhasya prajāvato.anamīvasya śuṣmiṇaḥ

translations.griffith: As such, O Agni, deal us wealth and hero might, O Bounteous One!  Most lofty, very glorious, rich in progeny, free from disease and full of power.

verses.sanskrit: चक्रिर्यो विश्वा भुवनाभि सासहिश्चक्रिर्देवेष्वा दुवः आ देवेषु यतत आ सुवीर्य आ शंस उत नर्णाम |||
verses.transliteration: cakriryo viśvā bhuvanābhi sāsahiścakrirdeveṣvā duvaḥ ā deveṣu yatata ā suvīrya ā śaṃsa uta nṛṇām

translations.griffith: He who made all that lives, who passes all in might, who orders service to the Gods,  He works among the Gods, he works in hero strength, yea, also in the praise of men.

verses.sanskrit: मा नो अग्ने.अमतये मावीरतायै रीरधः मागोतायै सहसस पुत्र मा निदे.अप दवेषांस्या कर्धि |||
verses.transliteration: mā no aghne.amataye māvīratāyai rīradhaḥ māghotāyai sahasas putra mā nide.apa dveṣāṃsyā kṛdhi

translations.griffith: Give us not up to indigence, Agni, nor want of hero sons,  Nor, Son of Strength, to lack of cattle, nor to blame. Drive. thou our enemies away.

verses.sanskrit: शग्धि वाजस्य सुभग परजावतो.अग्ने बर्हतो अध्वरे संराया भूयसा सर्ज मयोभुना तुविद्युम्न यशस्वता |||
verses.transliteration: śaghdhi vājasya subhagha prajāvato.aghne bṛhato adhvare saṃrāyā bhūyasā sṛja mayobhunā tuvidyumna yaśasvatā

translations.griffith: Help us to strength, blest Agni! rich in progeny, abundant, in our sacrifice.  Flood us with riches yet more plenteous, bringing weal, with high renown, most Glorious One!

verses.sanskrit: समिध्यमानः परथमानु धर्मा समक्तुभिरज्यते विश्ववारः शोचिष्केशो घर्तनिर्णिक पावकः सुयज्ञो अग्निर्यजथाय देवान |||
verses.transliteration: samidhyamānaḥ prathamānu dharmā samaktubhirajyate viśvavāraḥ śociṣkeśo ghṛtanirṇik pāvakaḥ suyajño aghniryajathāya devān

translations.griffith: DULY enkindled after ancient customs, bringing all treasures, he is balmed with unguents,—  Flame-haired, oil-clad, the purifying Agni, skilled in fair rites, to bring the Gods for worship.

verses.sanskrit: यथायजो होत्रमग्ने पर्थिव्या यथा दिवो जातवेदश्चिकित्वान एवानेन हविषा यक्षि देवान मनुष्वद यज्ञं पर तिरेममद्य |||
verses.transliteration: yathāyajo hotramaghne pṛthivyā yathā divo jātavedaścikitvān evānena haviṣā yakṣi devān manuṣvad yajñaṃ pra tiremamadya

translations.griffith: As thou, O Agni, skilful Jātavedas, hast sacrificed as Priest of Earth, of Heaven,  So with this offering bring the Gods, and prosper this sacrifice today as erst for Manu.

verses.sanskrit: तरीण्यायूंषि तव जातवेदस्तिस्र आजानीरुषसस्ते अग्ने ताभिर्देवानामवो यक्षि विद्वानथा भव यजमानाय शं योः |||
verses.transliteration: trīṇyāyūṃṣi tava jātavedastisra ājānīruṣasaste aghne tābhirdevānāmavo yakṣi vidvānathā bhava yajamānāya śaṃ yoḥ

translations.griffith: Three are thy times of life, O Jātavedas, and the three mornings are thy births, O Agni.  With these, well-knowing, grant the Gods’ kind favour, and help in stir and stress the man who worships.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निं सुदीतिं सुद्र्शं गर्णन्तो नमस्यामस्त्वेड्यं जातवेदः तवां दूतमरतिं हव्यवाहं देवा अक्र्ण्वन्नम्र्तस्य नाभिम |||
verses.transliteration: aghniṃ sudītiṃ sudṛśaṃ ghṛṇanto namasyāmastveḍyaṃ jātavedaḥ tvāṃ dūtamaratiṃ havyavāhaṃ devā akṛṇvannamṛtasya nābhim

translations.griffith: Agni most bright and fair with song we honour, yea, the adorable, O Jātavedas.  Thee, envoy, messenger, oblation-bearer, the Gods have made centre of life eternal.

verses.sanskrit: यस्त्वद धोता पूर्वो अग्ने यजीयान दविता च सत्ता सवधया च शम्भुः तस्यानु धर्म पर यजा चिकित्वो.अथ नो धा अध्वरं देववीतौ ||
verses.transliteration: yastvad dhotā pūrvo aghne yajīyān dvitā ca sattā svadhayā ca śambhuḥ tasyānu dharma pra yajā cikitvo.atha no dhā adhvaraṃ devavītau

translations.griffith: That Priest before thee, yet more skilled in worship, stablished of old, health-giver by his nature,—  After his custom offer, thou who knowest, and lay our sacrifice where Gods may taste it.

verses.sanskrit: भवा नो अग्ने सुमना उपेतौ सखेव सख्ये पितरेव साधुः पुरुद्रुहो हि कषितयो जनानां परति परतीचीर्दहतादरातीः |||
verses.transliteration: bhavā no aghne sumanā upetau sakheva sakhye pitareva sādhuḥ purudruho hi kṣitayo janānāṃ prati pratīcīrdahatādarātīḥ

translations.griffith: AGNI, be kind to us when we approach thee good as a friend to friend, as sire and mother.  The races of mankind are great oppressors burn up malignity that strives against us.

verses.sanskrit: तपो शवग्ने अन्तरानमित्रान तपा शंसमररुषः परस्य तपो वसो चिकितानो अचित्तान वि ते तिष्ठन्तामजरा अयासः |||
verses.transliteration: tapo śvaghne antarānamitrān tapā śaṃsamararuṣaḥ parasya tapo vaso cikitāno acittān vi te tiṣṭhantāmajarā ayāsaḥ

translations.griffith: Agni, burn up the unfriendly who are near us, burn thou the foeman's curse who pays no worship.  Burn, Vasu, thou who markest well, the foolish: let thine eternal nimble beams surround thee.

verses.sanskrit: इध्मेनाग्न इछमानो घर्तेन जुहोमि हव्यं तरसे बलाय यावदीशे बरह्मणा वन्दमान इमां धियं शतसेयाय देवीम |||
verses.transliteration: idhmenāghna ichamāno ghṛtena juhomi havyaṃ tarase balāya yāvadīśe brahmaṇā vandamāna imāṃ dhiyaṃ śataseyāya devīm

translations.griffith: With fuel, Agni, and with oil, desirous, mine offering I present for strength and conquest,  With prayer, so far as I have power, adoring-this hymn divine to gain a hundred treasures.

verses.sanskrit: उच्छोचिषा सहसस पुत्र सतुतो बर्हद वयः शशमानेषु धेहि रेवदग्ने विश्वामित्रेषु शं योर्मर्म्र्ज्मा ते तन्वं भूरि कर्त्वः |||
verses.transliteration: ucchociṣā sahasas putra stuto bṛhad vayaḥ śaśamāneṣu dhehi revadaghne viśvāmitreṣu śaṃ yormarmṛjmā te tanvaṃ bhūri kṛtvaḥ

translations.griffith: Give with thy glow, thou Son of Strength, when lauded, great vital power to those who toil to serve thee.  Give richly, Agni, to the Viśvāmitras in rest and stir. Oft have we decked thy body.

verses.sanskrit: कर्धि रत्नं सुसनितर्धनानां स घेदग्ने भवसि यत समिद्धः सतोतुर्दुरोणे सुभगस्य रेवत सर्प्रा करस्ना दधिषे वपूंषि |||
verses.transliteration: kṛdhi ratnaṃ susanitardhanānāṃ sa ghedaghne bhavasi yat samiddhaḥ stoturduroṇe subhaghasya revat sṛprā karasnā dadhiṣe vapūṃṣi

translations.griffith: Give us, O liberal Lord, great store of riches, for, Agni, such art thou when duly kindled.  Thou in the happy singer's home bestowest, amply with arms extended, things of beauty.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निं होतारं पर वर्णे मियेधे गर्त्सं कविं विश्वविदममूरम स नो यक्षद देवताता यजीयान राये वाजाय वनतेमघानि |||
verses.transliteration: aghniṃ hotāraṃ pra vṛṇe miyedhe ghṛtsaṃ kaviṃ viśvavidamamūram sa no yakṣad devatātā yajīyān rāye vājāya vanatemaghāni

translations.griffith: AGNI, quick, sage, infallible, all-knowing, I choose to be our Priest at this oblation.  In our Gods’ service he, best skilled, shall worship: may he obtain us boons for strength and riches.

verses.sanskrit: पर ते अग्ने हविष्मतीमियर्म्यछा सुद्युम्नां रातिनीं घर्ताचीम परदक्षिणिद देवतातिमुराणः सं रातिभिर्वसुभिर्यज्ञमश्रेत |||
verses.transliteration: pra te aghne haviṣmatīmiyarmyachā sudyumnāṃ rātinīṃ ghṛtācīm pradakṣiṇid devatātimurāṇaḥ saṃ rātibhirvasubhiryajñamaśret

translations.griffith: Agni, to thee I lift the oil-fed ladle, bright, with an offering, bearing our oblation.  From the right hand, choosing the Gods’ attendance, he with rich presents hath arranged the worship.

verses.sanskrit: स तेजीयसा मनसा तवोत उत शिक्ष सवपत्यस्य शिक्षोः अग्ने रायो नर्तमस्य परभूतौ भूयाम ते सुष्टुतयश्च वस्वः |||
verses.transliteration: sa tejīyasā manasā tvota uta śikṣa svapatyasya śikṣoḥ aghne rāyo nṛtamasya prabhūtau bhūyāma te suṣṭutayaśca vasvaḥ

translations.griffith: Of keenest spirit is the man thou aidest give us good offspring, thou who givest freely.  In power of wealth most rich in men. O Agni, of thee, the Good, may we sing forth fair praises.

verses.sanskrit: भूरीणि हि तवे दधिरे अनीकाग्ने देवस्य यज्यवो जनासः स आ वह देवतातिं यविष्ठ शर्धो यदद्य दिव्यंयजासि |||
verses.transliteration: bhūrīṇi hi tve dadhire anīkāghne devasya yajyavo janāsaḥ sa ā vaha devatātiṃ yaviṣṭha śardho yadadya divyaṃyajāsi

translations.griffith: Men as they worship thee the God, O Agni, have set on thee full many a brilliant, aspect.  So bring Most Youthful One, the Gods’ assembly, the Heavenly Host which thou to-day shalt honour.

verses.sanskrit: यत तवा होतारमनजन मियेधे निषादयन्तो यजथाय देवाः स तवं नो अग्ने.अवितेह बोध्यधि शरवांसि धेहि नस्तनूषु |||
