verses.transliteration: yat tvā hotāramanajan miyedhe niṣādayanto yajathāya devāḥ sa tvaṃ no aghne.aviteha bodhyadhi śravāṃsi dhehi nastanūṣu

translations.griffith: When Gods anoint thee Priest at their oblation, and seat thee for thy task as Sacrificer,  O Agni, be thou here our kind defender, and to ourselves vouchsafe the gift of glory.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निमुषसमश्विना दधिक्रां वयुष्टिषु हवते वह्निरुक्थैः सुज्योतिषो नः शर्ण्वन्तु देवाः सजोषसो अध्वरं वावशानाः |||
verses.transliteration: aghnimuṣasamaśvinā dadhikrāṃ vyuṣṭiṣu havate vahnirukthaiḥ sujyotiṣo naḥ śṛṇvantu devāḥ sajoṣaso adhvaraṃ vāvaśānāḥ

translations.griffith: WITH lauds at break of morn the priest invoketh Agni, Dawn, Dadhikrās, and both the Aśvins.  With one consent the Gods whose light is splendid, longing to taste our sacrifice, shall hear us.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने तरी ते वाजिना तरी षधस्था तिस्रस्ते जिह्वा रतजात पूर्वीः तिस्र उ ते तन्वो देववातास्ताभिर्नः पाहि गिरो अप्रयुछन |||
verses.transliteration: aghne trī te vājinā trī ṣadhasthā tisraste jihvā ṛtajāta pūrvīḥ tisra u te tanvo devavātāstābhirnaḥ pāhi ghiro aprayuchan

translations.griffith: Three are thy powers, O Agni, three thy stations, three are thy tongues, yea, many, Child of Order!  Three bodies hast thou which the Gods delight in: with these protect our hymns with care unceasing.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने भूरीणि तव जातवेदो देव सवधावो.अम्र्तस्य नाम याश्च माया मायिनां विश्वमिन्व तवे पूर्वीः सन्दधुःप्र्ष्टबन्धो |||
verses.transliteration: aghne bhūrīṇi tava jātavedo deva svadhāvo.amṛtasya nāma yāśca māyā māyināṃ viśvaminva tve pūrvīḥ sandadhuḥpṛṣṭabandho

translations.griffith: O Agni, many are the names thou bearest, immortal, God, Divine, and Jātavedas.  And many charms of charmers, All-Inspirer! have they laid in thee, Lord of true attendants!

verses.sanskrit: अग्निर्नेता भग इव कषितीनां दैवीनां देव रतुपा रतावा स वर्त्रहा सनयो विश्ववेदाः पर्षद विश्वाति दुरिता गर्णन्तम |||
verses.transliteration: aghnirnetā bhagha iva kṣitīnāṃ daivīnāṃ deva ṛtupā ṛtāvā sa vṛtrahā sanayo viśvavedāḥ parṣad viśvāti duritā ghṛṇantam

translations.griffith: Agni, like Bhaga, leads the godly people, he who is true to Law and guards the seasons.  Ancient, all-knowing, he the Vṛtra-slayer shall bear the singer safe through every trouble.

verses.sanskrit: ददहिक्रामग्निमुषसं च देवीं बर्हस्पतिं सवितारं चदेवम अश्विना मित्रावरुणा भगं च वसून रुद्रानादित्यानिह हुवे |||
verses.transliteration: dadahikrāmaghnimuṣasaṃ ca devīṃ bṛhaspatiṃ savitāraṃ cadevam aśvinā mitrāvaruṇā bhaghaṃ ca vasūn rudrānādityāniha huve

translations.griffith: I call on Savitar the God, on Morning, Bṛhaspati, and Dadhikrās, and Agni,  On Varuṇa and Mitra, on the Aśvins, Bhaga, the Vasus, Rudras and Ādityas.

verses.sanskrit: इमं नो यज्ञमम्र्तेषु धेहीमा हव्या जातवेदो जुषस्व सतोकानामग्ने मेदसो घर्तस्य होतः पराशान परथमो निषद्य |||
verses.transliteration: imaṃ no yajñamamṛteṣu dhehīmā havyā jātavedo juṣasva stokānāmaghne medaso ghṛtasya hotaḥ prāśāna prathamo niṣadya

translations.griffith: SET this our sacrifice among the Immortals: be pleased with these our presents, Jātavedas.  O Priest, O Agni, sit thee down before us, and first enjoy the drops of oil and fatness.

verses.sanskrit: घर्तवन्तः पावक ते सतोका शचोतन्ति मेदसः सवधर्मन देववीतये शरेष्ठं नो धेहि वार्यम |||
verses.transliteration: ghṛtavantaḥ pāvaka te stokā ścotanti medasaḥ svadharman devavītaye śreṣṭhaṃ no dhehi vāryam

translations.griffith: For thee, O Purifier, flow the drops of fatness rich in oil.  After thy wont vouchsafe to us the choicest boon that Gods may feast.

verses.sanskrit: तुभ्यं सतोका घर्तश्चुतो.अग्ने विप्राय सन्त्य रषिः शरेष्ठः समिध्यसे यज्ञस्य पराविता भव |||
verses.transliteration: tubhyaṃ stokā ghṛtaścuto.aghne viprāya santya ṛṣiḥ śreṣṭhaḥ samidhyase yajñasya prāvitā bhava

translations.griffith: Agni, Most Excellent! for thee the Sage are drops that drip with oil.  Thou art enkindled as the best of Seers. Help thou the sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: तुभ्यं शचोतन्त्यध्रिगो शचीव सतोकासो अग्ने मेदसो घर्तस्य कविशस्तो बर्हता भानुनागा हव्या जुषस्व मेधिर |||
verses.transliteration: tubhyaṃ ścotantyadhrigho śacīva stokāso aghne medaso ghṛtasya kaviśasto bṛhatā bhānunāghā havyā juṣasva medhira

translations.griffith: To thee, O Agni, mighty and resistless, to thee stream forth the drops of oil and fatness.  With great light art thou come, O praised by poets! Accept our offering, O thou Sage.

verses.sanskrit: ओजिष्ठं ते मध्यतो मेद उद्भ्र्तं पर ते वयं ददामहे शचोतन्ति ते वसो सतोका अधि तवचि परति तान देवशो विहि |||
verses.transliteration: ojiṣṭhaṃ te madhyato meda udbhṛtaṃ pra te vayaṃ dadāmahe ścotanti te vaso stokā adhi tvaci prati tān devaśo vihi

translations.griffith: Fatness exceeding rich, extracted from the midst,—this as our gift we offer thee.  Excellent God, the drops run down upon thy skin. Deal them to each among the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: अयं सो अग्निर्यस्मिन सोममिन्द्रः सुतं दधे जठरे वावशानः सहस्रिणं वाजमत्यं न सप्तिं ससवान सन सतूयसे जातवेदः |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ so aghniryasmin somamindraḥ sutaṃ dadhe jaṭhare vāvaśānaḥ sahasriṇaṃ vājamatyaṃ na saptiṃ sasavān san stūyase jātavedaḥ

translations.griffith: THIS is that Agni whence the longing Indra took the pressed Soma deep within his body.  Winner of spoils in thousands, like a courser, with praise art thou exalted, Jātavedas.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने यत ते दिवि वर्चः पर्थिव्यां यदोषधीष्वप्स्वा यजत्र येनान्तरिक्षमुर्वाततन्थ तवेषः स भानुरर्णवो नर्चक्षाः |||
verses.transliteration: aghne yat te divi varcaḥ pṛthivyāṃ yadoṣadhīṣvapsvā yajatra yenāntarikṣamurvātatantha tveṣaḥ sa bhānurarṇavo nṛcakṣāḥ

translations.griffith: That light of thine in heaven and earth, O Agni, in plants, O Holy One, and in the waters,  Wherewith thou hast spread wide the air's mid-region-bright is that splendour, wavy, man-beholding.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने दिवो अर्णमछा जिगास्यछा देवानूचिषे धिष्ण्याये या रोचने परस्तात सूर्यस्य याश्चावस्तादुपतिष्ठण्त आपः |||
verses.transliteration: aghne divo arṇamachā jighāsyachā devānūciṣe dhiṣṇyāye yā rocane parastāt sūryasya yāścāvastādupatiṣṭhaṇta āpaḥ

translations.griffith: O Agni, to the sea of heaven thou goest: thou hast called hither Gods beheld in spirit.  The waters, too, come hither, those up yonder in the Sun's realm of light, and those beneath it.

verses.sanskrit: पुरीष्यासो अग्नयः परावणेभिः सजोषसः जुषन्तां यज्ञमद्रुहो.अनमीवा इषो महीः |||
verses.transliteration: purīṣyāso aghnayaḥ prāvaṇebhiḥ sajoṣasaḥ juṣantāṃ yajñamadruho.anamīvā iṣo mahīḥ

translations.griffith: Let fires that dwell in mist, combined with those that have their home in floods,  Guileless accept our sacrifice, great viands free from all disease.

verses.transliteration: iḷāmaghne ...

translations.griffith: Agni, as holy food to thine invoker give wealth in cattle, lasting, rich in marvels.  To us be born a son and spreading offspring. Agni, be this thy gracious will to us-ward.

verses.sanskrit: निर्मथितः सुधित आ सधस्थे युवा कविरध्वरस्य परणेता जूर्यत्स्वग्निरजरो वनेष्वत्रा दधे अम्र्तं जातवेदाः |||
verses.transliteration: nirmathitaḥ sudhita ā sadhasthe yuvā kaviradhvarasya praṇetā jūryatsvaghnirajaro vaneṣvatrā dadhe amṛtaṃ jātavedāḥ

translations.griffith: RUBBED into life, well stablished in the dwelling, Leader of sacrifice, the Sage, the youthful,  Here in the wasting fuel Jātavedas, eternal, hath assumed immortal being.

verses.sanskrit: अमन्थिष्टां भारता रेवदग्निं देवश्रवा देववातः सुदक्षम अग्ने वि पश्य बर्हताभि रायेषां नो नेता भवतादनु दयून |||
verses.transliteration: amanthiṣṭāṃ bhāratā revadaghniṃ devaśravā devavātaḥ sudakṣam aghne vi paśya bṛhatābhi rāyeṣāṃ no netā bhavatādanu dyūn

translations.griffith: Both Bharatas, Devaśravas, Devāvata, have strongly rubbed to life effectual Agni.  O Agni, look thou forth with ample riches: be, every day, bearer of food to feed us.

verses.sanskrit: दश कषिपः पूर्व्यं सीमजीजनन सुजातं मात्र्षु परियम अग्निं सतुहि दैववातं देवश्रवो यो जनानामसद वशी |||
verses.transliteration: daśa kṣipaḥ pūrvyaṃ sīmajījanan sujātaṃ mātṛṣu priyam aghniṃ stuhi daivavātaṃ devaśravo yo janānāmasad vaśī

translations.griffith: Him nobly born of old the fingers ten produced, him whom his Mothers counted dear.  Praise Devāvata's Agni, thou Devaśravas, him who shall be the people's Lord.

verses.sanskrit: नि तवा दधे वर आ पर्थिव्या इळायास पदे सुदिनत्वे अह्नाम दर्षद्वत्यां मानुष आपयायां सरस्वत्यां रेवदग्नेदिदीहि |||
verses.transliteration: ni tvā dadhe vara ā pṛthivyā iḷāyās pade sudinatve ahnām dṛṣadvatyāṃ mānuṣa āpayāyāṃ sarasvatyāṃ revadaghnedidīhi

translations.griffith: He set thee in the earth's most lovely station, in Iḷā's place, in days of fair bright weather.  On man, on Āpayā, Agni! on the rivers Dṛṣadvati, Sarasvatī, shine richly.

verses.transliteration: iḷāmaghne ...

translations.griffith: Agni, as holy food to thine invoker give wealth in cattle, lasting, rich in marvels.  To us be born a son and spreading offspring Agni, be this thy gracious will to us-ward

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने सहस्व पर्तना अभिमातीरपास्य दुष्टरस्तरन्नरातीर्वर्चो धा यज्ञवाहसे |||
verses.transliteration: aghne sahasva pṛtanā abhimātīrapāsya duṣṭarastarannarātīrvarco dhā yajñavāhase

translations.griffith: AGNI, subdue opposing bands, and drive our enemies away.  Invincible, slay godless foes: give splendour to the worshipper.

verses.sanskrit: अग्न इळा समिध्यसे वीतिहोत्रो अमर्त्यः जुषस्व सू नो अध्वरम |||
verses.transliteration: aghna iḷā samidhyase vītihotro amartyaḥ juṣasva sū no adhvaram

translations.griffith: Lit with libation, Agni, thou, deathless, who callest Gods to feast,  Accept our sacrifice with joy.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने दयुम्नेन जाग्र्वे सहसः सूनवाहुत एदं बर्हिः सदो |||
verses.transliteration: aghne dyumnena jāghṛve sahasaḥ sūnavāhuta edaṃ barhiḥ sado

translations.griffith: With splendour, Agni, Son of Strength, thou who art worshipped, wakeful One.  Seat thee on this my sacred grass.

verses.sanskrit: मम ||
verses.transliteration: mama

translations.griffith: With all thy fires, with all the Gods, Agni, exalt the songs we sing.  And living men in holy rites.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने विश्वेभिरग्निभिर्देवेभिर्महया गिरः यज्ञेषु यौ चायवः |||
verses.transliteration: aghne viśvebhiraghnibhirdevebhirmahayā ghiraḥ yajñeṣu yau cāyavaḥ

translations.griffith: Grant, Agni, to the worshipper wealth rich in heroes, plenteous store,  Make thou us rich with many sons.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने दा दाशुषे रयिं वीरवन्तं परीणसम शिशीहि नः सूनुमतः |||
verses.transliteration: aghne dā dāśuṣe rayiṃ vīravantaṃ parīṇasam śiśīhi naḥ sūnumataḥ

translations.griffith: Missing Line From Griffith.

verses.sanskrit: अगने दिवः सूनुरसि परचेतास्तना पर्थिव्या उत विश्ववेदाः रधग देवानिह यजा चिकित्वः |||
verses.transliteration: aghne divaḥ sūnurasi pracetāstanā pṛthivyā uta viśvavedāḥ ṛdhagh devāniha yajā cikitvaḥ

translations.griffith: THOU art the sapient Son of Dyaus, O Agni, yes and the Child of Earth, who knowest all things.  Bring the Gods specially, thou Sage, for worship.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निः सनोति वीर्याणि विद्वान सनोति वाजमम्र्ताय भूषन स नो देवानेह वहा पुरुक्षो |||
verses.transliteration: aghniḥ sanoti vīryāṇi vidvān sanoti vājamamṛtāya bhūṣan sa no devāneha vahā purukṣo

translations.griffith: Agni the wise bestows the might of heroes grants strengthening food, preparing it for nectar.  Thou who art rich in food bring the Gods hither.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निर्द्यावाप्र्थिवी विश्वजन्ये आ भाति देवी अम्र्ते अमूरः कषयन वाजैः पुरुश्चन्द्रो नमोभिः |||
verses.transliteration: aghnirdyāvāpṛthivī viśvajanye ā bhāti devī amṛte amūraḥ kṣayan vājaiḥ puruścandro namobhiḥ

translations.griffith: Agni, infallible, lights Earth and Heaven, immortal Goddesses gracious to all men,—  Lord through his strength, splendid through adorations.

verses.sanskrit: अग्न इन्द्रश्च दाशुषो दुरोने सुतावतो यज्ञमिहोप यातम अमर्धन्ता सोमपेयाय देवा |||
verses.transliteration: aghna indraśca dāśuṣo durone sutāvato yajñamihopa yātam amardhantā somapeyāya devā

translations.griffith: Come to the sacrifice, Agni and Indra come to the offerer's house who hath the Soma.  Come, friendly-minded, Gods, to drink the Soma.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने अपां समिध्यसे दुरोणे नित्यः सूनो सहसो जातवेदः सधस्थानि महयमान ऊती |||
verses.transliteration: aghne apāṃ samidhyase duroṇe nityaḥ sūno sahaso jātavedaḥ sadhasthāni mahayamāna ūtī

translations.griffith: In the floods' home art thou enkindled, Agni, O Jātavedas, Son of Strength, eternal,  Exalting with thine help the gathering-places.

verses.sanskrit: वैश्वानरं मनसाग्निं निचाय्या हविष्मन्तो अनुषत्यं सवर्विदम सुदानुं देवं रथिरं वसूयवो गीर्भी रण्वंकुशिकासो हवामहे |||
verses.transliteration: vaiśvānaraṃ manasāghniṃ nicāyyā haviṣmanto anuṣatyaṃ svarvidam sudānuṃ devaṃ rathiraṃ vasūyavo ghīrbhī raṇvaṃkuśikāso havāmahe

translations.griffith: REVERING in our heart Agni Vaiśvānara, the finder of the light, whose promises are true,  The liberal, gladsome, car-borne God we Kuśikas invoke him with oblation, seeking wealth with songs.

verses.sanskrit: तं शुभ्रमग्निमवसे हवामहे वैश्वानरं मातरिश्वानमुक्थ्यम बर्हस्पतिं मनुषो देवतातये विप्रं शरोतारमतिथिं रघुष्यदम |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ śubhramaghnimavase havāmahe vaiśvānaraṃ mātariśvānamukthyam bṛhaspatiṃ manuṣo devatātaye vipraṃ śrotāramatithiṃ raghuṣyadam

translations.griffith: That Agni, bright, Vaiśvānara, we invoke for help, and Mātariśvan worthy of the song of praise;  Bṛhaspati for man's observance of the Gods, the Singer prompt to hear, the swiftly-moving guest.

verses.sanskrit: अश्वो न करन्दञ जनिभिः समिध्यते वैश्वानरः कुशिकेभिर्युगे-युगे स नो अग्निः सुवीर्यं सवश्व्यं दधातु रत्नमम्र्तेषु जाग्र्विः |||
verses.transliteration: aśvo na krandañ janibhiḥ samidhyate vaiśvānaraḥ kuśikebhiryughe-yughe sa no aghniḥ suvīryaṃ svaśvyaṃ dadhātu ratnamamṛteṣu jāghṛviḥ

translations.griffith: Age after age Vaiśvānara, neighing like a horse, is kindled with the women by the Kuśikas.  May Agni, he who wakes among Immortal Gods, grant us heroic strength and wealth in noble steeds.

verses.sanskrit: पर यन्तु वाजास्तविषीभिरग्नयः शुभे सम्मिष्लाः पर्षतीरयुक्षत बर्हदुक्षो मरुतो विश्ववेदसः पर वेपयन्तिपर्वतानदाभ्याः |||
verses.transliteration: pra yantu vājāstaviṣībhiraghnayaḥ śubhe sammiṣlāḥ pṛṣatīrayukṣata bṛhadukṣo maruto viśvavedasaḥ pra vepayantiparvatānadābhyāḥ

translations.griffith: Let them go forth, the strong, as flames of fire with might. Gathered for victory they have yoked their spotted deer.  Pourers of floods, the Maruts, Masters of all wealth, they who can ne’er be conquered, make the mountains shake.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निश्रियो मरुतो विश्वक्र्ष्टय आ तवेषमुग्रमव ईमहे वयम ते सवानिनो रुद्रिया वर्षनिर्णिजः सिंहा न हेषक्रतवः सुदानवः |||
verses.transliteration: aghniśriyo maruto viśvakṛṣṭaya ā tveṣamughramava īmahe vayam te svānino rudriyā varṣanirṇijaḥ siṃhā na heṣakratavaḥ sudānavaḥ

translations.griffith: The Maruts, Friends of men, are glorious as the fire: their mighty and resplendent succour we implore.  Those storming Sons of Rudra clothed in robes of rain, boon-givers of good gifts, roar as the lions roar.

verses.sanskrit: वरातं-वरातं गणं-गणं सुशस्तिभिरग्नेर्भामं मरुतामोज ईमहे पर्षदश्वासो अनवभ्रराधसो गन्तारो यज्ञं विदथेषु धीराः |||
verses.transliteration: vrātaṃ-vrātaṃ ghaṇaṃ-ghaṇaṃ suśastibhiraghnerbhāmaṃ marutāmoja īmahe pṛṣadaśvāso anavabhrarādhaso ghantāro yajñaṃ vidatheṣu dhīrāḥ

translations.griffith: We, band on band and troop following troop, entreat with fair lauds Agni's splendour and the Maruts’ might,  With spotted deer for steeds, with wealth that never fails, they, wise Ones, come to sacrifice at our gatherings.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निरस्मि जन्मना जातवेदा घर्तं मे चक्षुरम्र्तं म आसन अर्कस्त्रिधातू रजसो विमानो.अजस्रो घर्मो हविरस्मि नाम |||
verses.transliteration: aghnirasmi janmanā jātavedā ghṛtaṃ me cakṣuramṛtaṃ ma āsan arkastridhātū rajaso vimāno.ajasro gharmo havirasmi nāma

translations.griffith: Agni am I who know, by birth, all creatures. Mine eye is butter, in my mouth is nectar.  I am light threefold, measurer of the region exhaustless heat am I, named burnt-oblation.

verses.sanskrit: तरिभिः पवित्रैरपुपोद धयर्कं हर्दा मतिं जयोतिरनु परजानन वर्षिष्ठं रत्नमक्र्त सवधाभिरादिद दयावाप्र्थिवी पर्यपश्यत |||
verses.transliteration: tribhiḥ pavitrairapupod dhyarkaṃ hṛdā matiṃ jyotiranu prajānan varṣiṣṭhaṃ ratnamakṛta svadhābhirādid dyāvāpṛthivī paryapaśyat

translations.griffith: Bearing in mind a thought with light accordant, he purified the Sun with three refinings;  By his own nature gained the highest treasure, and looked abroad over the earth and heaven.

verses.sanskrit: शतधारमुत्समक्षीयमाणं विपश्चितं पितरं वक्त्वानाम मेळिं मदन्तं पित्रोरुपस्थे तं रोदसी पिप्र्तं सत्यवाचम |||
verses.transliteration: śatadhāramutsamakṣīyamāṇaṃ vipaścitaṃ pitaraṃ vaktvānām meḷiṃ madantaṃ pitrorupasthe taṃ rodasī pipṛtaṃ satyavācam

translations.griffith: The Spring that fails not with a hundred streamlets, Father inspired of prayers that men should utter,  The Sparkler, joyous in his Parents' bosorn, -him, the Truth-speaker, sate ye, Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit: पर वो वाजा अभिद्यवो हविष्मन्तो घर्ताच्या देवाञ जिगातिसुम्नयुः |||
verses.transliteration: pra vo vājā abhidyavo haviṣmanto ghṛtācyā devāñ jighātisumnayuḥ

translations.griffith: IN ladle dropping oil your food goes in oblation up to heaven,  Goes to the Gods in search of bliss.

verses.sanskrit: ईळे अग्निं विपश्चितं गिरा यज्ञस्य साधनम शरुष्टीवानं धितावानम |||
verses.transliteration: īḷe aghniṃ vipaścitaṃ ghirā yajñasya sādhanam śruṣṭīvānaṃ dhitāvānam

translations.griffith: Agni I laud, the Sage inspired, crowner of sacrifice through song,  Who listens and gives bounteous gifts.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने शकेम ते वयं यमं देवस्य वाजिनः अति दवेषांसि तरेम |||
verses.transliteration: aghne śakema te vayaṃ yamaṃ devasya vājinaḥ ati dveṣāṃsi tarema

translations.griffith: O Agni, if we might obtain control of thee the potent God,  Then should we overcome our foes.

verses.sanskrit: समिध्यमानो अध्वरे.अग्निः पावक ईड्यः शोचिष्केशस्तमीमहे |||
verses.transliteration: samidhyamāno adhvare.aghniḥ pāvaka īḍyaḥ śociṣkeśastamīmahe

translations.griffith: Kindled at sacrifices he is Agni, hallower, meet for praise,  With flame for hair: to him we seek.

verses.sanskrit: पर्थुपाजा अमर्त्यो घर्तनिर्णिक सवाहुतः अग्निर्यज्ञस्य हव्यवाट |||
verses.transliteration: pṛthupājā amartyo ghṛtanirṇik svāhutaḥ aghniryajñasya havyavāṭ

translations.griffith: Immortal Agni, shining far, enrobed with oil, well worshipped, bears  The gifts of sacrifice away.

verses.sanskrit: तं सबाधो यतस्रुच इत्था धिया यज्ञवन्तः आ चक्रुरग्निमूतये |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ sabādho yatasruca itthā dhiyā yajñavantaḥ ā cakruraghnimūtaye

translations.griffith: The priests with ladles lifted up, worshipping here with holy thought,  Have brought this Agni for our aid.

verses.sanskrit: होता देवो अमर्त्यः पुरस्तादेति मायया विदथानि परचोदयन |||
verses.transliteration: hotā devo amartyaḥ purastādeti māyayā vidathāni pracodayan

translations.griffith: Immortal, Sacrificer, God, with wondrous power he leads the way,  Urging the great assembly on.

verses.sanskrit: वाजी वाजेषु धीयते.अध्वरेषु पर णीयते विप्रो यज्ञस्य साधनः |||
verses.transliteration: vājī vājeṣu dhīyate.adhvareṣu pra ṇīyate vipro yajñasya sādhanaḥ

translations.griffith: Strong, he is set on deeds ofstrength. In sacrifices led in front,  As Singer he completes the rite.

verses.sanskrit: धिया चक्रे वरेण्यो भूतानां गर्भमा दधे दक्षस्यपितरं तना |||
verses.transliteration: dhiyā cakre vareṇyo bhūtānāṃ gharbhamā dadhe dakṣasyapitaraṃ tanā

translations.griffith: Excellent, he was made by thought. The Germ of beings have I gained,  Yea, and die Sire of active strength.

verses.sanskrit: नि तवा दधे वरेण्यं दक्षस्येळा सहस्क्र्त अग्ने सुदीतिमुशिजम |||
verses.transliteration: ni tvā dadhe vareṇyaṃ dakṣasyeḷā sahaskṛta aghne sudītimuśijam

translations.griffith: Thee have I stablished, Excellent, O strengthened by the sage's prayer,  Thee, Agni, longing, nobly bright.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निं यन्तुरमप्तुरं रतस्य योगे वनुषः विप्रा वाजैः समिन्धते |||
verses.transliteration: aghniṃ yanturamapturaṃ ṛtasya yoghe vanuṣaḥ viprā vājaiḥ samindhate

translations.griffith: Agni, the swift and active One, singers, at time of sacrifice,  Eagerly kindle with their food.

verses.sanskrit: ऊर्जो नपातमध्वरे दीदिवांसमुप दयवि अग्निमीळे कविक्रतुम |||
verses.transliteration: ūrjo napātamadhvare dīdivāṃsamupa dyavi aghnimīḷe kavikratum

translations.griffith: Agni the Son of Strength who shines up to the heaven in solemn rites,  The wise of heart, I glorify.

verses.sanskrit: ईळेन्यो नमस्यस्तिरस्तमांसि दर्शतः समग्निरिध्यत |||
verses.transliteration: īḷenyo namasyastirastamāṃsi darśataḥ samaghniridhyat

translations.griffith: Meet to be lauded and adored, showing in beauty through the dark,  Agni, the Strong, is kindled well.

verses.sanskrit: ए वर्षा ||
verses.transliteration: e vṛṣā

translations.griffith: Agni is kindled as a bull, like a horsebearer of the Gods:  Men with oblations worship him.

verses.sanskrit: वर्षो अग्निः समिध्यते.अश्वो न देववाहनः तं हविष्मन्त ईळते |||
verses.transliteration: vṛṣo aghniḥ samidhyate.aśvo na devavāhanaḥ taṃ haviṣmanta īḷate

translations.griffith: Thee will we kindle as a bull, we who are Bulls ourselves, O Bull.  Thee, Agni, shining mightily.

verses.sanskrit: वर्षणं तवा वयं वर्षन वर्षणः समिधीमहि अग्ने दीद्यतं बर्हत |||
verses.transliteration: vṛṣaṇaṃ tvā vayaṃ vṛṣan vṛṣaṇaḥ samidhīmahi aghne dīdyataṃ bṛhat

translations.griffith: Missing line from Griffith.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने जुषस्व नो हविः पुरोळाशं जातवेदः परातःसावेधियावसो |||
verses.transliteration: aghne juṣasva no haviḥ puroḷāśaṃ jātavedaḥ prātaḥsāvedhiyāvaso

translations.griffith: AGNI who knowest all, accept our offering and the cake of meal,  At dawn's libation, rich in prayer!

verses.sanskrit: पुरोळा अग्ने पचतस्तुभ्यं वा घा परिष्क्र्तः तं जुषस्व यविष्ठ्य |||
verses.transliteration: puroḷā aghne pacatastubhyaṃ vā ghā pariṣkṛtaḥ taṃ juṣasva yaviṣṭhya

translations.griffith: Agni, the sacrificial cake hath been prepared and dressed for thee:  Accept it, O Most Youthful God.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने वीहि पुरोळाषमाहुतं तिरोह्न्यम सहसः सूनुरस्यध्वरे हितः |||
verses.transliteration: aghne vīhi puroḷāṣamāhutaṃ tiroahnyam sahasaḥ sūnurasyadhvare hitaḥ

translations.griffith: Agni, enjoy the cake of meal and our oblation three days old:  Thou, Son of Strength, art stablished at our sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: माध्यन्दिने सवने जातवेदः पुरोळाशमिह कवे जुषस्व अग्ने यह्वस्य तव भागधेयं न पर मिनन्ति विदथेषु धीराः |||
verses.transliteration: mādhyandine savane jātavedaḥ puroḷāśamiha kave juṣasva aghne yahvasya tava bhāghadheyaṃ na pra minanti vidatheṣu dhīrāḥ

translations.griffith: Here at the midday sacrifice enjoy thou the sacrificial cake, wise, Jātavedas!  Agni, the sages in assemblies never minish the portion due to thee the Mighty.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने तर्तीये सवने हि कानिषः पुरोळाशं सहसः सूनवाहुतम अथा देवेष्वध्वरं विपन्यया धा रत्नवन्तमम्र्तेषु जाग्र्विम |||
verses.transliteration: aghne tṛtīye savane hi kāniṣaḥ puroḷāśaṃ sahasaḥ sūnavāhutam athā deveṣvadhvaraṃ vipanyayā dhā ratnavantamamṛteṣu jāghṛvim

translations.griffith: O Agni, at the third libation takewith joy the offered cake of sacrifice, thou, Son of Strength.  Through skill in song bear to the Gods our sacrifice, watchful and fraught with riches, to Immortal God.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने वर्धान आहुतिं पुरोळाशं जातवेदः जुषस्व तिरोह्न्यम |||
verses.transliteration: aghne vṛdhāna āhutiṃ puroḷāśaṃ jātavedaḥ juṣasva tiroahnyam

translations.griffith: O waxing Agni, knower, thou, of all, accept our gifts, the cake,  And that prepared ere yesterday.

verses.sanskrit: अस्तीदमधिमन्थनमस्ति परजननं कर्तम एतां विश्पत्नीमा भराग्निं मन्थाम पूर्वथा |||
verses.transliteration: astīdamadhimanthanamasti prajananaṃ kṛtam etāṃ viśpatnīmā bharāghniṃ manthāma pūrvathā

translations.griffith: HERE is the gear for friction, here tinder made ready for the spark.  Bring thou the Matron: we will rub Agni in ancient fashion forth.

verses.sanskrit: अरण्योर्निहितो जातवेदा गर्भ इव सुधितो गर्भिणीषु दिवे-दिव ईड्यो जाग्र्वद्भिर्हविष्मद्भिर्मनुष्येभिरग्निः |||
verses.transliteration: araṇyornihito jātavedā gharbha iva sudhito gharbhiṇīṣu dive-diva īḍyo jāghṛvadbhirhaviṣmadbhirmanuṣyebhiraghniḥ

translations.griffith: 1n the two fire-sticks Jātavedas lieth, even as the well-set germ in pregnant women,  Agni who day by day must be exalted by men who watch and worship with oblations.

verses.sanskrit: उत्तानायामव भरा चिकित्वान सद्यः परवीता वर्षणं जजान अरुषस्तूपो रुशदस्य पाज इळायास पुत्रो वयुने.अजनिष्ट |||
verses.transliteration: uttānāyāmava bharā cikitvān sadyaḥ pravītā vṛṣaṇaṃ jajāna aruṣastūpo ruśadasya pāja iḷāyās putro vayune.ajaniṣṭa

translations.griffith: Lay this with care on that which lies extended: straight hath she borne the Steer when made prolific.  With his red pillar—radiant is his splendour—in our skilled task is born the Son of Iḷā.

verses.sanskrit: इळायास्त्वा पदे वयं नाभा पर्थिव्या अधि जातवेदो नि धीमह्यग्ने हव्याय वोळ्हवे |||
verses.transliteration: iḷāyāstvā pade vayaṃ nābhā pṛthivyā adhi jātavedo ni dhīmahyaghne havyāya voḷhave

translations.griffith: In Iḷā's place we set thee down, upon the central point of earth,  That, Agni Jātavedas, thou mayst bear our offerings to the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: मन्थता नरः कविमद्वयन्तं परचेतसमम्र्तं सुप्रतीकम यज्ञस्य केतुं परथमं पुरस्तादग्निं नरो जनयता सुशेवम |||
verses.transliteration: manthatā naraḥ kavimadvayantaṃ pracetasamamṛtaṃ supratīkam yajñasya ketuṃ prathamaṃ purastādaghniṃ naro janayatā suśevam

translations.griffith: Rub into life, ye men, the Sage, the guileless, Immortal, very wise and fair to look on.  O men, bring forth the most propitious Agni, first ensign of the sacrifice to eastward.

verses.sanskrit: यदी मन्थन्ति बाहुभिर्वि रोचते.अश्वो न वाज्यरुषो वनेष्वा चित्रो न यामन्नश्विनोरनिव्र्तः परि वर्णक्त्यश्मनस्त्र्णा दहन |||
verses.transliteration: yadī manthanti bāhubhirvi rocate.aśvo na vājyaruṣo vaneṣvā citro na yāmannaśvinoranivṛtaḥ pari vṛṇaktyaśmanastṛṇā dahan

translations.griffith: When with their arms they rub him straight he shineth forth like a strong courser, red in colour, in the wood.  Bright, checkless, as it were upon the Aśvins' path, he passeth by the stones and burneth up the grass.

verses.sanskrit: जातो अग्नी रोचते चेकितानो वाजी विप्रः कविशस्तः सुदानुः यं देवास ईड्यं विश्वविदं हव्यवाहमदधुरध्वरेषु |||
verses.transliteration: jāto aghnī rocate cekitāno vājī vipraḥ kaviśastaḥ sudānuḥ yaṃ devāsa īḍyaṃ viśvavidaṃ havyavāhamadadhuradhvareṣu

translations.griffith: Agni shines forth when born, observant, mighty, the bountiful, the Singer praised by sages;  Whom, as adorable and knowing all things, Gods set at solemn rites as offering-bearer.

verses.sanskrit: सीद होतः सव उ लोके चिकित्वान सादया यज्ञं सुक्र्तस्य योनौ देवावीर्देवान हविषा यजास्यग्ने बर्हद यजमाने वयो धाः |||
verses.transliteration: sīda hotaḥ sva u loke cikitvān sādayā yajñaṃ sukṛtasya yonau devāvīrdevān haviṣā yajāsyaghne bṛhad yajamāne vayo dhāḥ

translations.griffith: Set thee, O Priest, in, thine own place, observant: lay down the sacrifice in the home of worship.  Thou, dear to Gods, shalt serve them with oblation: Agni, give long life to the sacrificer.

verses.sanskrit: कर्णोत धूमं वर्षणं सखायो.अस्रेधन्त इतन वाजमछ अयमग्निः पर्तनाषाट सुवीरो येन देवासो असहन्त दस्यून |||
verses.transliteration: kṛṇota dhūmaṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ sakhāyo.asredhanta itana vājamacha ayamaghniḥ pṛtanāṣāṭ suvīro yena devāso asahanta dasyūn

translations.griffith: Raise ye a mighty smoke, my fellow-workers! Ye shall attain to wealth without obstruction.  This Agni is the battle-winning Hero by whom the Gods have overcome the Dasyus.

verses.sanskrit: अयं ते योनिर्र्त्वियो यतो जातो अरोचथाः तं जानन्नग्न आ सीदाथा नो वर्धया गिरः |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ te yonirṛtviyo yato jāto arocathāḥ taṃ jānannaghna ā sīdāthā no vardhayā ghiraḥ

translations.griffith: This is thine ordered place of birth whence sprung to life thou shonest forth.  Knowing this, Agni, sit thee down, and prosper thou the songs we sing.

verses.sanskrit: तनूनपादुच्यते गर्भ आसुरो नराशंसो भवति यद विजायते मातरिश्वा यदमिमीत मातरि वातस्य सर्गो अभवत्सरीमणि |||
verses.transliteration: tanūnapāducyate gharbha āsuro narāśaṃso bhavati yad vijāyate mātariśvā yadamimīta mātari vātasya sargho abhavatsarīmaṇi

translations.griffith: As Germ Celestial he is called Tanūnapāt, and Narāśaṁsa born diffused in varied shape.  Formed in his Mother he is Mātariśvan; he hath, in his course, become the rapid flight of wind.

verses.sanskrit: सुनिर्मथा निर्मथितः सुनिधा निहितः कविः अग्ने सवध्वरा कर्णु देवान देवयते यज |||
verses.transliteration: sunirmathā nirmathitaḥ sunidhā nihitaḥ kaviḥ aghne svadhvarā kṛṇu devān devayate yaja

translations.griffith: With strong attrition rubbed to life, laid down with careful hand, a Sage,  Agni, make sacrifices good, and for the pious bring the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: अजीजनन्नम्र्तं मर्त्यासो.अस्रेमाणं तरणिं वीळुजम्भम दश सवसारो अग्रुवः समीचीः पुमांसं जातमभि सं रभन्ते |||
verses.transliteration: ajījanannamṛtaṃ martyāso.asremāṇaṃ taraṇiṃ vīḷujambham daśa svasāro aghruvaḥ samīcīḥ pumāṃsaṃ jātamabhi saṃ rabhante

translations.griffith: Mortals have brought to life the God Immortal, the Conqueror with mighty jaws, unfailing.  The sisters ten, unwedded and united, together grasp the Babe, the new-born Infant.

verses.sanskrit: पर सप्तहोता सनकादरोचत मातुरुपस्थे यदशोचदूधनि न नि मिषति सुरणो दिवे-दिवे यदसुरस्य जठरादजायत |||
verses.transliteration: pra saptahotā sanakādarocata māturupasthe yadaśocadūdhani na ni miṣati suraṇo dive-dive yadasurasya jaṭharādajāyata

translations.griffith: Served by the seven priests, he shone forth from ancient time, when in his Mother's bosom, in her lap, he glowed.  Giving delight each day he closeth not his eye, since from the Asura's body hewas brought to life.

verses.sanskrit: अमित्रायुधो मरुतामिव परयाः परथमजा बरह्मणो विश्वमिद विदुः दयुम्नवद बरह्म कुशिकास एरिर एक-एको दमे अग्निं समीधिरे |||
verses.transliteration: amitrāyudho marutāmiva prayāḥ prathamajā brahmaṇo viśvamid viduḥ dyumnavad brahma kuśikāsa erira eka-eko dame aghniṃ samīdhire

translations.griffith: Even as the Maruts, onslaughts who attack the foe, those born the first of all knew the full power of prayer.  The Kuśikas have made the glorious hymn ascend, and, each one singly in his home, have kindled fire.

verses.sanskrit: यदद्य तवा परयति यज्ञे अस्मिन होतश्चिकित्वो.अव्र्णीमहीह धरुवमया धरुवमुताशमिष्ठाः परजानन विद्वानुप याहि सोमम |||
verses.transliteration: yadadya tvā prayati yajñe asmin hotaścikitvo.avṛṇīmahīha dhruvamayā dhruvamutāśamiṣṭhāḥ prajānan vidvānupa yāhi somam

translations.griffith: As we, O Priest observant, have elected thee this day, what time the solemn sacrifice began,  So surely hast thou worshipped, surely hast thou toiled: come thou unto the Soma, wise and knowing all.

verses.sanskrit: इछन्ति तवा सोम्यासः सखायः सुन्वन्ति सोमं दधति परयांसि तितिक्षन्ते अभिशस्तिं जनानामिन्द्र तवदा कश्चन हि परकेतः |||
verses.transliteration: ichanti tvā somyāsaḥ sakhāyaḥ sunvanti somaṃ dadhati prayāṃsi titikṣante abhiśastiṃ janānāmindra tvadā kaścana hi praketaḥ

translations.griffith: THE friends who offer Soma long to find thee: they pour forth Soma and present their viands.  They bear unmoved the cursing of the people, for all our wisdom comes from thee, O Indra.

verses.sanskrit: न ते दूरे परमा चिद रजांस्या तु पर याहि हरिवो हरिभ्याम सथिराय वर्ष्णे सवना कर्तेमा युक्ता गरावाणः समिधाने अग्नौ |||
verses.transliteration: na te dūre paramā cid rajāṃsyā tu pra yāhi harivo haribhyām sthirāya vṛṣṇe savanā kṛtemā yuktā ghrāvāṇaḥ samidhāne aghnau

translations.griffith: Not far for thee are mid-air's loftiest regions: start hither, Lord of Bays, with thy Bay Horses.  Made for the Firm and Strong are these libations. The pressing-stones are set and fire is kindled.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रः सुशिप्रो मघवा तरुत्रो महाव्रातस्तुविकूर्मिर्र्घावान यदुग्रो धा बाधितो मर्त्येषु कव तया ते वर्षभ वीर्याणि |||
verses.transliteration: indraḥ suśipro maghavā tarutro mahāvrātastuvikūrmirṛghāvān yadughro dhā bādhito martyeṣu kva tyā te vṛṣabha vīryāṇi

translations.griffith: Fair cheeks hath Indra, Maghavan, the Victor, Lord of a great host, Stormer, strong in action.  What once thou didst in might when mortals vexed thee,—where now, O Bull, are those thy hero exploits?

verses.sanskrit: तवं हि षमा चयावयन्नच्युतान्येको वर्त्रा चरसि जिघ्नमानः तव दयावाप्र्थिवी पर्वतासो.अनु वरताय निमितेव तस्थुः |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ hi ṣmā cyāvayannacyutānyeko vṛtrā carasi jighnamānaḥ tava dyāvāpṛthivī parvatāso.anu vratāya nimiteva tasthuḥ

translations.griffith: For, overthrowing what hath ne’er been shaken, thou goest forth alone destroying Vṛtras.  For him who followeth thy Law the mountains and heaven and earth stand as if firmly stablished.

verses.sanskrit: उताभये पुरुहूत शरवोभिरेको दर्ळ्हमवदो वर्त्रहा सन इमे चिदिन्द्र रोदसी अपारे यत संग्र्भ्णा मघवन काशिरित ते |||
verses.transliteration: utābhaye puruhūta śravobhireko dṛḷhamavado vṛtrahā san ime cidindra rodasī apāre yat saṃghṛbhṇā maghavan kāśirit te

translations.griffith: Yea, Much-invoked! in safety through thy glories alone thou speakest truth as Vṛtra's slayer.  E’en these two boundless worlds to thee, O Indra, what time thou graspest them, are but a handful.

verses.sanskrit: पर सू त इन्द्र परवता हरिभ्यां पर ते वज्रः परम्र्णन्नेतु शत्रून जहि परतीचो अनूचः पराचो विश्वं सत्यंक्र्णुहि विष्टमस्तु |||
verses.transliteration: pra sū ta indra pravatā haribhyāṃ pra te vajraḥ pramṛṇannetu śatrūn jahi pratīco anūcaḥ parāco viśvaṃ satyaṃkṛṇuhi viṣṭamastu

translations.griffith: Forthwith thy Bay steeds down the steep, O Indra, forth, crushing foemen, go thy bolt of thunder!  Slay those who meet thee, those who flee, who follow: make all thy promise true; be all completed.

verses.sanskrit: यस्मै धायुरदधा मर्त्यायाभक्तं चिद भजते गेह्यं सः भद्रा त इन्द्र सुमतिर्घ्र्ताची सहस्रदाना पुरुहूत रातिः |||
verses.transliteration: yasmai dhāyuradadhā martyāyābhaktaṃ cid bhajate ghehyaṃ saḥ bhadrā ta indra sumatirghṛtācī sahasradānā puruhūta rātiḥ

translations.griffith: The man to whom thou givest as Provider enjoys domestic plenty undivided.  Blest, Indra, is thy favour dropping fatness: thy worship, Much-invoked! brings gifts in thousands.

verses.sanskrit: सहदानुं पुरुहूत कषियन्तमहस्तमिन्द्र सं पिणक कुणारुम अभि वर्त्रं वर्धमानं पियारुमपादमिन्द्र तवसा जघन्थ |||
verses.transliteration: sahadānuṃ puruhūta kṣiyantamahastamindra saṃ piṇak kuṇārum abhi vṛtraṃ vardhamānaṃ piyārumapādamindra tavasā jaghantha

translations.griffith: Thou, Indra, Much-invoked! didst crush to pieces Kunaru handless fiend who dwelt with Danu.  Thou with might, Indra, smotest dead the scorner, the footless Vṛtra as he waxed in vigour.

verses.sanskrit: नि सामनामिषिरामिन्द्र भूमिं महीमपारां सदने ससत्थ अस्तभ्नाद दयां वर्षभो अन्तरिक्षमर्षन्त्वापस्त्वयेह परसूताः |||
verses.transliteration: ni sāmanāmiṣirāmindra bhūmiṃ mahīmapārāṃ sadane sasattha astabhnād dyāṃ vṛṣabho antarikṣamarṣantvāpastvayeha prasūtāḥ

translations.griffith: Thou hast established in her seat, O Indra, the level earth, vast, vigorous, unbounded.  The Bull hath propped the heaven and air's mid-region. By thee sent onward let the floods flow hither.

verses.sanskrit: अलात्र्णो वल इन्द्र वरजो गोः पुरा हन्तोर्भयमानो वयार सुगान पथो अक्र्णोन निरजे गाः परावन वाणीः पुरुहूतं धमन्तीः |||
verses.transliteration: alātṛṇo vala indra vrajo ghoḥ purā hantorbhayamāno vyāra sughān patho akṛṇon niraje ghāḥ prāvan vāṇīḥ puruhūtaṃ dhamantīḥ

translations.griffith: He who withheld the kine, in silence I yielded in fear before thy blow, O Indra.  He made paths easy to drive forth the cattle. Loud-breathing praises helped the Much-invoked One.

verses.sanskrit: एको दवे वसुमती समीची इन्द्र आ पप्रौ पर्थिवीमुत दयाम उतान्तरिक्षादभि नः समीक इषो रथीः सयुजः शूर वाजान |||
verses.transliteration: eko dve vasumatī samīcī indra ā paprau pṛthivīmuta dyām utāntarikṣādabhi naḥ samīka iṣo rathīḥ sayujaḥ śūra vājān

translations.griffith: Indra alone filled full the earth and heaven, the Pair who meet together, rich in treasures.  Yea, bring thou near us from the air's mid-region strength, on thy car, and wholesome food, O Hero.

verses.sanskrit: दिशः सूर्यो न मिनाति परदिष्टा दिवे-दिवे हर्यश्वप्रसूताः सं यदानळ अध्वन आदिदश्वैर्विमोचनं कर्णुते तत तवस्य |||
verses.transliteration: diśaḥ sūryo na mināti pradiṣṭā dive-dive haryaśvaprasūtāḥ saṃ yadānaḷ adhvana ādidaśvairvimocanaṃ kṛṇute tat tvasya

translations.griffith: Sūrya transgresses not the ordered limits set daily by the Lord of Tawny Coursers.  When to the goal he comes, his journey ended, his Steeds he looses: this is Indra's doing.

verses.sanskrit: दिद्र्क्षन्त उषसो यामन्नक्तोर्विवस्वत्या महि चित्रमनीकम विश्वे जानन्ति महिना यदागादिन्द्रस्य कर्म सुक्र्तापुरूणि |||
verses.transliteration: didṛkṣanta uṣaso yāmannaktorvivasvatyā mahi citramanīkam viśve jānanti mahinā yadāghādindrasya karma sukṛtāpurūṇi

translations.griffith: Men gladly in the course of night would look on the broad bright front of the refulgent Morning;  And all acknowledge, when she comes in glory, the manifold and goodly works of Indra.

verses.sanskrit: महि जयोतिर्निहितं वक्षणास्वामा पक्वं चरति बिभ्रती गौः विश्वं सवाद्म सम्भ्र्तमुस्रियायां यत सीमिन्द्रो अदधाद भोजनाय |||
verses.transliteration: mahi jyotirnihitaṃ vakṣaṇāsvāmā pakvaṃ carati bibhratī ghauḥ viśvaṃ svādma sambhṛtamusriyāyāṃ yat sīmindro adadhād bhojanāya

translations.griffith: A mighty splendour rests upon her bosom: bearing ripe milk the Cow, unripe, advances.  All sweetness is collected in the Heifer, sweetness which Indra made for our enjoyment.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्र दर्ह्य यामकोशा अभूवन यज्ञाय शिक्ष गर्णते सखिभ्यः दुर्मायवो दुरेवा मर्त्यासो निषङगिणो रिपवो हन्त्वासः |||
verses.transliteration: indra dṛhya yāmakośā abhūvan yajñāya śikṣa ghṛṇate sakhibhyaḥ durmāyavo durevā martyāso niṣaṅghiṇo ripavo hantvāsaḥ

translations.griffith: Barring the way they come. Be firm, O Indra; aid friends to sacrifice and him who singeth.  These must be slain by thee, malignant mortals, armed with ill arts, our quiverbearing foemen.

verses.sanskrit: सं घोषः शर्ण्वे.अवमैरमित्रैर्जही नयेष्वशनिं तपिष्ठाम वर्श्चेमधस्ताद वि रुजा सहस्व जहि रक्षो मघवन रन्धयस्व |||
verses.transliteration: saṃ ghoṣaḥ śṛṇve.avamairamitrairjahī nyeṣvaśaniṃ tapiṣṭhām vṛścemadhastād vi rujā sahasva jahi rakṣo maghavan randhayasva

translations.griffith: A cry is beard from enemies most near us: against them send thy fiercest-flaming weapon.  Rend them from under, crush them and subdue them. Slay, Maghavan, and make the fiends our booty.

verses.sanskrit: उद वर्ह रक्षः सहमूलमिन्द्र वर्श्चा मध्यं परत्यग्रंश्र्णीहि आ कीवतः सललूकं चकर्थ बरह्मद्विषे तपुषिं हेतिमस्य |||
verses.transliteration: ud vṛha rakṣaḥ sahamūlamindra vṛścā madhyaṃ pratyaghraṃśṛṇīhi ā kīvataḥ salalūkaṃ cakartha brahmadviṣe tapuṣiṃ hetimasya

translations.griffith: Root up the race of Rākṣasas, O Indra rend it in front and crush it in the middle.  How long hast thou bebaved as one who wavers? Cast thy hot dart at him who hates devotion:

verses.sanskrit: सवस्तये वाजिभिश्च परणेतः सं यन महीरिष आसत्सिपूर्वीः रायो वन्तारो बर्हतः सयामास्मे अस्तु भग इन्द्रप्रजावान |||
verses.transliteration: svastaye vājibhiśca praṇetaḥ saṃ yan mahīriṣa āsatsipūrvīḥ rāyo vantāro bṛhataḥ syāmāsme astu bhagha indraprajāvān

translations.griffith: When borne by strong Steeds for our weal, O Leader, thou seatest thee at many noble viands.  May we be winners of abundant riches. May Indra be our wealth with store of children.

verses.sanskrit: आ नो भर भगमिन्द्र दयुमन्तं नि ते देष्णस्य धीमहि पररेके ऊर्व इव पप्रथे कामो अस्मे तमा पर्ण वसुपते वसूनाम |||
verses.transliteration: ā no bhara bhaghamindra dyumantaṃ ni te deṣṇasya dhīmahi prareke ūrva iva paprathe kāmo asme tamā pṛṇa vasupate vasūnām

translations.griffith: Bestow on us resplendent wealth. O Indra let us enjoy thine overflow of bounty.  Wide as a sea our longing hath expanded, fulfil it, O thou Treasure-Lord of treasures.

verses.sanskrit: इमं कामं मन्दया गोभिरश्वैश्चन्द्रवता राधसा पप्रथश्च सवर्यवो मतिभिस्तुभ्यं विप्रा इन्द्राय वाहःकुशिकासो अक्रन |||
verses.transliteration: imaṃ kāmaṃ mandayā ghobhiraśvaiścandravatā rādhasā paprathaśca svaryavo matibhistubhyaṃ viprā indrāya vāhaḥkuśikāso akran

translations.griffith: With kine and horses satisfy this longing with very splendid bounty skill extend it.  Seeking the light, with hymns to thee, O Indra, Kuśikas have brought their gift, the singers.

verses.sanskrit: आ नो गोत्रा दर्द्र्हि गोपते गाः समस्मभ्यं सनयो यन्तु वाजाः दिवक्षा असि वर्षभ सत्यशुष्मो.अस्मभ्यं सु मघवन बोधि गोदाः |||
verses.transliteration: ā no ghotrā dardṛhi ghopate ghāḥ samasmabhyaṃ sanayo yantu vājāḥ divakṣā asi vṛṣabha satyaśuṣmo.asmabhyaṃ su maghavan bodhi ghodāḥ

translations.griffith: Lord of the kine, burst the kine's stable open: cows shall be ours, and strength that wins the booty.  Hero, whose might is true, thy home is heaven: to us, O Maghavan, grant gifts of cattle.

verses.sanskrit: शुनं हुवेम मघवानमिन्द्रमस्मिन भरे नर्तमं वाजसातौ शर्ण्वन्तमुग्रमूतये समत्सु घनन्तं वर्त्राणि संजितं धनानाम |||
verses.transliteration: śunaṃ huvema maghavānamindramasmin bhare nṛtamaṃ vājasātau śṛṇvantamughramūtaye samatsu ghnantaṃ vṛtrāṇi saṃjitaṃ dhanānām

translations.griffith: Call we on Maghavan, auspicious Indra, best Hero in this fight where spoil is gathered,  The Strong who listens, who gives aid in battles, who slays the Vṛtras, wins and gathers riches.

verses.sanskrit: शासद वह्निर्दुहितुर्नप्त्यं गाद विद्वान रतस्य दीधितिंसपर्यन पिता यत्र दुहितुः सेकं रञ्जन सं शग्म्येन मनसा दधन्वे |||
verses.transliteration: śāsad vahnirduhiturnaptyaṃ ghād vidvān ṛtasya dīdhitiṃsaparyan pitā yatra duhituḥ sekaṃ ṛñjan saṃ śaghmyena manasā dadhanve

translations.griffith: WISE, teaching, following the thought of Order, the sonless gained a grandson from his daughter.  Fain, as a sire, to see his child prolific, he sped to meet her with an eager spirit.

verses.sanskrit: न जामये तान्वो रिक्थमारैक चकार गर्भं सनितुर्निधानम यदी मातरो जनयन्त वह्निमन्यः कर्ता सुक्र्तोरन्य रन्धन |||
verses.transliteration: na jāmaye tānvo rikthamāraik cakāra gharbhaṃ saniturnidhānam yadī mātaro janayanta vahnimanyaḥ kartā sukṛtoranya ṛndhan

translations.griffith: The Son left not his portion to the brother, he made a home to hold him who should gain, it.  What time his Parents gave the Priest his being, of the good pair one acted, one promoted.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निर्जज्ञे जुह्वा रेजमानो महस पुत्रानरुषस्य परयक्षे महान गर्भो मह्या जातमेषां मही परव्र्द धर्यश्वस्य यज्ञैः |||
verses.transliteration: aghnirjajñe juhvā rejamāno mahas putrānaruṣasya prayakṣe mahān gharbho mahyā jātameṣāṃ mahī pravṛd dharyaśvasya yajñaiḥ

translations.griffith: Agni was born trembling with tongue that flickered, so that the Red's great children should be honoured.  Great is their germ, that born of them is mighty, great the Bays' Lord's approach through sacrifices.

verses.sanskrit: अभि जैत्रीरसचन्त सप्र्धानं महि जयोतिस्तमसो निरजानन तं जानतीः परत्युदायन्नुषासः पतिर्गवामभवदेक इन्द्रः |||
verses.transliteration: abhi jaitrīrasacanta spṛdhānaṃ mahi jyotistamaso nirajānan taṃ jānatīḥ pratyudāyannuṣāsaḥ patirghavāmabhavadeka indraḥ

translations.griffith: Conquering bands upon the Warrior waited: they recognized great light from out the darkness.  The conscious Dawns went forth to meet his coming, and the sole Master of the kine was Indra.

verses.sanskrit: वीळौ सतीरभि धीरा अत्र्न्दन पराचाहिन्वन मनसा सप्तविप्राः विश्वामविन्दन पथ्यां रतस्य परजानन्नित तानमसा विवेश |||
verses.transliteration: vīḷau satīrabhi dhīrā atṛndan prācāhinvan manasā saptaviprāḥ viśvāmavindan pathyāṃ ṛtasya prajānannit tānamasā viveśa

translations.griffith: The sages freed them from their firmbuilt prison: the seven priests drove them forward with their spirit.  All holy Order's pathway they discovered he, full of knowledge, shared these deeds through worship.

verses.sanskrit: विदद यदी सरमा रुग्णमद्रेर्महि पाथः पूर्व्यं सध्र्यक कः अग्रं नयत सुपद्यक्षराणामछा रवं परथमा जानती गात |||
verses.transliteration: vidad yadī saramā rughṇamadrermahi pāthaḥ pūrvyaṃ sadhryak kaḥ aghraṃ nayat supadyakṣarāṇāmachā ravaṃ prathamā jānatī ghāt

translations.griffith: When Saramā had found the mountain's fissure, that vast and ancient place she plundered thoroughly.  In the floods' van she led them forth, light-footed: she who well knew came first unto their lowing.

verses.sanskrit: अगछदु विप्रतमः सखीयन्नसूदयत सुक्र्ते गर्भमद्रिः ससान मर्यो युवभिर्मखस्यन्नथाभवदङगिराः सद्यो अर्चन |||
verses.transliteration: aghachadu vipratamaḥ sakhīyannasūdayat sukṛte gharbhamadriḥ sasāna maryo yuvabhirmakhasyannathābhavadaṅghirāḥ sadyo arcan

translations.griffith: Longing for friendship came the noblest singer: the hill poured forth its treasure for the pious.  The Hero with young followers fought and conquered, and straightway Aṅgiras was singing praises,

verses.sanskrit: सतः-सतः परतिमानं पुरोभूर्विश्वा वेद जनिमा हन्ति शुष्णम पर णो दिवः पदवीर्गव्युरर्चन सखा सखीन्रमुञ्चन निरवद्यात |||
verses.transliteration: sataḥ-sataḥ pratimānaṃ purobhūrviśvā veda janimā hanti śuṣṇam pra ṇo divaḥ padavīrghavyurarcan sakhā sakhīnramuñcan niravadyāt

translations.griffith: Peer of each noble thing, yea, all excelling, all creatures doth he know, he slayeth Śuṣṇa.  Our leader, fain for war, singing from heaven, as Friend he saved his lovers from dishonour.

verses.sanskrit: नि गव्यता मनसा सेदुरर्कैः कर्ण्वानासो अम्र्तत्वाय गातुम इदं चिन नु सदनं भूर्येषां येन मासानसिषासन्न्र्तेन |||
verses.transliteration: ni ghavyatā manasā sedurarkaiḥ kṛṇvānāso amṛtatvāya ghātum idaṃ cin nu sadanaṃ bhūryeṣāṃ yena māsānasiṣāsannṛtena

translations.griffith: They sate them down with spirit fain for booty, making with hymns a way to life eternal.  And this is still their place of frequent session, whereby they sought to gain the months through Order.

verses.sanskrit: सम्पश्यमाना अमदन्नभि सवं पयः परत्नस्य रेतसो दुघानाः वि रोदसी अतपद घोष एषां जाते निष्ठामदधुर्गोषु वीरान |||
verses.transliteration: sampaśyamānā amadannabhi svaṃ payaḥ pratnasya retaso dughānāḥ vi rodasī atapad ghoṣa eṣāṃ jāte niṣṭhāmadadhurghoṣu vīrān

translations.griffith: Drawing the milk of ancient seed prolific, they joyed as they beheld their own possession.  Their shout of triumph heated earth and heaven. When the kine showed, they bade the heroes rouse them.

verses.sanskrit: स जातेभिर्व्र्त्रहा सेदु हव्यैरुदुस्रिया अस्र्जदिन्द्रो अर्कैः उरूच्यस्मै घर्तवद भरन्ती मधु सवाद्म दुदुहे जेन्या गौः |||
verses.transliteration: sa jātebhirvṛtrahā sedu havyairudusriyā asṛjadindro arkaiḥ urūcyasmai ghṛtavad bharantī madhu svādma duduhe jenyā ghauḥ

translations.griffith: Indra drove forth the kine, that Vṛtra-slayer, while hymns of praise rose up and gifts were offered.  For him the Cow, noble and far-extending, poured pleasant juices, bringing oil and sweetness.

verses.sanskrit: पित्रे चिच्चक्रुः सदनं समस्मै महि तविषीमत सुक्र्तो विहि खयन विष्कभ्नन्त सकम्भनेना जनित्री आसीना ऊर्ध्वं रभसं वि मिन्वन |||
verses.transliteration: pitre ciccakruḥ sadanaṃ samasmai mahi tviṣīmat sukṛto vihi khyan viṣkabhnanta skambhanenā janitrī āsīnā ūrdhvaṃ rabhasaṃ vi minvan

translations.griffith: They made a mansion for their Father, deftly provided him a great and glorious dwelling;  With firm support parted and stayed the Parents, and, sitting, fixed him there erected, mighty.

verses.sanskrit: मही यदि धिषणा शिश्नथे धात सद्योव्र्धं विभ्वं रोदस्योः गिरो यस्मिन्ननवद्याः समीचीर्विश्वा इन्द्राय तविषीरनुत्ताः |||
verses.transliteration: mahī yadi dhiṣaṇā śiśnathe dhāt sadyovṛdhaṃ vibhvaṃ rodasyoḥ ghiro yasminnanavadyāḥ samīcīrviśvā indrāya taviṣīranuttāḥ

translations.griffith: What time the ample chalice had impelled him, swift waxing, vast, to pierce the earth and heaven,—  Him in whom blameless songs are all united: all powers invincible belong to Indra.

verses.sanskrit: मह्या ते सख्यं वश्मि शक्तीरा वर्त्रघ्ने नियुतो यन्ति पूर्वीः महि सतोत्रमव आगन्म सूरेरस्माकं सु मघवन बोधि गोपाः |||
verses.transliteration: mahyā te sakhyaṃ vaśmi śaktīrā vṛtraghne niyuto yanti pūrvīḥ mahi stotramava āghanma sūrerasmākaṃ su maghavan bodhi ghopāḥ

translations.griffith: I crave thy powers, I crave thy mighty friendship: full many a team goes to the Vṛtra-slayer.  Great is the laud, we seek the Princes' favour. Be thou, O Maghavan, our guard and keeper.

verses.sanskrit: महि कषेत्रं पुरु शचन्द्रं विविद्वानादित सखिभ्यश्चरथं समैरत इन्द्रो नर्भिरजनद दीद्यानः साकं सूर्यमुषसं गातुमग्निम |||
verses.transliteration: mahi kṣetraṃ puru ścandraṃ vividvānādit sakhibhyaścarathaṃ samairat indro nṛbhirajanad dīdyānaḥ sākaṃ sūryamuṣasaṃ ghātumaghnim

translations.griffith: He, having found great, splendid, rich dominion, sent life and motion to his friends and lovers.  Indra who shone together with the Heroes begot the song, the fire, and Sun and Morning.

verses.sanskrit: अपश्चिदेष विभ्वो दमूनाः पर सध्रीचीरस्र्जद विश्वश्चन्द्राः मध्वः पुनानाः कविभिः पवित्रैर्द्युभिर्हिन्वन्त्यक्तुभिर्धनुत्रीः |||
verses.transliteration: apaścideṣa vibhvo damūnāḥ pra sadhrīcīrasṛjad viśvaścandrāḥ madhvaḥ punānāḥ kavibhiḥ pavitrairdyubhirhinvantyaktubhirdhanutrīḥ

translations.griffith: Vast, the House-Friend, he set the waters flowing, all-lucid, widely spread, that move together.  By the wise cleansings of the meath made holy, through days, and nights they speed the swift streams onward.

verses.sanskrit: अनु कर्ष्णे वसुधिती जिहाते उभे सूर्यस्य मंहना यजत्रे परि यत ते महिमानं वर्जध्यै सखाय इन्द्र काम्या रजिप्याः |||
verses.transliteration: anu kṛṣṇe vasudhitī jihāte ubhe sūryasya maṃhanā yajatre pari yat te mahimānaṃ vṛjadhyai sakhāya indra kāmyā ṛjipyāḥ

translations.griffith: To thee proceed the dark, the treasure-holders, both of them sanctified by Sūrya's bounty.  The while thy ovely storming Friends, O Indra, fail to attain the measure of thy greatness.

verses.sanskrit: पतिर्भव वर्त्रहन सून्र्तानां गिरां विश्वायुर्व्र्षभो वयोधाः आ नो गहि सख्येभिः शिवेभिर्महान महीभिरूतिभिः सरण्यन |||
verses.transliteration: patirbhava vṛtrahan sūnṛtānāṃ ghirāṃ viśvāyurvṛṣabho vayodhāḥ ā no ghahi sakhyebhiḥ śivebhirmahān mahībhirūtibhiḥ saraṇyan

translations.griffith: Be Lord of joyous songs, O Vṛtra-slayer, Bull dear to all, who gives the power of living.  Come unto us with thine auspicious friendship, hastening, Mighty One, with mighty succours.

verses.sanskrit: तमङगिरस्वन नमसा सपर्यन नव्यं कर्णोमि सन्यसे पुराजाम दरुहो वि याहि बहुला अदेवीः सवश्च नो मघवन सातये धाः |||
verses.transliteration: tamaṅghirasvan namasā saparyan navyaṃ kṛṇomi sanyase purājām druho vi yāhi bahulā adevīḥ svaśca no maghavan sātaye dhāḥ

translations.griffith: Like Aṅgiras I honour him with worship, and renovate old song for him the Ancient.  Chase thou the many godless evil creatures, and give us, Maghavan, heaven's light to help m.

verses.sanskrit: मिहः पावकाः परतता अभूवन सवस्ति नः पिप्र्हि पारमासाम इन्द्र तवं रथिरः पाहि नो रिषो मक्षू-मक्षू कर्णुहि गोजितो नः |||
verses.transliteration: mihaḥ pāvakāḥ pratatā abhūvan svasti naḥ pipṛhi pāramāsām indra tvaṃ rathiraḥ pāhi no riṣo makṣū-makṣū kṛṇuhi ghojito naḥ

translations.griffith: Far forth are spread the purifying waters convey thou us across them unto safety.  Save us, our Charioteer, from harm, O Indra, soon, very soon, make us win spoil of cattle.

verses.sanskrit: अदेदिष्ट वर्त्रहा गोपतिर्गा अन्तः कर्ष्णानरुषैर्धामभिर्गात पर सून्र्ता दिशमान रतेन दुरश्च विश्वा अव्र्णोदप सवाः |||
verses.transliteration: adediṣṭa vṛtrahā ghopatirghā antaḥ kṛṣṇānaruṣairdhāmabhirghāt pra sūnṛtā diśamāna ṛtena duraśca viśvā avṛṇodapa svāḥ

translations.griffith: His kine their Lord hath shown, e’en Vṛtra's slayer, through the black hosts he passed with red attendants.  Teaching us pleasant things by holy Order, to, us hath he thrown open all his portals.

verses.transliteration: śunaṃ huvema ...

translations.griffith: Call we on Maghavan, auspicious Indra, best Hero in this fight where spoil is gathered.  The Strong who listens, who gives aid in battles, who slays the Vṛtras, wins and gathers riches.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्र सोमं सोमपते पिबेमं माध्यन्दिनं सवनं चारु यत ते परप्रुथ्या शिप्रे मघवन्न्र्जीषिन विमुच्या हरी इहमादयस्व |||
verses.transliteration: indra somaṃ somapate pibemaṃ mādhyandinaṃ savanaṃ cāru yat te prapruthyā śipre maghavannṛjīṣin vimucyā harī ihamādayasva

translations.griffith: DRINK thou this Soma, Indra, Lord of Soma; drink thou the draught of noonday which thou Iovest.  Puffing thy cheeks, impetuous, liberal Giver, here loose thy two Bay Horses and rejoice thee.

verses.sanskrit: गवाशिरं मन्थिनमिन्द्र शुक्रं पिबा सोमं ररिमा ते मदाय बरह्मक्र्ता मारुतेना गणेन सजोषा रुद्रैस्त्र्पदाव्र्षस्व |||
verses.transliteration: ghavāśiraṃ manthinamindra śukraṃ pibā somaṃ rarimā te madāya brahmakṛtā mārutenā ghaṇena sajoṣā rudraistṛpadāvṛṣasva

translations.griffith: Quaff it pure, meal-blent, mixt with milk, O Indra; we have poured forth the Soma for thy rapture.  Knit with the prayer-fulfilling band of Maruts, yea, with the Rudras, drink till thou art sated;

verses.sanskrit: ये ते शुष्मं ये तविषीमवर्धन्नर्चन्त इन्द्र मरुतस्तोजः माध्यन्दिने सवने वज्रहस्त पिबा रुद्रेभिः सगणः सुशिप्र |||
verses.transliteration: ye te śuṣmaṃ ye taviṣīmavardhannarcanta indra marutastaojaḥ mādhyandine savane vajrahasta pibā rudrebhiḥ saghaṇaḥ suśipra

translations.griffith: Those who gave increase to thy strength and vigour; the Maruts singing forth thy might, O Indra.  Drink thou, O fair of cheek, whose hand wields thunder, with Rudras banded, at our noon libation.

verses.sanskrit: त इन नवस्य मधुमद विविप्र इन्द्रस्य शर्धो मरुतो य आसन येभिर्व्र्त्रस्येषितो विवेदामर्मणो मन्यमानस्य मर्म |||
verses.transliteration: ta in nvasya madhumad vivipra indrasya śardho maruto ya āsan yebhirvṛtrasyeṣito vivedāmarmaṇo manyamānasya marma

translations.griffith: They, even the Maruts who were there, excited with song the meath-created strength of Indra.  By them impelled to act he reached the vitals Of Vṛtra, though he deemed that none might wound him.

verses.sanskrit: मनुष्वदिन्द्र सवनं जुषाणः पिबा सोमं शश्वते वीर्याय स आ वव्र्त्स्व हर्यश्व यज्ञैः सरण्युभिरपो अर्णा सिसर्षि |||
verses.transliteration: manuṣvadindra savanaṃ juṣāṇaḥ pibā somaṃ śaśvate vīryāya sa ā vavṛtsva haryaśva yajñaiḥ saraṇyubhirapo arṇā sisarṣi

translations.griffith: Pleased, like a man, with our libation, Indra, drink, for enduring hero might, the Soma.  Lord of Bays, moved by sacrifice come hither: thou with the Swift Ones stirrest floods and waters.

verses.sanskrit: तवमपो यद ध वर्त्रं जघन्वानत्यानिव परास्र्जः सर्तवाजौ शयानमिन्द्र चरत वधेन वव्रिवांसं परि देवीरदेवम |||
verses.transliteration: tvamapo yad dha vṛtraṃ jaghanvānatyāniva prāsṛjaḥ sartavājau śayānamindra carata vadhena vavrivāṃsaṃ pari devīradevam

translations.griffith: When thou didst loose the streams to run like racers in the swift contest, having smitten Vṛtra  With flying weapon where he lay, O Indra, and, godless, kept the Goddesses encompassed.

verses.sanskrit: यजाम इन नमसा वर्द्धमिन्द्रं बर्हन्तं रष्वमजरं युवानम यस्य परिये ममतुर्यज्ञियस्य न रोदसी महिमानं ममाते |||
verses.transliteration: yajāma in namasā vṛddhamindraṃ bṛhantaṃ ṛṣvamajaraṃ yuvānam yasya priye mamaturyajñiyasya na rodasī mahimānaṃ mamāte

translations.griffith: With reverence let us worship mighty Indra, great and sublime, eternal, everyouthful,  Whose greatness the dear world-halves have not measured, no, nor conceived the might of him the Holy.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रस्य कर्म सुक्र्ता पुरूणि वरतानि देवा न मिनन्ति विश्वे दाधार यः पर्थिवीं दयामुतेमां जजान सूर्यमुषसं सुदंसाः |||
verses.transliteration: indrasya karma sukṛtā purūṇi vratāni devā na minanti viśve dādhāra yaḥ pṛthivīṃ dyāmutemāṃ jajāna sūryamuṣasaṃ sudaṃsāḥ

translations.griffith: Many are Indra's nobly wrought achievements, and none of all the Gods transgress his statutes.  He beareth up this earth and heaven, and, doer of marvels, he begot the Sun and Morning.

verses.sanskrit: अद्रोघ सत्यं तव तन महित्वं सद्यो यज्जातो अपिबो ह सोमम न दयाव इन्द्र तवसस्त ओजो नाहा न मासाः शरदो वरन्त |||
verses.transliteration: adrogha satyaṃ tava tan mahitvaṃ sadyo yajjāto apibo ha somam na dyāva indra tavasasta ojo nāhā na māsāḥ śarado varanta

translations.griffith: Herein, O Guileless One, is thy true greatness, that soon as born thou drankest up the Soma.  Days may not check the power of thee the Mighty, nor the nights, Indra, nor the months, nor autumns.

verses.sanskrit: तवं सद्यो अपिबो जात इन्द्र मदाय सोमं परमे वयोमन यद ध दयावाप्र्थिवी आविवेषीरथाभवः पूर्व्यः कारुधायाः |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ sadyo apibo jāta indra madāya somaṃ parame vyoman yad dha dyāvāpṛthivī āviveṣīrathābhavaḥ pūrvyaḥ kārudhāyāḥ

translations.griffith: As soon as thou wast born in highest heaven thou drankest Soma to delight thee, Indra;  And when thou hadst pervaded earth and heaven thou wast the first supporter of the singer.

verses.sanskrit: अहन्नहिं परिशयानमर्ण ओजायमानं तुविजात तव्यान न ते महित्वमनु भूदध दयौर्यदन्यया सफिग्या कषामवस्थाः |||
verses.transliteration: ahannahiṃ pariśayānamarṇa ojāyamānaṃ tuvijāta tavyān na te mahitvamanu bhūdadha dyauryadanyayā sphighyā kṣāmavasthāḥ

translations.griffith: Thou, puissant God, more mighty, slewest. Ahi showing his strength when couched around the waters.  The heaven itself attained not to thy greatness when with one hip of thine the earth was shadowed.

verses.sanskrit: यज्ञो हि त इन्द्र वर्धनो भूदुत परियः सुतसोमो मियेधः यज्ञेन यज्ञमव यज्ञियः सन यज्ञस्ते वज्रमहिहत्य आवत |||
verses.transliteration: yajño hi ta indra vardhano bhūduta priyaḥ sutasomo miyedhaḥ yajñena yajñamava yajñiyaḥ san yajñaste vajramahihatya āvat

translations.griffith: Sacrifice, Indra, made thee wax so mighty, the dear oblation with the flowing Soma.  O Worshipful, with worship help our worship, for worship helped thy bolt when slaying Ahi.

verses.sanskrit: यज्ञेनेन्द्रमवसा चक्रे अर्वागैनं सुम्नाय नव्यसे वव्र्त्याम य सतोमेभिर्वाव्र्धे पूर्व्येभिर्यो मध्यमेभिरुत नूतनेभिः |||
verses.transliteration: yajñenendramavasā cakre arvāghainaṃ sumnāya navyase vavṛtyām ya stomebhirvāvṛdhe pūrvyebhiryo madhyamebhiruta nūtanebhiḥ

translations.griffith: With sacrifice and wish have I brought Indra; still for new blessings may I turn him hither,  Him magnified by ancient songs and praises, by lauds of later time and days yet recent.

verses.sanskrit: विवेष यन मा धिषणा जजान सतवै पुरा पार्यादिन्द्रमह्नः अंहसो यत्र पीपरद यथा नो नावेव यान्तमुभये हवन्ते |||
verses.transliteration: viveṣa yan mā dhiṣaṇā jajāna stavai purā pāryādindramahnaḥ aṃhaso yatra pīparad yathā no nāveva yāntamubhaye havante

translations.griffith: I have brought forth a song when longing seized me: ere the decisive day will I laud Indra;  Then may he safely bear us over trouble, as in a ship, when both sides invocate him.

verses.sanskrit: आपूर्णो अस्य कलशः सवाहा सेक्तेव कोशं सिसिचे पिबध्यै समु परिया आवव्र्त्रन मदाय परदक्षिणिदभि सोमासैन्द्रम |||
verses.transliteration: āpūrṇo asya kalaśaḥ svāhā sekteva kośaṃ sisice pibadhyai samu priyā āvavṛtran madāya pradakṣiṇidabhi somāsaindram

translations.griffith: Full is his chalice: Glory! Like a pourer I have filled up the vessel for his drinking.  Presented on the right, dear Soma juices have brought us Indra, to rejoice him, hither.

verses.sanskrit: न तवा गभीरः पुरुहूत सिन्धुर्नाद्रयः परि षन्तो वरन्त इत्था सखिभ्य इषितो यदिन्द्रा दर्ळ्हं चिदरुजो गव्यमूर्वम |||
verses.transliteration: na tvā ghabhīraḥ puruhūta sindhurnādrayaḥ pari ṣanto varanta itthā sakhibhya iṣito yadindrā dṛḷhaṃ cidarujo ghavyamūrvam

translations.griffith: Not the deep-flowing flood, O Much-invoked One! not hills that compass thee about restrain thee,  Since here incited, for thy friends, O Indra, thou breakest e’en the firm built stall of cattle.

verses.transliteration: śunaṃ huvema ...

translations.griffith: Call we on Maghavan, auspicious Indra, best Hero in this fight where spoil is gathered,  The Strong who listens, who gives aid in battles, who slays the Vṛtras, wins and gathers riches.

verses.sanskrit: पर पर्वतानामुशती उपस्थादश्वे इव विषिते हासमाने गावेव शुभ्रे मातरा रिहाणे विपाट छुतुद्री पयसाजवेते |||
verses.transliteration: pra parvatānāmuśatī upasthādaśve iva viṣite hāsamāne ghāveva śubhre mātarā rihāṇe vipāṭ chutudrī payasājavete

translations.griffith: FORTH from the bosom of the mountains, eager as two swift mares with loosened rein contending,  Like two bright mother cows who lick their youngling, Vipāś and Sutudri speed down their waters.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रेषिते परसवं भिक्षमाणे अछा समुद्रं रथ्येव याथः समाराणे ऊर्मिभिः पिन्वमाने अन्या वामन्यामप्येति शुभ्रे |||
verses.transliteration: indreṣite prasavaṃ bhikṣamāṇe achā samudraṃ rathyeva yāthaḥ samārāṇe ūrmibhiḥ pinvamāne anyā vāmanyāmapyeti śubhre

translations.griffith: Impelled by Indra whom ye pray to urge you, ye move as ’twere on chariots to the ocean.  Flowing together, swelling with your billows, O lucid Streams, each of you seeks the other.

verses.sanskrit: अछा सिन्धुं मात्र्तमामयासं विपाशमुर्वीं सुभगामगन्म वत्समिव मातरा संरिहाणे समानं योनिमनु संचरन्ती |||
verses.transliteration: achā sindhuṃ mātṛtamāmayāsaṃ vipāśamurvīṃ subhaghāmaghanma vatsamiva mātarā saṃrihāṇe samānaṃ yonimanu saṃcarantī

translations.griffith: I have attained the most maternal River, we have approached Vipāś, the broad, the blessed.  Licking as ’twere their calf the pair of Mothers flow onward to their common home together.

verses.sanskrit: एन वयं पयसा पिन्वमाना अनु योनिं देवक्र्तं चरन्तीः न वर्तवे परसवः सर्गतक्तः किंयुर्विप्रो नद्यो जोहवीति |||
verses.transliteration: ena vayaṃ payasā pinvamānā anu yoniṃ devakṛtaṃ carantīḥ na vartave prasavaḥ sarghataktaḥ kiṃyurvipro nadyo johavīti

translations.griffith: We two who rise and swell with billowy waters move forward to the home which Gods have made us.  Our flood may not be stayed when urged to motion. What would the singer, calling to the Rivers?

verses.sanskrit: रमध्वं मे वचसे सोम्याय रतावरीरुप मुहूर्तमेवैः पर सिन्धुमछा बर्हती मनीषावस्युरह्वे कुशिकस्य सूनुः |||
verses.transliteration: ramadhvaṃ me vacase somyāya ṛtāvarīrupa muhūrtamevaiḥ pra sindhumachā bṛhatī manīṣāvasyurahve kuśikasya sūnuḥ

translations.griffith: Linger a little at my friendly bidding rest, Holy Ones, a moment in your journey.  With hymn sublime soliciting your favour Kuśika's son hath called unto the River.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रो अस्मानरदद वज्रबाहुरपाहन वर्त्रं परिधिं नदीनाम देवो.अनयत सवित सुपाणिस्तस्य वयं परसवे याम उर्वीः |||
verses.transliteration: indro asmānaradad vajrabāhurapāhan vṛtraṃ paridhiṃ nadīnām devo.anayat savita supāṇistasya vayaṃ prasave yāma urvīḥ

translations.griffith: Indra who wields the thunder dug our channels: he smote down Vṛtra, him who stayed our currents.  Savitar, God, the lovely-handed, led us, and at his sending forth we flow expanded.

verses.sanskrit: परवाच्यं शश्वधा वीर्यं तदिन्द्रस्य कर्म यदहिंविव्र्श्चत वि वज्रेण परिषदो जघानायन्नापो.अयनमिछमानाः |||
verses.transliteration: pravācyaṃ śaśvadhā vīryaṃ tadindrasya karma yadahiṃvivṛścat vi vajreṇa pariṣado jaghānāyannāpo.ayanamichamānāḥ

translations.griffith: That hero deed of Indra must be lauded for ever that he rent Ahi in pieces.  He smote away the obstructors with his thunder, and eager for their course forth flowed the waters.

verses.sanskrit: एतद वचो जरितर्मापि मर्ष्ठा आ यत ते घोषानुत्तरा युगानि उक्थेषु कारो परति नो जुषस्व मा नो नि कः पुरुषत्रा नमस्ते |||
verses.transliteration: etad vaco jaritarmāpi mṛṣṭhā ā yat te ghoṣānuttarā yughāni uktheṣu kāro prati no juṣasva mā no ni kaḥ puruṣatrā namaste

translations.griffith: Never forget this word of thine, O singer, which future generations shall reecho.  In hymns, O bard, show us thy loving kindness. Humble us not mid men. To thee be honour!

verses.sanskrit: ओ षु सवसारः कारवे शर्णोत ययौ वो दूरादनसा रथेन नि षू नमध्वं भवता सुपारा अधोक्षाः सिन्धवःस्रोत्याभिः |||
verses.transliteration: o ṣu svasāraḥ kārave śṛṇota yayau vo dūrādanasā rathena ni ṣū namadhvaṃ bhavatā supārā adhoakṣāḥ sindhavaḥsrotyābhiḥ

translations.griffith: List quickly, Sisters, to the bard who cometh to you from far away with car and wagon.  Bow lowly down; be easy to be traversed stay, Rivers, with your floods below our axles.

verses.sanskrit: आ ते कारो शर्णवामा वचांसि ययाथ दूरादनसा रथेन नि ते नंसै पीप्यानेव योषा मर्यायेव कन्या शश्वचै ते |||
verses.transliteration: ā te kāro śṛṇavāmā vacāṃsi yayātha dūrādanasā rathena ni te naṃsai pīpyāneva yoṣā maryāyeva kanyā śaśvacai te

translations.griffith: Yea, we will listen to thy words, O singer. With wain and car from far away thou comest.  Low, like a nursing mother, will I bend me, and yield me as a maiden to her lover.

verses.sanskrit: यदङग तवा भरताः सन्तरेयुर्गव्यन गराम इषित इन्द्रजूतः अर्षादह परसवः सर्गतक्त आ वो वर्णे सुमतिं यज्ञियानाम |||
verses.transliteration: yadaṅgha tvā bharatāḥ santareyurghavyan ghrāma iṣita indrajūtaḥ arṣādaha prasavaḥ sarghatakta ā vo vṛṇe sumatiṃ yajñiyānām

translations.griffith: Soon as the Bharatas have fared across thee, the warrior band, urged on and sped by Indra,  Then let your streams flow on in rapid motion. I crave your favour who deserve our worship.

verses.sanskrit: अतारिषुर्भरता गव्यवः समभक्त विप्रः सुमतिं नदीनाम पर पिन्वध्वमिषयन्तीः सुराधा आ वक्षणाः पर्णध्वं यात शीभम |||
verses.transliteration: atāriṣurbharatā ghavyavaḥ samabhakta vipraḥ sumatiṃ nadīnām pra pinvadhvamiṣayantīḥ surādhā ā vakṣaṇāḥ pṛṇadhvaṃ yāta śībham

translations.griffith: The warrior host, the Bharatas, fared over the singer won the favour of the Rivers.  Swell with your billows, hasting, pouring riches. Fill full your channels, and roll swiftly onward.

verses.sanskrit: उद व ऊर्मिः शम्या हन्त्वापो योक्त्राणि मुञ्चत मादुष्क्र्तौ वयेनसाघ्न्यौ शूनमारताम |||
verses.transliteration: ud va ūrmiḥ śamyā hantvāpo yoktrāṇi muñcata māduṣkṛtau vyenasāghnyau śūnamāratām

translations.griffith: So let your wave bear up the pins, and ye, O Waters, spare the thongs;  And never may the pair of Bulls, harmless and sinless, waste away.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रः पूर्भिदातिरद दासमर्कैर्विदद्वसुर्दयमानो विशत्रून बरह्मजूतस्तन्वा वाव्र्धानो भूरिदात्र आप्र्णद रोदसी उभे |||
verses.transliteration: indraḥ pūrbhidātirad dāsamarkairvidadvasurdayamāno viśatrūn brahmajūtastanvā vāvṛdhāno bhūridātra āpṛṇad rodasī ubhe

translations.griffith: FORT-RENDER, Lord of Wealth, dispelling foemen, Indra with lightnings hath o’ercome the Dāsa.  Impelled by prayer and waxen great in body, he hath filled earth and heaven, the Bounteous Giver.

verses.sanskrit: मखस्य ते तविषस्य पर जूतिमियर्मि वाचमम्र्ताय भूषन इन्द्र कषितीनामसि मानुषीणां विशां दैवीनामुत पूर्वयावा |||
verses.transliteration: makhasya te taviṣasya pra jūtimiyarmi vācamamṛtāya bhūṣan indra kṣitīnāmasi mānuṣīṇāṃ viśāṃ daivīnāmuta pūrvayāvā

translations.griffith: I stimulate thy zeal, the Strong, the Hero decking my song of praise forth; Immortal.  O Indra, thou art equally the Leader of heavenly hosts and human generations.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रो वर्त्रमव्र्णोच्छर्धनीतिः पर मायिनाममिनाद वर्पणीतिः अहन वयंसमुशधग वनेष्वाविर्धेना अक्र्णोद राम्याणाम |||
verses.transliteration: indro vṛtramavṛṇocchardhanītiḥ pra māyināmaminād varpaṇītiḥ ahan vyaṃsamuśadhagh vaneṣvāvirdhenā akṛṇod rāmyāṇām

translations.griffith: Leading, his band Indra encompassed Vṛtra; weak grew the wily leader of enchanters.  He who burns fierce in forests slaughtered Vyaṁsa, and made the Milch-kine of the nights apparent.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रः सवर्षा जनयन्नहानि जिगायोशिग्भिः पर्तना अभिष्टिः परारोचयन मनवे केतुमह्नामविन्दज्ज्योतिर्ब्र्हतेरणाय |||
verses.transliteration: indraḥ svarṣā janayannahāni jighāyośighbhiḥ pṛtanā abhiṣṭiḥ prārocayan manave ketumahnāmavindajjyotirbṛhateraṇāya

translations.griffith: Indra, light-winner, days' Creator, conquered, victorious, hostile bands with those who loved him.  For man the days' bright ensign he illumined, and found the light for his joy and gladness.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रस्तुजो बर्हणा आ विवेश नर्वद दधानो नर्या पुरूणि अचेतयद धिय इमा जरित्रे परेमं वर्णमतिरच्छुक्रमासाम |||
verses.transliteration: indrastujo barhaṇā ā viveśa nṛvad dadhāno naryā purūṇi acetayad dhiya imā jaritre premaṃ varṇamatiracchukramāsām

translations.griffith: Forward to fiercely falling blows pressed Indra, herolike doing many hero exploits.  These holy songs he taught the bard who gaised him, and widely spread these Dawns' resplendent colour.

verses.sanskrit: महो महानि पनयन्त्यस्येन्द्रस्य कर्म सुक्र्ता पुरूणि वर्जनेन वर्जिनान सं पिपेष मायाभिर्दस्यून्रभिभूत्योजाः |||
verses.transliteration: maho mahāni panayantyasyendrasya karma sukṛtā purūṇi vṛjanena vṛjinān saṃ pipeṣa māyābhirdasyūnrabhibhūtyojāḥ

translations.griffith: They laud the mighty acts of him the Mighty, the many glorious deeds performed by Indra.  He in his strength, with all-surpassing prowess, through wondrous arts crushed the malignant Dasyus.

verses.sanskrit: युधेन्द्रो मह्ना वरिवश्चकार देवेभ्यः सत्पतिश्चर्षणिप्राः विवस्वतः सदने अस्य तानि विप्रा उक्थेभिः कवयोग्र्णन्ति |||
verses.transliteration: yudhendro mahnā varivaścakāra devebhyaḥ satpatiścarṣaṇiprāḥ vivasvataḥ sadane asya tāni viprā ukthebhiḥ kavayoghṛṇanti

translations.griffith: Lord of the brave, Indra who rules the people gave freedom to the Gods by might and battle.  Wise singers glorify with chanted praises these his achievements in Vivasvān's dwelling.

verses.sanskrit: सत्रासाहं वरेण्यं सहोदां ससवांसं सवरपश्च देवीः ससान यः पर्थिवीं दयामुतेमामिन्द्रं मदन्त्यनु धीरणासः |||
verses.transliteration: satrāsāhaṃ vareṇyaṃ sahodāṃ sasavāṃsaṃ svarapaśca devīḥ sasāna yaḥ pṛthivīṃ dyāmutemāmindraṃ madantyanu dhīraṇāsaḥ

translations.griffith: Excellent, Conqueror, the victory-giver, the winner of the light and Godlike Waters,  He who hath won this broad earth and this heaven, -in Indra they rejoice who love devotions.

verses.sanskrit: ससानात्यानुत सूर्यं ससानेन्द्रः ससान पुरुभोजसं गाम हिरण्ययमुत भोगं ससान हत्वी दस्यून परार्यंवर्णमावत |||
verses.transliteration: sasānātyānuta sūryaṃ sasānendraḥ sasāna purubhojasaṃ ghām hiraṇyayamuta bhoghaṃ sasāna hatvī dasyūn prāryaṃvarṇamāvat

translations.griffith: He gained possession of the Sun and Horses, Indra obtained the Cow who feedeth many.  Treasure of gold he won; he smote the Dasyus, and gave protection to the Āryan colour.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्र ओषधीरसनोदहानि वनस्पतीन्रसनोदन्तरिक्षम बिभेद वलं नुनुदे विवाचो.अथाभवद दमितद्भिक्रतूनाम |||
verses.transliteration: indra oṣadhīrasanodahāni vanaspatīnrasanodantarikṣam bibheda valaṃ nunude vivāco.athābhavad damitadbhikratūnām

translations.griffith: He took the plants and days for his possession; he gained the forest trees and air's mid-region.  Vala he cleft, and chased away opponents: thus was he tamer of the overweening.

verses.transliteration: śunaṃ huvema ...

translations.griffith: Call we on Maghavan, auspicious Indra, best Hero in the fight where spoil is gathered,  The Strong, who listens, who gives aid in battles, who slays the Vṛtras, wins and gathers treasures.

verses.sanskrit: तिष्ठा हरी रथ आ युज्यमाना याहि वायुर्न नियुतो नो अछ पिबास्यन्धो अभिस्र्ष्टो अस्मे इन्द्र सवाहा ररिमाते मदाय |||
verses.transliteration: tiṣṭhā harī ratha ā yujyamānā yāhi vāyurna niyuto no acha pibāsyandho abhisṛṣṭo asme indra svāhā rarimāte madāya

translations.griffith: MOUNT the Bay Horses to thy chariot harnessed, and come to us like Vāyu with his coursers.  Thou, hastening to us, shalt drink the Soma. Hail, Indra. We have poured it for thy rapture.

verses.sanskrit: उपाजिरा पुरुहूताय सप्ती हरी रथस्य धूर्ष्वा युनज्मि दरवद यथा सम्भ्र्तं विश्वतश्चिदुपेमं यज्ञमावहात इन्द्रम |||
verses.transliteration: upājirā puruhūtāya saptī harī rathasya dhūrṣvā yunajmi dravad yathā sambhṛtaṃ viśvataścidupemaṃ yajñamāvahāta indram

translations.griffith: For him, the God who is invoked by many, the two swift Bay Steeds to the pole I harness,  That they in fleet course may bring Indra hither, e’en to this sacrifice arranged completely.

verses.sanskrit: उपो नयस्व वर्षणा तपुष्पोतेमव तवं वर्षभ सवधावः गरसेतामश्वा वि मुचेह शोणा दिवे-दिवे सद्र्शीरद्धिधानाः |||
verses.transliteration: upo nayasva vṛṣaṇā tapuṣpotemava tvaṃ vṛṣabha svadhāvaḥ ghrasetāmaśvā vi muceha śoṇā dive-dive sadṛśīraddhidhānāḥ

translations.griffith: Bring the strong Steeds who drink the warm libation, and, Bull of Godlike nature, be thou gracious.  Let thy Steeds eat; set free thy Tawny Horses, and roasted grain like this consume thou daily.

verses.sanskrit: बरह्मणा ते बरह्मयुजा युनज्मि हरी सखाया सधमाद आशू सथिरं रथं सुखमिन्द्राधितिष्ठन परजानन विद्वानुप याहि सोमम |||
verses.transliteration: brahmaṇā te brahmayujā yunajmi harī sakhāyā sadhamāda āśū sthiraṃ rathaṃ sukhamindrādhitiṣṭhan prajānan vidvānupa yāhi somam

translations.griffith: Those who are yoked by prayer I harness, fleet friendly Bays who take their joy together.  Mounting thy firm and easy car, O Indra, wise and all-knowing come thou to the Soma.

verses.sanskrit: मा ते हरी वर्षणा वीतप्र्ष्ठा नि रीरमन यजमानासो अन्ये अत्यायाहि शश्वतो वयं ते.अरं सुतेभिः कर्णवामसोमैः |||
verses.transliteration: mā te harī vṛṣaṇā vītapṛṣṭhā ni rīraman yajamānāso anye atyāyāhi śaśvato vayaṃ te.araṃ sutebhiḥ kṛṇavāmasomaiḥ

translations.griffith: No other worshippers must stay beside them thy Bays, thy vigorous and smooth-backed Coursers.  Pass by them all and hasten onward hither: with Soma pressed we will prepare to feast thee.

verses.sanskrit: तवायं सोमस्त्वमेह्यर्वां छश्वत्तमं सुमना अस्यपाहि अस्मिन यज्ञे बर्हिष्या निषद्या दधिष्वेमं जठर इन्दुमिन्द्र |||
verses.transliteration: tavāyaṃ somastvamehyarvāṃ chaśvattamaṃ sumanā asyapāhi asmin yajñe barhiṣyā niṣadyā dadhiṣvemaṃ jaṭhara indumindra

translations.griffith: Thine is this Soma: hasten to approach it. Drink thou thereof, benevolent, and cease not.  Sit on the sacred grass at this our worship, and take these drops into thy belly, Indra.

verses.sanskrit: सतीर्णं ते बर्हिः सुत इन्द्र सोमः कर्ता धाना अत्तवे तेहरिभ्याम तदोकसे पुरुशाकाय वर्ष्णे मरुत्वते तुभ्यंराता हवींषि |||
verses.transliteration: stīrṇaṃ te barhiḥ suta indra somaḥ kṛtā dhānā attave teharibhyām tadokase puruśākāya vṛṣṇe marutvate tubhyaṃrātā havīṃṣi

translations.griffith: The grass is strewn for thee, pressed is the Soma; the grain is ready for thy Bays to feed on.  To thee who lovest them, the very mighty, strong, girt by Maruts, are these gifts presented.

verses.sanskrit: इमं नरः पर्वतास्तुभ्यमापः समिन्द्र गोभिर्मधुमन्तमक्रन तस्यागत्या सुमना रष्व पाहि परजानन विद्वान पथ्या अनु सवाः |||
verses.transliteration: imaṃ naraḥ parvatāstubhyamāpaḥ samindra ghobhirmadhumantamakran tasyāghatyā sumanā ṛṣva pāhi prajānan vidvān pathyā anu svāḥ

translations.griffith: This the sweet draught, with cows, the men, the mountains, the waters, Indra, have for thee made ready.  Come, drink thereof, Sublime One, friendly-minded, foreseeing, knowing well the ways thou goest.

verses.sanskrit: यानाभजो मरुत इन्द्र सोमे ये तवामवर्धन्नभवन गणस्ते तेभिरेतं सजोषा वावशानो.अग्नेः पिब जिह्वयासोममिन्द्र |||
verses.transliteration: yānābhajo maruta indra some ye tvāmavardhannabhavan ghaṇaste tebhiretaṃ sajoṣā vāvaśāno.aghneḥ piba jihvayāsomamindra

translations.griffith: The Maruts, they with whom thou sharedst Soma, Indra, who made thee strong and were thine army,—  With these accordant, eagerly desirous drink thou this Soma with the tongue of Agni.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्र पिब सवधया चित सुतस्याग्नेर्वा पाहि जिह्वया यजत्र अध्वर्योर्वा परयतं शक्र हस्ताद धोतुर्वा यज्ञं हविषो जुषस्व |||
verses.transliteration: indra piba svadhayā cit sutasyāghnervā pāhi jihvayā yajatra adhvaryorvā prayataṃ śakra hastād dhoturvā yajñaṃ haviṣo juṣasva

translations.griffith: Drink, Indra, of the juice by thine own nature, or by the tongue of Agni, O thou Holy.  Accept the sacrificial gift, O Śakra, from the Adhvaryu's hand or from the Hotar's.

verses.transliteration: śunaṃ huvema ...

translations.griffith: Call we on Maghavan, auspicious Indra, best Hero in the fight where spoil is gathered,  The Strong, who listens, who.gives aid in battles, who slays the Vṛtras, wins and gathers riches.

verses.sanskrit: इमामू षु परभ्र्तिं सातये धाः शश्वचः छश्वदूतिभिर्यादमानः सुते-सुते वाव्र्धे वर्धनेभिर्यः कर्मभिर्महद्भिः सुश्रुतो भूत |||
verses.transliteration: imāmū ṣu prabhṛtiṃ sātaye dhāḥ śaśvacḥ chaśvadūtibhiryādamānaḥ sute-sute vāvṛdhe vardhanebhiryaḥ karmabhirmahadbhiḥ suśruto bhūt

translations.griffith: WITH constant succours, fain thyself to share it, make this oblation which we bring effective.  Grown great through strengthening gifts at each libation, he hath become renowned by mighty exploits.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्राय सोमाः परदिवो विदाना रभुर्येभिर्व्र्षपर्वा विहायाः परयम्यमानान परति षू गर्भायेन्द्र पिब वर्षधूतस्य वर्ष्णः |||
verses.transliteration: indrāya somāḥ pradivo vidānā ṛbhuryebhirvṛṣaparvā vihāyāḥ prayamyamānān prati ṣū ghṛbhāyendra piba vṛṣadhūtasya vṛṣṇaḥ

translations.griffith: For Indra were the Somas erst- discovered, whereby he grew strong-jointed, vast, and skilful.  Indra , take quickly these presented juices: drink of the strong, that which the strong have shaken.

verses.sanskrit: पिबा वर्धस्व तव घा सुतास इन्द्र सोमासः परथमा उतेमे यथापिबः पूर्व्यानिन्द्र सोमानेवा पाहि पन्यो अद्या नवीयान |||
verses.transliteration: pibā vardhasva tava ghā sutāsa indra somāsaḥ prathamā uteme yathāpibaḥ pūrvyānindra somānevā pāhi panyo adyā navīyān

translations.griffith: Drink and wax great. Thine are the juices, Indra, both Somas of old time and these we bring thee.  Even as thou drankest, Indra, earlier Somas, so drink to-day, a new guest, meet for praises.

verses.sanskrit: महानमत्रो वर्जने विरप्श्युग्रं शवः पत्यते धर्ष्ण्वोजः नाह विव्याच पर्थिवी चनैनं यत सोमासो हर्यश्वममन्दन |||
verses.transliteration: mahānamatro vṛjane virapśyughraṃ śavaḥ patyate dhṛṣṇvojaḥ nāha vivyāca pṛthivī canainaṃ yat somāso haryaśvamamandan

translations.griffith: Great and impetuous, mighty-voiced in battle, surpassing power is his, and strength resistless.  Him the broad earth hath never comprehended when Somas cheered the Lord of Tawny Coursers.

verses.sanskrit: महानुग्रो वाव्र्धे वीर्याय समाचक्रे वर्षभः काव्येन इन्द्रो भगो वाजदा अस्य गावः पर जायन्ते दक्षिणा अस्य पूर्वीः |||
verses.transliteration: mahānughro vāvṛdhe vīryāya samācakre vṛṣabhaḥ kāvyena indro bhagho vājadā asya ghāvaḥ pra jāyante dakṣiṇā asya pūrvīḥ

translations.griffith: Mighty and strong he waxed for hero exploit: the Bull was furnished a Sage's wisdom.  Indra is our kind Lord; his steers have vigour; his cows are many with abundant offspring.

verses.sanskrit: पर यत सिन्धवः परसवं यथायन्नापः समुद्रं रथ्येव जग्मुः अतश्चिदिन्द्रः सदसो वरीयान यदीं सोमः पर्णति दुग्धो अंशुः |||
verses.transliteration: pra yat sindhavaḥ prasavaṃ yathāyannāpaḥ samudraṃ rathyeva jaghmuḥ ataścidindraḥ sadaso varīyān yadīṃ somaḥ pṛṇati dughdho aṃśuḥ

translations.griffith: As floods according to their stream flow onward, so to the sea, as borne on cars, the waters.  Vaster is Indra even than his dwelling, what time the stalk milked out, the Soma, fills him.

verses.sanskrit: समुद्रेण सिन्धवो यादमाना इन्द्राय सोमं सुषुतं भरन्तः अंशुं दुहन्ति हस्तिनो भरित्रैर्मध्वः पुनन्ति धारया पवित्रैः |||
verses.transliteration: samudreṇa sindhavo yādamānā indrāya somaṃ suṣutaṃ bharantaḥ aṃśuṃ duhanti hastino bharitrairmadhvaḥ punanti dhārayā pavitraiḥ

translations.griffith: Eager to mingle with the sea, the rivers carry the well-pressed Soma juice to Indra.  They drain the stalk out with their arms, quick-banded, and cleanse it with a stream of mead and filters.

verses.sanskrit: हरदा इव कुक्षयः सोमधानाः समी विव्याच सवना पुरूणि अन्ना यदिन्द्रः परथमा वयाश वर्त्रं जघन्वानव्र्णीत सोमम |||
verses.transliteration: hradā iva kukṣayaḥ somadhānāḥ samī vivyāca savanā purūṇi annā yadindraḥ prathamā vyāśa vṛtraṃ jaghanvānavṛṇīta somam

translations.griffith: Like lakes appear his flanks filled full with Soma: yea, he contains libations in abundance.  When Indra had consumed the first sweet viands, he, after slaying Vṛtra, claimed the Soma.
