verses.sanskrit: आ तू भर माकिरेतत परि षठाद विद्मा हि तवा वसुपतिं वसूनाम इन्द्र यत ते माहिनं दत्रमस्त्यस्मभ्यं तद धर्यश्व पर यन्धि |||
verses.transliteration: ā tū bhara mākiretat pari ṣṭhād vidmā hi tvā vasupatiṃ vasūnām indra yat te māhinaṃ datramastyasmabhyaṃ tad dharyaśva pra yandhi

translations.griffith: Then bring thou hither, and let none prevent it: we know thee well, the Lord of wealth and treasure.  That splendid gift which is thine own, O Indra, vouchsafe to us, Lord of the Tawny Coursers.

verses.sanskrit: अस्मे पर यन्धि मघवन्न्र्जीषिन्निन्द्र रायो विश्ववारस्य भूरेः अस्मे शतं शरदो जीवसे धा अस्मे वीरान छश्वत इन्द्र शिप्रिन |||
verses.transliteration: asme pra yandhi maghavannṛjīṣinnindra rāyo viśvavārasya bhūreḥ asme śataṃ śarado jīvase dhā asme vīrān chaśvata indra śiprin

translations.griffith: O Indra, Maghavan, impetuous mover, grant us abundant wealth that brings all blessings.  Give us a hundred autumns for our lifetime: give us, O fair-checked Indra, store of heroes.

verses.transliteration: śunaṃ huvema ...

translations.griffith: Call we on Indra, Maghavan, auspicious, best Hero in the fight where spoil is gathered,  The Strong, who listens, who gives aid in battles, who slays the Vṛtras, wins and gathers riches.

verses.sanskrit: वार्त्रहत्याय शवसे पर्तनाषाह्याय च इन्द्र तवा वर्तयामसि |||
verses.transliteration: vārtrahatyāya śavase pṛtanāṣāhyāya ca indra tvā vartayāmasi

translations.griffith: O INDRA, for the strength that slays Vṛtra and conquers in the fight,  We turn thee hitherward to us.

verses.sanskrit: अर्वाचीनं सु ते मन उत चक्षुः शतक्रतो इन्द्र कर्ण्वन्तु वाघतः |||
verses.transliteration: arvācīnaṃ su te mana uta cakṣuḥ śatakrato indra kṛṇvantu vāghataḥ

translations.griffith: O Indra, Lord of Hundred Powers, may those who praise thee hitherward.  Direct thy spirit and thine eye.

verses.sanskrit: नामानि ते शतक्रतो विश्वाभिर्गीर्भिरीमहे इन्द्राभिमातिषाह्ये |||
verses.transliteration: nāmāni te śatakrato viśvābhirghīrbhirīmahe indrābhimātiṣāhye

translations.griffith: O Indra, Lord of Hundred Powers, with all our songs we invocate  Thy names for triumph over foes.

verses.sanskrit: पुरुष्टुतस्य धामभिः शतेन महयामसि इन्द्रस्य चर्षणीध्र्तः |||
verses.transliteration: puruṣṭutasya dhāmabhiḥ śatena mahayāmasi indrasya carṣaṇīdhṛtaḥ

translations.griffith: We strive for glory through the powers immense of him whom many praise,  Of Indra who supports mankind.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रं वर्त्राय हन्तवे पुरुहूतमुप बरुवे भरेषु वाजसातये |||
verses.transliteration: indraṃ vṛtrāya hantave puruhūtamupa bruve bhareṣu vājasātaye

translations.griffith: For Vṛtra's slaughter I address Indra whom many invocate,  To win us booty in the wars.

verses.sanskrit: वाजेषु सासहिर्भव तवामीमहे शतक्रतो इन्द्र वर्त्रायहन्तवे |||
verses.transliteration: vājeṣu sāsahirbhava tvāmīmahe śatakrato indra vṛtrāyahantave

translations.griffith: In battles be victorious. We seek thee, Lord of Hundred Powers,  Indra, that Vṛtra may be slain.

verses.sanskrit: दयुम्नेषु पर्तनाज्ये पर्त्सुतूर्षु शरवस्सु च इन्द्र साक्ष्वाभिमातिषु |||
verses.transliteration: dyumneṣu pṛtanājye pṛtsutūrṣu śravassu ca indra sākṣvābhimātiṣu

translations.griffith: In splendid combats of the hosts, in glories where the fight is won.  Indra, be victor over foes.

verses.sanskrit: शुष्मिन्तमं न ऊतये दयुम्निनं पाहि जाग्र्विम इन्द्र सोमंशतक्रतो |||
verses.transliteration: śuṣmintamaṃ na ūtaye dyumninaṃ pāhi jāghṛvim indra somaṃśatakrato

translations.griffith: Drink thou the Soma for our help, bright, vigilant, exceeding strong,  O Indra, Lord of Hundred Powers.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रियाणि शतक्रतो या ते जनेषु पञ्चसु इन्द्र तानि ता वर्णे |||
verses.transliteration: indriyāṇi śatakrato yā te janeṣu pañcasu indra tāni taā vṛṇe

translations.griffith: O Śatakratu, powers which thou mid the Five Races hast displayed-  These, Indra, do I claim of thee.

verses.sanskrit: अगन्निन्द्र शरवो बर्हद दयुम्नं दधिष्व दुष्टरम उत ते शुष्मं तिरामसि |||
verses.transliteration: aghannindra śravo bṛhad dyumnaṃ dadhiṣva duṣṭaram ut te śuṣmaṃ tirāmasi

translations.griffith: Indra, great glory hast thou gained. Win splendid fame which none may mar  We make thy might perpetual.

verses.sanskrit: अर्वावतो न आ गह्यथो शक्र परावतः उ लोको यस्ते अद्रिव इन्द्रेह तत आ गहि |||
verses.transliteration: arvāvato na ā ghahyatho śakra parāvataḥ u loko yaste adriva indreha tata ā ghahi

translations.griffith: Come to us either from anear, Or, Śakra, come from far away.  Indra, wherever be thy home, come to us thence, O Thunder-armed.

verses.sanskrit: अभि तष्टेव दीधया मनीषामत्यो न वाजी सुधुरो जिहानः अभि परियाणि मर्म्र्शत पराणि कवीन्रिछामि सन्द्र्शे सुमेधाः |||
verses.transliteration: abhi taṣṭeva dīdhayā manīṣāmatyo na vājī sudhuro jihānaḥ abhi priyāṇi marmṛśat parāṇi kavīnrichāmi sandṛśe sumedhāḥ

translations.griffith: HASTING like some strong courser good at drawing, a thought have I imagined like a workman.  Pondering what is dearest and most noble, I long to see the sages full of wisdom.

verses.sanskrit: इनोत पर्छ जनिमा कवीनां मनोध्र्तः सुक्र्तस्तक्षत दयाम इमा उ ते परण्यो वर्धमाना मनोवाता अध नु धर्मणिग्मन |||
verses.transliteration: inota pṛcha janimā kavīnāṃ manodhṛtaḥ sukṛtastakṣata dyām imā u te praṇyo vardhamānā manovātā adha nu dharmaṇighman

translations.griffith: Ask of the sages' mighty generations firm-minded and devout they framed the heaven.  These are thy heart-sought strengthening directions, and they have come to be sky's upholders.

verses.sanskrit: नि षीमिदत्र गुह्या दधाना उत कषत्राय रोदसी समञ्जन सं मात्राभिर्ममिरे येमुर उर्वी अन्तर मही सम्र्ते धायसे धुः |||
verses.transliteration: ni ṣīmidatra ghuhyā dadhānā uta kṣatrāya rodasī samañjan saṃ mātrābhirmamire yemur urvī antar mahī samṛte dhāyase dhuḥ

translations.griffith: Assuming in this world mysterious natures, they decked the heaven and earth for high dominion,  Measured with measures, fixed their broad expanses, set the great worlds apart held firm for safety.

verses.sanskrit: आतिष्ठन्तं परि विश्वे अभूषञ्छ्रियो वसानश्चरति सवरोचिः महत तद वर्ष्णो असुरस्य नामा विश्वरूपो अम्र्तानि तस्थौ |||
verses.transliteration: ātiṣṭhantaṃ pari viśve abhūṣañchriyo vasānaścarati svarociḥ mahat tad vṛṣṇo asurasya nāmā viśvarūpo amṛtāni tasthau

translations.griffith: Even as he mounted up they all adorned him: self-luminous he travels clothed in splendour.  That is the Bull's, the Asura's mighty figure: he, omniform, hath reached the eternal waters.

verses.sanskrit: असूत पूर्वो वर्षभो जयायानिमा अस्य शुरुधः सन्ति पूर्वीः दिवो नपाता विदथस्य धीभिः कषत्रं राजाना परदिवो दधाथे |||
verses.transliteration: asūta pūrvo vṛṣabho jyāyānimā asya śurudhaḥ santi pūrvīḥ divo napātā vidathasya dhībhiḥ kṣatraṃ rājānā pradivo dadhāthe

translations.griffith: First the more ancient Bull engendered offspring; these are his many draughts that lent him vigour.  From days of old ye Kings, two Sons of Heaven, by hymns of sacrifice have won dominion.

verses.sanskrit: तरीणि राजाना विदथे पुरूणि परि विश्वानि भूषथः सदांसि अपश्यमत्र मनसा जगन्वान वरते गन्धर्वानपि वायुकेशान |||
verses.transliteration: trīṇi rājānā vidathe purūṇi pari viśvāni bhūṣathaḥ sadāṃsi apaśyamatra manasā jaghanvān vrate ghandharvānapi vāyukeśān

translations.griffith: Three seats ye Sovrans, in the Holy synod, many, yea, all, ye honour with your presence.  There saw I, going thither in the spirit, Gandharvas in their course with wind-blown tresses.

verses.sanskrit: तदिन नवस्य वर्षभस्य धेनोरा नामभिर्ममिरे सक्म्यंगोः अन्यद-अन्यदसुर्यं वसाना नि मायिनो ममिरे रूपमस्मिन |||
verses.transliteration: tadin nvasya vṛṣabhasya dhenorā nāmabhirmamire sakmyaṃghoḥ anyad-anyadasuryaṃ vasānā ni māyino mamire rūpamasmin

translations.griffith: That same companionship of her, the Milch-cow, here with the strong Bull's divers forms they stablished.  Enduing still some new celestial figure, the skilful workers shaped a form around him.

verses.sanskrit: तदिन नवस्य सवितुर्नकिर्मे हिरण्ययीममतिं यामशिश्रेत आ सुष्टुती रोदसी विश्वमिन्वे अपीव योषा जनिमानि वव्रे |||
verses.transliteration: tadin nvasya saviturnakirme hiraṇyayīmamatiṃ yāmaśiśret ā suṣṭutī rodasī viśvaminve apīva yoṣā janimāni vavre

translations.griffith: Let no one here debar me from enjoying the golden light which Savitar diffuses.  He covers both all-fostering worlds with praises even as a woman cherishes her children.

verses.sanskrit: युवं परत्नस्य साधथो महो यद दैवी सवस्तिः परि णः सयातम गोपाजिह्वस्य तस्थुषो विरूपा विश्वे पश्यन्ति मायिनः कर्तानि |||
verses.transliteration: yuvaṃ pratnasya sādhatho maho yad daivī svastiḥ pari ṇaḥ syātam ghopājihvasya tasthuṣo virūpā viśve paśyanti māyinaḥ kṛtāni

translations.griffith: Fulfil, ye twain, his work, the Great, the Ancient: as heavenly blessing keep your guard around us.  All the wise Gods behold his varied actions who stands erect, whose voice is like a herdsman's.

verses.transliteration: śunaṃ huvema ...

translations.griffith: Call we on Indra, Maghavan, auspicious, best Hero in the fight where spoil is gathered,  The Strong, who listens, who gives aid in battles, who slays the Vṛtras, wins and gathers riches.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रं मतिर्ह्र्द आ वच्यमानाछा पतिं सतोमतष्टा जिगाति या जाग्र्विर्विदथे शस्यमानेन्द्र यत ते जायते विद्धि तस्य |||
verses.transliteration: indraṃ matirhṛda ā vacyamānāchā patiṃ stomataṣṭā jighāti yā jāghṛvirvidathe śasyamānendra yat te jāyate viddhi tasya

translations.griffith: To Indra from the heart the hymn proceedeth, to him the Lord, recited, built with praises;  The wakening song sung forth in holy synod: that which is born for thee, O Indra, notice.

verses.sanskrit: दिवश्चिदा पूर्व्या जायमाना वि जाग्र्विर्विदथे शस्यमाना भद्रा वस्त्राण्यर्जुना वसाना सेयमस्मे सनजापित्र्या धीः |||
verses.transliteration: divaścidā pūrvyā jāyamānā vi jāghṛvirvidathe śasyamānā bhadrā vastrāṇyarjunā vasānā seyamasme sanajāpitryā dhīḥ

translations.griffith: Born from the heaven e’en in the days aforetime, wakening, sting aloud in holy synod,  Auspicious, clad in white and shining raiment, this is the ancient hymn of our forefathers.

verses.sanskrit: यमा चिदत्र यमसूरसूत जिह्वाया अग्रं पतदा हयस्थात वपूंषि जाता मिथुना सचेते तमोहना तपुषो बुध्न एता |||
verses.transliteration: yamā cidatra yamasūrasūta jihvāyā aghraṃ patadā hyasthāt vapūṃṣi jātā mithunā sacete tamohanā tapuṣo budhna etā

translations.griffith: The Mother of the Twins hath borne Twin Children: my tongue's tip raised itself and rested silent.  Killing the darkness at the light's foundation, the Couple newly born attain their beauty.

verses.sanskrit: नकिरेषां निन्दिता मर्त्येषु ये अस्माकं पितरो गोषु योधाः इन्द्र एषां दरंहिता माहिनावानुद गोत्राणि सस्र्जे दंसनावान |||
verses.transliteration: nakireṣāṃ ninditā martyeṣu ye asmākaṃ pitaro ghoṣu yodhāḥ indra eṣāṃ dṛṃhitā māhināvānud ghotrāṇi sasṛje daṃsanāvān

translations.griffith: Not one is found among them, none of mortals, to blame our sires who fought to win the cattle.  Their strengthener was Indra the Majestic he spread their stalls of kine the Wonder-Worker.

verses.sanskrit: सखा ह यत्र सखिभिर्नवग्वैरभिज्ञ्वा सत्वभिर्गा अनुग्मन सत्यं तदिन्द्रो दसभिर्दशग्भिः सूर्यं विवेदतमसि कषियन्तम |||
verses.transliteration: sakhā ha yatra sakhibhirnavaghvairabhijñvā satvabhirghā anughman satyaṃ tadindro dasabhirdaśaghbhiḥ sūryaṃ vivedatamasi kṣiyantam

translations.griffith: Where as a Friend with friendly men, Navagvas, with heroes, on his knees he sought the cattle.  There, verily with ten Daśagvas Indra found the Sun lying hidden in the darkness.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रो मधु सम्भ्र्तमुस्रियायां पद्वद विवेद शफवन नमेगोः गुहा हितं गुह्यं गूळ्हमप्सु हस्ते दधे दक्षिणे दक्षिणावान |||
verses.transliteration: indro madhu sambhṛtamusriyāyāṃ padvad viveda śaphavan nameghoḥ ghuhā hitaṃ ghuhyaṃ ghūḷhamapsu haste dadhe dakṣiṇe dakṣiṇāvān

translations.griffith: Indra found meath collected in the milch-cow, by foot and hoof, in the cow's place of pasture.  That which lay secret, hidden in the waters, he held in his right hand, the rich rewarder.

verses.sanskrit: जयोतिर्व्र्णीत तमसो विजानन्नारे सयाम दुरितादभीके इमा गिरः सोमपाः सोमव्र्द्ध जुषस्वेन्द्र पुरुतमस्य कारोः |||
verses.transliteration: jyotirvṛṇīta tamaso vijānannāre syāma duritādabhīke imā ghiraḥ somapāḥ somavṛddha juṣasvendra purutamasya kāroḥ

translations.griffith: He took the light, discerning it from darkness: may we be far removed from all misfortune.  These songs, O Soma-drinker, cheered by Soma, Indra, accept from thy most zealous poet.

verses.sanskrit: जयोतिर्यज्ञाय रोदसी अनु षयादारे सयाम दुरितस्य भूरेः भूरि चिद धि तुजतो मर्त्यस्य सुपारासो वसवो बर्हणावत |||
verses.transliteration: jyotiryajñāya rodasī anu ṣyādāre syāma duritasya bhūreḥ bhūri cid dhi tujato martyasya supārāso vasavo barhaṇāvat

translations.griffith: Let there be light through both the worlds for worship: may we be far from most overwhelming evil.  Great woe comes even from the hostile mortal, piled up; but good at rescue are the Vasus.

verses.transliteration: śunaṃ huvema ...

translations.griffith: Call we on Maghavan, auspicious Indra, best Hero in the fight where spoil is gathered,  The Strong, who listens, who gives aid in battles, who slays the Vṛtras, wins and gathers riches.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्र तवा वर्षभं वयं सुते सोमे हवामहे स पाहि मध्वो अन्धसः |||
verses.transliteration: indra tvā vṛṣabhaṃ vayaṃ sute some havāmahe sa pāhi madhvo andhasaḥ

translations.griffith: THEE, Indra, we invoke, the Bull, what time the Soma is expressed.  So drink thou of the savoury juice.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्र करतुविदं सुतं सोमं हर्य पुरुष्टुत पिबा वर्षस्व तात्र्पिम |||
verses.transliteration: indra kratuvidaṃ sutaṃ somaṃ harya puruṣṭuta pibā vṛṣasva tātṛpim

translations.griffith: Indra, whom many laud, accept the strength-conferring Soma juice:  Quaff, pour down drink that satisfies.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्र पर णो धितावानं यज्ञं विश्वेभिर्देवेभिः तिर सतवान विश्पते |||
verses.transliteration: indra pra ṇo dhitāvānaṃ yajñaṃ viśvebhirdevebhiḥ tira stavāna viśpate

translations.griffith: Indra, with all the Gods promote our wealth-bestowing sacrifice,  Thou highly-lauded Lord of men.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्र सोमाः सुता इमे तव पर यन्ति सत्पते कषयं चन्द्रास इन्दवः |||
verses.transliteration: indra somāḥ sutā ime tava pra yanti satpate kṣayaṃ candrāsa indavaḥ

translations.griffith: Lord of the brave, to thee proceed these drops of Soma juice expressed,  The bright drops to thy dwelling-place.

verses.sanskrit: दधिष्वा जठरे सुतं सोममिन्द्र वरेण्यम तव दयुक्षास इन्दवः |||
verses.transliteration: dadhiṣvā jaṭhare sutaṃ somamindra vareṇyam tava dyukṣāsa indavaḥ

translations.griffith: Within thy belly, Indra, take juice, Soma the most excellent: Thine are the drops celestial.

verses.sanskrit: गिर्वणः पाहि नः सुतं मधोर्धाराभिरज्यसे इन्द्र तवादातमिद यशः |||
verses.transliteration: ghirvaṇaḥ pāhi naḥ sutaṃ madhordhārābhirajyase indra tvādātamid yaśaḥ

translations.griffith: Drink our libation, Lord of hymns: with streams of meath thou art bedewed  Our glory, Indra, is thy gift.

verses.sanskrit: अभि दयुम्नानि वनिन इन्द्रं सचन्ते अक्षिता पीत्वी सोमस्य वाव्र्धे |||
verses.transliteration: abhi dyumnāni vanina indraṃ sacante akṣitā pītvī somasya vāvṛdhe

translations.griffith: To Indra go the treasures of the worshipper, which never fail:  He drinks the Soma and is strong

verses.sanskrit: अर्वावतो न आ गहि परावतश्च वर्त्रहन इमा जुषस्व नो गिरः |||
verses.transliteration: arvāvato na ā ghahi parāvataśca vṛtrahan imā juṣasva no ghiraḥ

translations.griffith: From far away, from near at hand, O Vṛtra-slayer, come to us:  Accept the songs we sing to thee.

verses.sanskrit: यदन्तरा परावतमर्वावतं च हूयसे इन्द्रेह तत आ गहि |||
verses.transliteration: yadantarā parāvatamarvāvataṃ ca hūyase indreha tata ā ghahi

translations.griffith: When from the space between the near and far thou art invoked by us,  Thence, Indra. come thou hitherward.

verses.sanskrit: आ तू न इन्द्र मद्र्यग घुवानः सोमपीतये हरिभ्यां याह्यद्रिवः |||
verses.transliteration: ā tū na indra madryagh ghuvānaḥ somapītaye haribhyāṃ yāhyadrivaḥ

translations.griffith: INVOKED to drink the Soma juice, come with thy Bay Steeds, Thunder-armed  Come, Indra, hitherward to me.

verses.sanskrit: सत्तो होता न रत्वियस्तिस्तिरे बर्हिरानुषक अयुज्रन परातरद्रयः |||
verses.transliteration: satto hotā na ṛtviyastistire barhirānuṣak ayujran prātaradrayaḥ

translations.griffith: Our priest is seated, true to time; the grass is regularly strewn;  The pressing-stones were set at morn.

verses.sanskrit: इमा बरह्म बरह्मवाहः करियन्त आ बर्हिः सीद वीहि शूर पुरोळाशम |||
verses.transliteration: imā brahma brahmavāhaḥ kriyanta ā barhiḥ sīda vīhi śūra puroḷāśam

translations.griffith: These prayers, O thou who hearest prayer are offered: seat thee on the grass.  Hero, enjoy the offered cake.

verses.sanskrit: रारन्धि सवनेषु ण एषु सतोमेषु वर्त्रहन उक्थेष्विन्द्र गिर्वणः |||
verses.transliteration: rārandhi savaneṣu ṇa eṣu stomeṣu vṛtrahan uktheṣvindra ghirvaṇaḥ

translations.griffith: O Vṛtra-slayer, be thou pleased with these libations, with these hymns,  Song-loving Indra, with our lauds.

verses.sanskrit: मतयः सोमपामुरुं रिहन्ति शवसस पतिम इन्द्रं वत्सं न मातरः |||
verses.transliteration: matayaḥ somapāmuruṃ rihanti śavasas patim indraṃ vatsaṃ na mātaraḥ

translations.griffith: Our hymns caress the Lord of Strength, vast, drinker of the Soma's juice,  Indra, as mother-cows their calf.

verses.sanskrit: स मन्दस्वा हयन्धसो राधसे तन्वा महे न सतोतारं निदे करः |||
verses.transliteration: sa mandasvā hyandhaso rādhase tanvā mahe na stotāraṃ nide karaḥ

translations.griffith: Delight thee with the juice we pour for thine own great munificence:  Yield not thy singer to reproach.

verses.sanskrit: वयमिन्द्र तवायवो हविष्मन्तो जरामहे उत तवमस्मयुर्वसो |||
verses.transliteration: vayamindra tvāyavo haviṣmanto jarāmahe uta tvamasmayurvaso

translations.griffith: We, Indra, dearly loving thee, bearing oblation, sing thee hymns  Thou, Vasu, dearly lovest us.

verses.sanskrit: मारे अस्मद वि मुमुचो हरिप्रियार्वां याहि इन्द्र सवधावोमत्स्वेह |||
verses.transliteration: māre asmad vi mumuco haripriyārvāṃ yāhi indra svadhāvomatsveha

translations.griffith: O thou to whom thy Bays are dear, loose not thy Horses far from us:  Here glad thee, Indra, Lord divine.

verses.sanskrit: अर्वाञ्चं तवा सुखे रथे वहतामिन्द्र केशिना घर्तस्नूबर्हिरासदे |||
verses.transliteration: arvāñcaṃ tvā sukhe rathe vahatāmindra keśinā ghṛtasnūbarhirāsade

translations.griffith: May long-maned Coursers, dropping oil, bring thee on swift car hitherward,  Indra, to seat thee on the grass.

verses.sanskrit: उप नः सुतमा गहि सोममिन्द्र गवाशिरम हरिभ्यां यस्ते अस्मयुः |||
verses.transliteration: upa naḥ sutamā ghahi somamindra ghavāśiram haribhyāṃ yaste asmayuḥ

translations.griffith: COME to the juice that we have pressed, to Soma, Indra, bleat with milk:  Come, favouring us, thy Bay-drawn car!

verses.sanskrit: तमिन्द्र मदमा गहि बर्हिष्ठां गरावभिः सुतम कुविन नवस्य तर्प्णवः |||
verses.transliteration: tamindra madamā ghahi barhiṣṭhāṃ ghrāvabhiḥ sutam kuvin nvasya tṛpṇavaḥ

translations.griffith: Come, Indra, to this gladdening drink, placed on the grass, pressed out with stones:  Wilt thou not drink thy fill thereof?

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रमित्था गिरो ममाछागुरिषिता इतः आव्र्ते सोमपीतये |||
verses.transliteration: indramitthā ghiro mamāchāghuriṣitā itaḥ āvṛte somapītaye

translations.griffith: To Indra have my songs of praise gone forth, thus rapidly sent hence,  To turn him to the Soma-draught.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रं सोमस्य पीतये सतोमैरिह हवामहे उक्थेभिः कुविदागमत |||
verses.transliteration: indraṃ somasya pītaye stomairiha havāmahe ukthebhiḥ kuvidāghamat

translations.griffith: Hither with songs of praise we call Indra to drink the Soma juice:  Will he not come to us by lauds?

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्र सोमाः सुता इमे तान दधिष्व शतक्रतो जठरे वाजिनीवसो |||
verses.transliteration: indra somāḥ sutā ime tān dadhiṣva śatakrato jaṭhare vājinīvaso

translations.griffith: Indra, these Somas are expressed. Take them within thy belly, Lord  Of Hundred Powers, thou Prince of Wealth.

verses.sanskrit: विद्मा हि तवा धनंजयं वाजेषु दध्र्षं कवे अधा तेसुम्नमीमहे |||
verses.transliteration: vidmā hi tvā dhanaṃjayaṃ vājeṣu dadhṛṣaṃ kave adhā tesumnamīmahe

translations.griffith: We know thee winner of the spoil, and resolute in battles, Sage!  Therefore thy blessing we implore.

verses.sanskrit: इममिन्द्र गवाशिरं यवाशिरं च नः पिब आगत्या वर्षभिः सुतम |||
verses.transliteration: imamindra ghavāśiraṃ yavāśiraṃ ca naḥ piba āghatyā vṛṣabhiḥ sutam

translations.griffith: Borne hither by thy Stallions, drink, Indra, this juice which we have pressed,  Mingled with barley and with milk.

verses.sanskrit: तुभ्येदिन्द्र सव ओक्ये सोमं चोदामि पीतये एष रारन्तु ते हर्दि |||
verses.transliteration: tubhyedindra sva okye somaṃ codāmi pītaye eṣa rārantu te hṛdi

translations.griffith: Indra, for thee, in thine own place, I urge the Soma for thy draught:  Deep in thy heart let it remain,

verses.sanskrit: तवां सुतस्य पीतये परत्नमिन्द्र हवामहे कुशिकासो अवस्यवः |||
verses.transliteration: tvāṃ sutasya pītaye pratnamindra havāmahe kuśikāso avasyavaḥ

translations.griffith: We call on thee, the Ancient One, Indra, to drink the Soma juice,  We Kuśikas who seek thine aid.

verses.sanskrit: आ याह्यर्वां उप वन्धुरेष्ठास्तवेदनु परदिवः सोमपेयम परिया सखाया वि मुचोप बर्हिस्त्वामिमे हव्यवाहो हवन्ते |||
verses.transliteration: ā yāhyarvāṃ upa vandhureṣṭhāstavedanu pradivaḥ somapeyam priyā sakhāyā vi mucopa barhistvāmime havyavāho havante

translations.griffith: MOUNTED upon thy chariot-seat approach us: thine is the Soma-draught from days aforetime.  Loose for the sacred grass thy dear companions. These men who bring oblation call thee hither.

verses.sanskrit: आ याहि पूर्वीरति चर्षणीरानर्य आशिष उप नो हरिभ्याम इमा हि तवा मतय सतोमतष्टा इन्द्र हवन्ते सख्यं जुषाणाः |||
verses.transliteration: ā yāhi pūrvīrati carṣaṇīrānarya āśiṣa upa no haribhyām imā hi tvā mataya stomataṣṭā indra havante sakhyaṃ juṣāṇāḥ

translations.griffith: Come our true Friend, passing by many people; come with thy two Bay Steeds to our devotions;  For these our hymns are calling thee, O Indra, hymns formed for praise, soliciting thy friendship.

verses.sanskrit: आ नो यज्ञं नमोव्र्धं सजोषा इन्द्र देव हरिभिर्याहि तूयम अहं हि तवा मतिभिर्जोहवीमि घर्तप्रयाः सधमादे मधूनाम |||
verses.transliteration: ā no yajñaṃ namovṛdhaṃ sajoṣā indra deva haribhiryāhi tūyam ahaṃ hi tvā matibhirjohavīmi ghṛtaprayāḥ sadhamāde madhūnām

translations.griffith: Pleased, with thy Bay Steeds, Indra, God, come quickly to this our sacrifice that heightens worship;  For with my thoughts, presenting oil to feed thee, I call thee to the feast of sweet libations.

verses.sanskrit: आ च तवामेता वर्षणा वहातो हरी सखाया सुधुरा सवङगा धानावदिन्द्रः सवनं जुषाणः सखा सख्युः शर्णवद वन्दनानि |||
verses.transliteration: ā ca tvāmetā vṛṣaṇā vahāto harī sakhāyā sudhurā svaṅghā dhānāvadindraḥ savanaṃ juṣāṇaḥ sakhā sakhyuḥ śṛṇavad vandanāni

translations.griffith: Yea, let thy two Bay Stallions bear thee hither, well limbed and good to draw, thy dear companions.  Pleased with the corn-blent offering which we bring thee, may Indra, Friend, hear his friend's adoration.

verses.sanskrit: कुविन मा गोपां करसे जनस्य कुविद राजानं मघवन्न्र्जीषिन कुविन म रषिं पपिवांसं सुतस्य कुविन मे वस्वो अम्र्तस्य शिक्षाः |||
verses.transliteration: kuvin mā ghopāṃ karase janasya kuvid rājānaṃ maghavannṛjīṣin kuvin ma ṛṣiṃ papivāṃsaṃ sutasya kuvin me vasvo amṛtasya śikṣāḥ

translations.griffith: Wilt thou not make me guardian of the people, make me, impetuous Maghavan, their ruler?  Make me a Ṛṣi having drunk of Soma? Wilt thou not give me wealth that lasts for ever?

verses.sanskrit: आ तवा बर्हन्तो हरयो युजाना अर्वागिन्द्र सधमादो वहन्तु पर ये दविता दिव रञ्जन्त्याताः सुसम्म्र्ष्टासो वर्षभस्य मूराः |||
verses.transliteration: ā tvā bṛhanto harayo yujānā arvāghindra sadhamādo vahantu pra ye dvitā diva ṛñjantyātāḥ susammṛṣṭāso vṛṣabhasya mūrāḥ

translations.griffith: Yoked to thy chariot, led thy tall Bays, Indra, companions of thy banquet, bear thee hither,  Who from of old press to heaven's farthest limits, the Bull's impetuous and well-groomed Horses.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्र पिब वर्षधूतस्य वर्ष्ण आ यं ते शयेन उशते जभार यस्य मदे चयावयसि पर कर्ष्टीर्यस्य मदे अप गोत्रा ववर्थ |||
verses.transliteration: indra piba vṛṣadhūtasya vṛṣṇa ā yaṃ te śyena uśate jabhāra yasya made cyāvayasi pra kṛṣṭīryasya made apa ghotrā vavartha

translations.griffith: Drink of the strong pressed out by strong ones, Indra, that which the Falcon brought thee when thou longedst;  In whose wild joy thou stirrest up the people, in whose wild joy thou didst unbar the cow-stalls.

verses.transliteration: śunaṃ huvema ...

translations.griffith: Call we on Indra, Makhavan, auspicious, best Hero in the fight where spoil is gathered;  The Strong, who listens, who gives aid in battles, who slays the Vṛtras, wins and gathers riches.

verses.sanskrit: अयं ते अस्तु हर्यतः सोम आ हरिभिः सुतः जुषाण इन्द्र हरिभिर्न आ गह्या तिष्ठ हरितं रथम |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ te astu haryataḥ soma ā haribhiḥ sutaḥ juṣāṇa indra haribhirna ā ghahyā tiṣṭha haritaṃ ratham

translations.griffith: May this delightsome Soma be expressed for thee by tawny stones.  Joying thereat, O Indra, with thy Bay Steeds come:. ascend thy golden-coloured car.

verses.sanskrit: हर्यन्नुषसमर्चयः सूर्यं हर्यन्नरोचयः विद्वांष्चिकित्वान हर्यश्व वर्धस इन्द्र विश्वा अभि शरियः |||
verses.transliteration: haryannuṣasamarcayaḥ sūryaṃ haryannarocayaḥ vidvāṃṣcikitvān haryaśva vardhasa indra viśvā abhi śriyaḥ

translations.griffith: In love thou madest Uṣas glow, in love thou madest Sūrya shine.  Thou, Indra, knowing, thinking, Lord of Tawny Steeds, above all glories waxest great.

verses.sanskrit: दयामिन्द्रो हरिधायसं पर्थिवीं हरिवर्पसम अधारयद धरितोर्भूरि भोजनं ययोरन्तर्हरिश्चरत |||
verses.transliteration: dyāmindro haridhāyasaṃ pṛthivīṃ harivarpasam adhārayad dharitorbhūri bhojanaṃ yayorantarhariścarat

translations.griffith: The heaven with streams of golden hue, earth with her tints of green and gold-  The golden Pair yield Indra plenteous nourishment: between them moves the golden One.

verses.sanskrit: जज्ञानो हरितो वर्षा विश्वमा भाति रोचनम हर्यश्वो हरितं धत्त आयुधमा वज्रं बाह्वोर्हरिम |||
verses.transliteration: jajñāno harito vṛṣā viśvamā bhāti rocanam haryaśvo haritaṃ dhatta āyudhamā vajraṃ bāhvorharim

translations.griffith: When born to life the golden Bull illumines all the realm of light.  He takes his golden weapon, Lord of Tawny Steeds, the golden thunder in his arms.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रो हर्यन्तमर्जुनं वज्रं शुक्रैरभीव्र्तम अपाव्र्णोद धरिभिरद्रिभिः सुतमुद गा हरिभिराजत |||
verses.transliteration: indro haryantamarjunaṃ vajraṃ śukrairabhīvṛtam apāvṛṇod dharibhiradribhiḥ sutamud ghā haribhirājata

translations.griffith: The bright, the well-loved thunderbolt, girt with the bright, Indra disclosed,  Disclosed the Soma juice pressed out by tawny stones, with tawny steeds drave forth the kine.

verses.sanskrit: आ मन्द्रैरिन्द्र हरिभिर्याहि मयूररोमभिः मा तवा केचिन नि यमन विं न पाशिनो.अति धन्वेव तानिहि |||
verses.transliteration: ā mandrairindra haribhiryāhi mayūraromabhiḥ mā tvā kecin ni yaman viṃ na pāśino.ati dhanveva tānihi

translations.griffith: COME hither, Indra, with Bay Steeds, joyous, with tails like peacocks' plumes.  Let no men cheek thy course as fowlers stay the bird: pass o’er them as o’er desert lands.

verses.sanskrit: वर्त्रखादो वलंरुजः पुरां दर्मो अपामजः सथाता रथस्य हर्योरभिस्वर इन्द्रो दर्ळ्हा चिदारुजः |||
verses.transliteration: vṛtrakhādo valaṃrujaḥ purāṃ darmo apāmajaḥ sthātā rathasya haryorabhisvara indro dṛḷhā cidārujaḥ

translations.griffith: He who slew Vṛtra, burst the cloud, brake the strongholds and drave the floods,  Indra who mounts his chariot at his Bay Steeds' cry, shatters e’en things that stand most firm.

verses.sanskrit: गम्भीरानुदधीन्रिव करतुं पुष्यसि गा इव पर सुगोपायवसं धेनवो यथा हरदं कुल्या इवाशत |||
verses.transliteration: ghambhīrānudadhīnriva kratuṃ puṣyasi ghā iva pra sughopāyavasaṃ dhenavo yathā hradaṃ kulyā ivāśata

translations.griffith: Like pools of water deep and full, like kine thou cherishest thy might;  Like the milch-cows that go well-guarded to the mead, like water-brooks that reach the lake.

verses.sanskrit: आ नस्तुजं रयिं भरांशं न परतिजानते वर्क्षं पक्वं फलमङकीव धूनुहीन्द्र सम्पारणं वसु |||
verses.transliteration: ā nastujaṃ rayiṃ bharāṃśaṃ na pratijānate vṛkṣaṃ pakvaṃ phalamaṅkīva dhūnuhīndra sampāraṇaṃ vasu

translations.griffith: Bring thou us wealth with power to strike, our share, 'gainst him who calls it his.  Shake, Indra, as with hooks, the tree for ripened fruit, for wealth to satisfy our wish.

verses.sanskrit: सवयुरिन्द्र सवराळ असि समद्दिष्टिः सवयशस्तरः स वाव्र्धान ओजसा पुरुष्टुत भवा नः सुश्रवस्तमः |||
verses.transliteration: svayurindra svarāḷ asi smaddiṣṭiḥ svayaśastaraḥ sa vāvṛdhāna ojasā puruṣṭuta bhavā naḥ suśravastamaḥ

translations.griffith: Indra, self-ruling Lord art thou, good Leader, of most glorious fame.  So, waxen in thy strength, O thou whom many praise, be thou most swift to hear our call.

verses.sanskrit: युध्मस्य ते वर्षभस्य सवराज उग्रस्य यून सथविरस्य घर्ष्वेः अजूर्यतो वज्रिणो वीर्याणीन्द्र शरुतस्य महतो महानि |||
verses.transliteration: yudhmasya te vṛṣabhasya svarāja ughrasya yūna sthavirasya ghṛṣveḥ ajūryato vajriṇo vīryāṇīndra śrutasya mahato mahāni

translations.griffith: OF thee, the Bull, the Warrior, Sovran Ruler, joyous and fierce, ancient and ever youthful,  The undecaying One who wields the thunder, renowned and great, great are the exploits, Indra.

verses.sanskrit: महानसि महिष वर्ष्ण्येभिर्धनस्प्र्दुग्र सहमानो अन्यान एको विश्वस्य भुवनस्य राजा स योधया च कषयया च जनान |||
verses.transliteration: mahānasi mahiṣa vṛṣṇyebhirdhanaspṛdughra sahamāno anyān eko viśvasya bhuvanasya rājā sa yodhayā ca kṣayayā ca janān

translations.griffith: Great art thou, Mighty Lord, through manly vigour, O fierce One, gathering spoil, subduing others,  Thyself alone the universe's Sovran: so send forth men to combat and to rest them.

verses.sanskrit: पर मात्राभी रिरिचे रोचमानः पर देवेभिर्विश्वतो अप्रतीतः पर मज्मना दिव इन्द्रः पर्थिव्याः परोरोर्महो अन्तरिक्षाद रजीषी |||
verses.transliteration: pra mātrābhī ririce rocamānaḥ pra devebhirviśvato apratītaḥ pra majmanā diva indraḥ pṛthivyāḥ prorormaho antarikṣād ṛjīṣī

translations.griffith: He hath surpassed all measure in his brightness, yea, and the Gods, for none may be his equal.  Impetuous Indra in his might cxccedcth wide vast mid-air and heaven and earth together.

verses.sanskrit: उरुं गभीरं जनुषाभ्युग्रं विश्वव्यचसमवतं मतीनाम इन्द्रं सोमासः परदिवि सुतासः समुद्रं न सरवता विशन्ति |||
verses.transliteration: uruṃ ghabhīraṃ januṣābhyughraṃ viśvavyacasamavataṃ matīnām indraṃ somāsaḥ pradivi sutāsaḥ samudraṃ na sravataā viśanti

translations.griffith: To Indra, even as rivers to the ocean, flow forth from days of old the Soma juices;  To him wide deep and mighty from his birth-time, the well of holy thoughts, aIl-comprehending.

verses.sanskrit: यं सोममिन्द्र पर्थिवीद्यावा गर्भं न माता बिभ्र्तस्त्वाया तं ते हिन्वन्ति तमु ते मर्जन्त्यध्वर्यवो वर्षभ पातवा उ |||
verses.transliteration: yaṃ somamindra pṛthivīdyāvā gharbhaṃ na mātā bibhṛtastvāyā taṃ te hinvanti tamu te mṛjantyadhvaryavo vṛṣabha pātavā u

translations.griffith: The Soma, Indra, which the earth and heaven bear for thee as a mother bears her infant,  This they send forth to thee, this, vigorous Hero! Adhvaryus purify for thee to drink of.

verses.sanskrit: मरुत्वानिन्द्र वर्षभो रणाय पिबा सोममनुष्वधं मदाय आ सिञ्चस्व जठरे मध्व ऊर्मिं तवं राजासि परदिवः सुतानाम |||
verses.transliteration: marutvānindra vṛṣabho raṇāya pibā somamanuṣvadhaṃ madāya ā siñcasva jaṭhare madhva ūrmiṃ tvaṃ rājāsi pradivaḥ sutānām

translations.griffith: DRINK, Indra, Marut-girt, as Bull, the Soma, for joy, for rapture even as thou listest.  Pour down the flood of meath within thy belly: thou from of old art King of Soma juices.

verses.sanskrit: सजोषा इन्द्र सगणो मरुद्भिः सोमं पिब वर्त्रहा शूर विद्वान जहि शत्रून्रप मर्धो नुदस्वाथाभयं कर्णुहि विश्वतो नः |||
verses.transliteration: sajoṣā indra saghaṇo marudbhiḥ somaṃ piba vṛtrahā śūra vidvān jahi śatrūnrapa mṛdho nudasvāthābhayaṃ kṛṇuhi viśvato naḥ

translations.griffith: Indra, accordant, with the banded Maruts, drink Soma, Hero, as wise Vṛtra-slayer.  Slay thou our foemen, drive away assailants and make us safe on every side from danger.

verses.sanskrit: उत रतुभिर्र्तुपाः पाहि सोममिन्द्र देवेभिः सखिभिः सुतं नः यानाभजो मरुतो ये तवान्वहन वर्त्रमदधुस्तुभ्यमोजः |||
verses.transliteration: uta ṛtubhirṛtupāḥ pāhi somamindra devebhiḥ sakhibhiḥ sutaṃ naḥ yānābhajo maruto ye tvānvahan vṛtramadadhustubhyamojaḥ

translations.griffith: And, drinker at due seasons, drink in season, Indra, with friendly Gods, our pressed-out Soma.  The Maruts following, whom thou madest sharers, gave thee the victory, and thou slewest Vṛtra.

verses.sanskrit: ये तवाहिहत्ये मघवन्नवर्धन ये शाम्बरे हरिवो ये गविष्टौ ये तवा नूनमनुमदन्ति विप्राः पिबेन्द्र सोमं सगणो मरुद्भिः |||
verses.transliteration: ye tvāhihatye maghavannavardhan ye śāmbare harivo ye ghaviṣṭau ye tvā nūnamanumadanti viprāḥ pibendra somaṃ saghaṇo marudbhiḥ

translations.griffith: Drink Soma, Indra, banded with the Maruts who, Maghavan, strengthened thee at Ahi's slaughter,  'Gainst Śambara, Lord of Bays! in winning cattle, and now rejoice in thee, the holy Singers.

verses.sanskrit: मरुत्वन्तं वर्षभं वाव्र्धानमकवारिं दिव्यं शासमिन्द्रम विश्वासाहमवसे नूतनायोग्रं सहोदामिह तंहुवेम |||
verses.transliteration: marutvantaṃ vṛṣabhaṃ vāvṛdhānamakavāriṃ divyaṃ śāsamindram viśvāsāhamavase nūtanāyoghraṃ sahodāmiha taṃhuvema

translations.griffith: The Bull whose strength hath waxed, whom Maruts follow, free-giving Indra, the celestial Ruler,  Mighty, all-conquering, the victory-giver, him let us call to grant us new protection.

verses.sanskrit: सद्यो ह जातो वर्षभः कनीनः परभर्तुमावदन्धसः सुतस्य साधोः पिब परतिकामं यथा ते रसाशिरः परथमं सोम्यस्य |||
verses.transliteration: sadyo ha jāto vṛṣabhaḥ kanīnaḥ prabhartumāvadandhasaḥ sutasya sādhoḥ piba pratikāmaṃ yathā te rasāśiraḥ prathamaṃ somyasya

translations.griffith: SOON as the young Bull sprang into existence he longed to taste the pressed-out Soma's liquor.  Drink thou thy fill, according to thy longing, first, of the goodly mixture blent with Soma.

verses.sanskrit: यज्जायथास्तदहरस्य कामे.अंशोः पीयूषमपिबो गिरिष्ठाम तं ते माता परि योषा जनित्री महः पितुर्दम आसिञ्चदग्रे |||
verses.transliteration: yajjāyathāstadaharasya kāme.aṃśoḥ pīyūṣamapibo ghiriṣṭhām taṃ te mātā pari yoṣā janitrī mahaḥ piturdama āsiñcadaghre

translations.griffith: That day when thou wast born thou, fain to taste it, drankest the plant's milk which the mountains nourish.  That milk thy Mother first, the Dame who bare thee, poured for thee in thy mighty Father's dwelling.

verses.sanskrit: उपस्थाय मातरमन्नमैट्ट तिग्ममपश्यदभि सोममूधः परयावयन्नचरद गर्त्सो अन्यान महानि चक्रे पुरुधप्रतीकः |||
verses.transliteration: upasthāya mātaramannamaiṭṭa tighmamapaśyadabhi somamūdhaḥ prayāvayannacarad ghṛtso anyān mahāni cakre purudhapratīkaḥ

translations.griffith: Desiring food he came unto his Mother, and on her breast beheld the pungent Soma.  Wise, he moved on, keeping aloof the others, and wrought great exploits in his varied aspects.

verses.sanskrit: उग्रस्तुराषाळ अभिभूत्योजा यथावशं तन्वं चक्र एषः तवष्टारमिन्द्रो जनुषाभिभूयामुष्या सोममपिबच्चमूषु |||
verses.transliteration: ughrasturāṣāḷ abhibhūtyojā yathāvaśaṃ tanvaṃ cakra eṣaḥ tvaṣṭāramindro januṣābhibhūyāmuṣyā somamapibaccamūṣu

translations.griffith: Fierce, quickly conquering, of surpassing vigour, he framed his body even as he listed.  E’en from his birth-time Indra conquered Tvaṣṭar, bore off the Soma and in beakers drank it.

verses.transliteration: śunaṃ huvema ...

translations.griffith: Call we on Maghavan, auspicious Indra, best Hero in the fight where spoil is gathered;  The Strong, who listens, who gives aid in battles, who slays the Vṛtras, wins and gathers riches.

verses.sanskrit: शंसा महामिन्द्रं यस्मिन विश्वा आ कर्ष्टयः सोमपाः काममव्यन यं सुक्रतुं धिषणे विभ्वतष्टं घनं वर्त्राणां जनयन्त देवाः |||
verses.transliteration: śaṃsā mahāmindraṃ yasmin viśvā ā kṛṣṭayaḥ somapāḥ kāmamavyan yaṃ sukratuṃ dhiṣaṇe vibhvataṣṭaṃ ghanaṃ vṛtrāṇāṃ janayanta devāḥ

translations.griffith: GREAT Indra will I laud, in whom all people who drink the Soma have attained their longing;  Whom, passing wise, Gods, Heaven and Earth, engendered, formed by a Master's hand, to crush the Vṛtras.

verses.sanskrit: यं नु नकिः पर्तनासु सवराजं दविता तरति नर्तमं हरिष्ठाम इनतमः सत्वभिर्यो ह शूषैः पर्थुज्रया अमिनादायुर्दस्योः |||
verses.transliteration: yaṃ nu nakiḥ pṛtanāsu svarājaṃ dvitā tarati nṛtamaṃ hariṣṭhām inatamaḥ satvabhiryo ha śūṣaiḥ pṛthujrayā aminādāyurdasyoḥ

translations.griffith: Whom, most heroic, borne by Tawny Coursers, verily none subdueth in the battle;  Who, reaching far, most vigorous, hath shortened the Dasyu's life with Warriors bold of spirit.

verses.sanskrit: सहावा पर्त्सु तरणिर्नार्वा वयानशी रोदसी मेहनावान भगो न कारे हव्यो मतीनां पितेव चारुः सुहवो वयोधाः |||
verses.transliteration: sahāvā pṛtsu taraṇirnārvā vyānaśī rodasī mehanāvān bhagho na kāre havyo matīnāṃ piteva cāruḥ suhavo vayodhāḥ

translations.griffith: Victor in fight, swift mover like a warhorse, pervading both worlds, rainer down of blessings,  To he invoked in war like Bhaga, Father, as ’twere, of hymns, fair, prompt to hear, strength-giver.

verses.sanskrit: धर्ता दिवो रजसस पर्ष्ट ऊर्ध्वो रथो न वायुर्वसुभिर्नियुत्वान कषपां वस्ता जनिता सूर्यस्य विभक्ता भागं धिषणेव वाजम |||
verses.transliteration: dhartā divo rajasas pṛṣṭa ūrdhvo ratho na vāyurvasubhirniyutvān kṣapāṃ vastā janitā sūryasya vibhaktā bhāghaṃ dhiṣaṇeva vājam

translations.griffith: Supporting heaven, the high back of the region, his car is Vāyu with his team of Vasus.  Illumining the nights, the Sun's creator, like Dhiṣaṇā he deals forth strength and riches.

verses.transliteration: śunaṃ huvema ...

translations.griffith: Call we on Maghavan, auspicious Indra, best Hero in the fight where spoil is gathered;  The Strong, who listens, who gives aid in battles, who slays the Vṛtras, wins and gathers treasure.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रः सवाहा पिबतु यस्य सोम आगत्या तुम्रो वर्षभो मरुत्वान ओरुव्यचाः पर्णतामेभिरन्नैरास्य हविस्तन्वःकामं रध्याः |||
verses.transliteration: indraḥ svāhā pibatu yasya soma āghatyā tumro vṛṣabho marutvān oruvyacāḥ pṛṇatāmebhirannairāsya havistanvaḥkāmaṃ ṛdhyāḥ

translations.griffith: LET Indra drink, All-hail! for his is Soma,—the mighty Bull come, girt by Maruts, hither.  Far-reaching, let him fill him with these viands, and let our offering sate his body's longing.

verses.sanskrit: आ ते सपर्यू जवसे युनज्मि ययोरनु परदिवः शरुष्टिमावः इह तवा धेयुर्हरयः सुशिप्र पिबा तवस्य सुषुतस्य चारोः |||
verses.transliteration: ā te saparyū javase yunajmi yayoranu pradivaḥ śruṣṭimāvaḥ iha tvā dheyurharayaḥ suśipra pibā tvasya suṣutasya cāroḥ

translations.griffith: I yoke thy pair of trusty Steeds for swiftness, whose faithful service from of old thou lovest.  Here, fair of cheek! let thy Bay Coursers place thee: drink of this lovely welleffused libation.

verses.sanskrit: गोभिर्मिमिक्षुं दधिरे सुपारमिन्द्रं जयैष्ठ्याय धायसे गर्णानाः मन्दानः सोमं पपिवान रजीषिन समस्मभ्यं पुरुधा गा इषण्य |||
verses.transliteration: ghobhirmimikṣuṃ dadhire supāramindraṃ jyaiṣṭhyāya dhāyase ghṛṇānāḥ mandānaḥ somaṃ papivān ṛjīṣin samasmabhyaṃ purudhā ghā iṣaṇya

translations.griffith: With milk they made Indra their good Preserver, lauding for help and rule the bounteous rainer.  Impetuous God, when thou hast drunk the Soma, enraptured send us cattle in abundance.

verses.transliteration: imaṃ kāmaṃ ...

translations.griffith: With kine and horses satisfy this longing with very splendid bounty still extend it.  Seeking the light, with hymns to thee, O Indra, the Kuśikas have brought their gift, the singers.

verses.transliteration: śunaṃ huvema ...

translations.griffith: Call we on Maghavan, auspicious Indra, best Hero in the fight where spoil is gathered;  The Strong, who listens, who gives aid in battles, who slays the Vṛtras, wins and gathers riches.

verses.sanskrit: चर्षणीध्र्तं मघवानमुक्थ्यमिन्द्रं गिरो बर्हतीरभ्यनूषत वाव्र्धानं पुरुहूतं सुव्र्क्तिभिरमर्त्यं जरमाणं दिवे-दिवे |||
verses.transliteration: carṣaṇīdhṛtaṃ maghavānamukthyamindraṃ ghiro bṛhatīrabhyanūṣata vāvṛdhānaṃ puruhūtaṃ suvṛktibhiramartyaṃ jaramāṇaṃ dive-dive

translations.griffith: HIGH hymns have sounded forth the praise of Maghavan, supporter of mankind, of Indra meet for lauds;  Him who hath waxen great, invoked with beauteous songs, Immortal One, whose praise each day is sung aloud.

verses.sanskrit: शतक्रतुमर्णवं शाकिनं नरं गिरो म इन्द्रमुप यन्ति विश्वतः वाजसनिं पूर्भिदं तूर्णिमप्तुरं धामसाचमभिषाचं सवर्विदम |||
verses.transliteration: śatakratumarṇavaṃ śākinaṃ naraṃ ghiro ma indramupa yanti viśvataḥ vājasaniṃ pūrbhidaṃ tūrṇimapturaṃ dhāmasācamabhiṣācaṃ svarvidam

translations.griffith: To Indra from all sides go forth my songs of praise, the Lord of Hundred Powers, strong, Hero, like the sea,  Swift, winner of the booty, breaker-down of forts, faithful and ever-glorious, finder of the light.

verses.sanskrit: आकरे वसोर्जरिता पनस्यते.अनेहस सतुभ इन्द्रो दुवस्यति विवस्वतः सदन आ हि पिप्रिये सत्रासाहमभिमातिहनं सतुहि |||
verses.transliteration: ākare vasorjaritā panasyate.anehasa stubha indro duvasyati vivasvataḥ sadana ā hi pipriye satrāsāhamabhimātihanaṃ stuhi

translations.griffith: Where battle's spoil is piled the singer winneth praise, for Indra taketh care of matchless worshippers.  He in Vivasvān's dwelling findeth his delight: praise thou the ever-conquering slayer of the foe.

verses.sanskrit: नर्णामु तवा नर्तमं गीर्भिरुक्थैरभि पर वीरमर्चता सबाधः सं सहसे पुरुमायो जिहीते नमो अस्य परदिव एक ईशे |||
verses.transliteration: nṛṇāmu tvā nṛtamaṃ ghīrbhirukthairabhi pra vīramarcatā sabādhaḥ saṃ sahase purumāyo jihīte namo asya pradiva eka īśe

translations.griffith: Thee, valorous, most heroic of the heroes, shall the priests glorify with songg and praises.  Full of all wondrous power he goes to conquest: worship is his, sole Lord from days aforetime.

verses.sanskrit: पूर्वीरस्य निष्षिधो मर्त्येषु पुरू वसूनि पर्थिवी बिभर्ति इन्द्राय दयाव ओषधीरुतापो रयिं रक्षन्ति जीरयो वनानि |||
verses.transliteration: pūrvīrasya niṣṣidho martyeṣu purū vasūni pṛthivī bibharti indrāya dyāva oṣadhīrutāpo rayiṃ rakṣanti jīrayo vanāni

translations.griffith: Abundant are the gifts he gives to mortals: for him the earth bears a rich store of treasures.  The heavens, the growing plants, the living waters, the forest trees preserve their wealth for Indra.

verses.sanskrit: तुभ्यं बरह्माणि गिर इन्द्र तुभ्यं सत्रा दधिरे हरिवो जुषस्व बोध्यापिरवसो नूतनस्य सखे वसो जरित्र्भ्यो वयोधाः |||
verses.transliteration: tubhyaṃ brahmāṇi ghira indra tubhyaṃ satrā dadhire harivo juṣasva bodhyāpiravaso nūtanasya sakhe vaso jaritṛbhyo vayodhāḥ

translations.griffith: To thee, O Indra, Lord of Bays, for ever are offered prayers and songs: accept them gladly.  As Kinsman think thou of some fresh assistance; good Friend, give strength and life to those who praise thee.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्र मरुत्व इह पाहि सोमं यथा शार्याते अपिबः सुतस्य तव परणीती तव शूर शर्मन्ना विवासन्ति कवयःसुयज्ञाः |||
verses.transliteration: indra marutva iha pāhi somaṃ yathā śāryāte apibaḥ sutasya tava praṇītī tava śūra śarmannā vivāsanti kavayaḥsuyajñāḥ

translations.griffith: Here, Indra, drink thou Soma with the Maruts, as thou didst drink the juice beside Śāryāta.  Under thy guidance, in thy keeping, Hero, the singers serve, skilled in fair sacrifices.

verses.sanskrit: स वावशान इह पाहि सोमं मरुद्भिरिन्द्र सखिभिः सुतं नः जातं यत तवा परि देवा अभूषन महे भराय पुरुहूत विश्वे |||
verses.transliteration: sa vāvaśāna iha pāhi somaṃ marudbhirindra sakhibhiḥ sutaṃ naḥ jātaṃ yat tvā pari devā abhūṣan mahe bharāya puruhūta viśve

translations.griffith: So eagerly desirous drink the Soma, our juice, O Indra, with thy friends the Maruts,  Since at thy birth all Deities adorned thee for the great fight, O thou invoked of many.

verses.sanskrit: अप्तूर्ये मरुत आपिरेषो.अमन्दन्निन्द्रमनु दातिवाराः तेभिः साकं पिबतु वर्त्रखादः सुतं सोमं दाशुषः सवे सधस्थे |||
verses.transliteration: aptūrye maruta āpireṣo.amandannindramanu dātivārāḥ tebhiḥ sākaṃ pibatu vṛtrakhādaḥ sutaṃ somaṃ dāśuṣaḥ sve sadhasthe

translations.griffith: He was your comrade in your zeal, O Maruts: they, rich in noble gifts, rejoiced in Indra.  With them together let the Vṛtra-slayer drink in his home the worshipper's libation.

verses.sanskrit: इदं हयन्वोजसा सुतं राधानां पते पिबा तवस्य गिर्वणः |||
verses.transliteration: idaṃ hyanvojasā sutaṃ rādhānāṃ pate pibā tvasya ghirvaṇaḥ

translations.griffith: So, Lord of affluent gifts, this juice hath been pressed for thee with strength  Drink of it, thou who lovest song.

verses.sanskrit: यस्ते अनु सवधामसत सुते नि यछ तन्वम स तवा ममत्तु सोम्यम |||
verses.transliteration: yaste anu svadhāmasat sute ni yacha tanvam sa tvā mamattu somyam

translations.griffith: Incline thy body to this juice which suits thy Godlike nature well:  May it cheer thee who lovest it.

verses.sanskrit: पर ते अश्नोतु कुक्ष्योः परेन्द्र बरह्मणा शिरः पर बाहू शूर राधसे |||
verses.transliteration: pra te aśnotu kukṣyoḥ prendra brahmaṇā śiraḥ pra bāhū śūra rādhase

translations.griffith: Brave Indra, let it work through both thy flanks, and through thy head by prayer,  And through thine arms, to prosper us.

verses.sanskrit: धानावन्तं करम्भिणमपूपवन्तमुक्थिनम इन्द्र परातर्जुषस्व नः |||
verses.transliteration: dhānāvantaṃ karambhiṇamapūpavantamukthinam indra prātarjuṣasva naḥ

translations.griffith: INDRA, accept at break of day our Soma mixt with roasted corn,  With groats with cake, with eulogies.

verses.sanskrit: पुरोळाशं पचत्यं जुषस्वेन्द्रा गुरस्व च तुभ्यं हव्यानि सिस्रते |||
verses.transliteration: puroḷāśaṃ pacatyaṃ juṣasvendrā ghurasva ca tubhyaṃ havyāni sisrate

translations.griffith: Accept, O Indra, and enjoy the well-dressed sacrificial cake: Oblations are poured forth to thee.

verses.sanskrit: पुरोळाशं च नो घसो जोषयासे गिरश्च नः वधूयुरिव योषणाम |||
verses.transliteration: puroḷāśaṃ ca no ghaso joṣayāse ghiraśca naḥ vadhūyuriva yoṣaṇām

translations.griffith: Consume our sacrificial cake, accept the songs of praise we sing,  As he who woes accepts his bride.

verses.sanskrit: पुरोळाशं सनश्रुत परातःसावे जुषस्व नः इन्द्र करतुर्हि ते बर्हन |||
verses.transliteration: puroḷāśaṃ sanaśruta prātaḥsāve juṣasva naḥ indra kraturhi te bṛhan

translations.griffith: Famed from of old, accept the cake at our libation poured at dawn,  Forgreat, O Indra, is thy power.

verses.sanskrit: माध्यन्दिनस्य सवनस्य धानाः पुरोळाशमिन्द्र कर्ष्वेहचारुम पर यत सतोता जरिता तूर्ण्यर्थो वर्षायमाण उप गीर्भिरीट्टे |||
verses.transliteration: mādhyandinasya savanasya dhānāḥ puroḷāśamindra kṛṣvehacārum pra yat stotā jaritā tūrṇyartho vṛṣāyamāṇa upa ghīrbhirīṭṭe

translations.griffith: Let roasted corn of our midday libation, and sacrificial cake here please thee, Indra,  What time the lauding singer, keen of purpose and eager as a bull, with hymns implores thee.

verses.sanskrit: तर्तीये धानाः सवने पुरुष्टुत पुरोळाशमाहुतं मामहस्व नः रभुमन्तं वाजवन्तं तवा कवे परयस्वन्त उप शिक्षेम धीतिभिः |||
verses.transliteration: tṛtīye dhānāḥ savane puruṣṭuta puroḷāśamāhutaṃ māmahasva naḥ ṛbhumantaṃ vājavantaṃ tvā kave prayasvanta upa śikṣema dhītibhiḥ

translations.griffith: At the third sacrifice, O thou whom many praise, give glory to the roasted corn and holy cake.  With offered viands and with songs may we assist thee, Sage, whom Vāja and the Ṛbhus wait upon.

verses.sanskrit: पूषण्वते ते चक्र्मा करम्भं हरिवते हर्यश्वाय धानाः अपूपमद्धि सगणो मरुद्भिः सोमं पिब वर्त्रहा शूर विद्वान |||
verses.transliteration: pūṣaṇvate te cakṛmā karambhaṃ harivate haryaśvāya dhānāḥ apūpamaddhi saghaṇo marudbhiḥ somaṃ piba vṛtrahā śūra vidvān

translations.griffith: The groats have we prepared for thee with Pūṣan, corn for thee, Lord of Bay Steeds, with thy horses.  Eat thou the meal-cake, banded with the Maruts, wise Hero, Vṛtra-slayer, drink the Soma.

verses.sanskrit: परति धाना भरत तूयमस्मै पुरोळाशं वीरतमाय नर्णाम दिवे-दिवे सद्र्शीरिन्द्र तुभ्यं वर्धन्तु तवा सोमपेयाय धर्ष्णो |||
verses.transliteration: prati dhānā bharata tūyamasmai puroḷāśaṃ vīratamāya nṛṇām dive-dive sadṛśīrindra tubhyaṃ vardhantu tvā somapeyāya dhṛṣṇo

translations.griffith: Bring forth the roasted corn to meet him quickly, cake for the bravest Hero mid the heroes.  Indra, may hymns accordant with thee daily strengthen thee, Bold One, for the draught of Soma.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रापर्वता बर्हता रथेन वामीरिष आ वहतं सुवीराः वीतं हव्यान्यध्वरेषु देवा वर्धेथां गीर्भीरिळया मदन्ता |||
verses.transliteration: indrāparvatā bṛhatā rathena vāmīriṣa ā vahataṃ suvīrāḥ vītaṃ havyānyadhvareṣu devā vardhethāṃ ghīrbhīriḷayā madantā

translations.griffith: ON a high car, O Parvata and Indra, bring pleasant viands, with brave heroes, hither.  Enjoy the gifts, Gods, at our sacrifices wax strong by hymns, rejoice in our oblation.

verses.sanskrit: तिष्ठा सु कं मघवन मा परा गाः सोमस्य नु तवा सुषुतस्य यक्षि पितुर्न पुत्रः सिचमा रभे त इन्द्र सवादिष्ठया गिरा शचीवः |||
verses.transliteration: tiṣṭhā su kaṃ maghavan mā parā ghāḥ somasya nu tvā suṣutasya yakṣi piturna putraḥ sicamā rabhe ta indra svādiṣṭhayā ghirā śacīvaḥ

translations.griffith: Stay still, O Maghavan, advance no farther. a draught of well-pressed Soma will I give thee.  With sweetest song I grasp, O Mighty Indra, thy garment's hem as a child grasps his father's.

verses.sanskrit: शंसावाध्वर्यो परति मे गर्णीहीन्द्राय वाहः कर्णवाव जुष्टम एदं बर्हिर्यजमानस्य सीदाथा च भूदुक्थमिन्द्राय शस्तम |||
verses.transliteration: śaṃsāvādhvaryo prati me ghṛṇīhīndrāya vāhaḥ kṛṇavāva juṣṭam edaṃ barhiryajamānasya sīdāthā ca bhūdukthamindrāya śastam

translations.griffith: Adhvaryu, sing we both; sing thou in answer: make we a laud acceptable to Indra.  Upon this sacrificer's grass he seated: to Indra shall our eulogy be uttered.

verses.sanskrit: जायेदस्तं मघवन सेदु योनिस्तदित तवा युक्ता हरयो वहन्तु यदा कदा च सुनवाम सोममग्निष टवा दूतो धन्वात्यछ |||
verses.transliteration: jāyedastaṃ maghavan sedu yonistadit tvā yuktā harayo vahantu yadā kadā ca sunavāma somamaghniṣ ṭvā dūto dhanvātyacha

translations.griffith: A wife, O Maghavan is home and dwelling: so let thy Bay Steeds yoked convey thee hither.  Whenever we press out for thee the Soma, let Agni as our Herald speed to call thee.

verses.sanskrit: परा याहि मघवन्ना च याहीन्द्र भरातरुभयत्रा ते अर्थम यत्रा रथस्य बर्हतो निधानं विमोचनं वाजिनो रासभस्य |||
verses.transliteration: parā yāhi maghavannā ca yāhīndra bhrātarubhayatrā te artham yatrā rathasya bṛhato nidhānaṃ vimocanaṃ vājino rāsabhasya

translations.griffith: Depart, O Maghavan;again come hither: both there and here thy goat is Indra, Brother,  Where thy tall chariot hath a place to rest in, and where thqu loosest thy loud-neighing Courser.

verses.sanskrit: अपाः सोममस्तमिन्द्र पर याहि कल्याणीर्जया सुरणंग्र्हे ते यत्रा रथस्य बर्हतो निधानं विमोचनं वाजिनोदक्षिणावत |||
verses.transliteration: apāḥ somamastamindra pra yāhi kalyāṇīrjayā suraṇaṃghṛhe te yatrā rathasya bṛhato nidhānaṃ vimocanaṃ vājinodakṣiṇāvat

translations.griffith: Thou hast drunk Soma, Indra, turn thee homeward; thy joy is in thy home, thy racious Consort;  Where thy tall chariot hath a place to rest in, and thy strong Courser is set free with guerdon.

verses.sanskrit: इमे भोजा अङगिरसो विरूपा दिवस पुत्रासो असुरस्य वीराः विश्वामित्राय ददतो मघानि सहस्रसावे पर तिरन्त आयुः |||
verses.transliteration: ime bhojā aṅghiraso virūpā divas putrāso asurasya vīrāḥ viśvāmitrāya dadato maghāni sahasrasāve pra tiranta āyuḥ

translations.griffith: Bounteous are these, Aṅgirases, Virupas: the Asura's Heroes and the Sons of Heaven.  They, giving store of wealth to Viśvāmitra, prolong his life through countless Soma-pressings.

verses.sanskrit: रूपं-रूपं मघवा बोभवीति मायाः कर्ण्वानस्तन्वं परि सवाम तरिर्यद दिवः परि मुहूर्तमागात सवैर्मन्त्रैरन्र्तुपा रतावा |||
verses.transliteration: rūpaṃ-rūpaṃ maghavā bobhavīti māyāḥ kṛṇvānastanvaṃ pari svām triryad divaḥ pari muhūrtamāghāt svairmantrairanṛtupā ṛtāvā

translations.griffith: Maghavan weareth every shape at pleasure, effecting magic changes in his body,  Holy One, drinker out of season, coming thrice, in a moment, through fit prayers, from heaven.

verses.sanskrit: महान रषिर्देवजा देवजूतो.अस्तभ्नात सिन्धुमर्णवं नर्चक्षाः विश्वामित्रो यदवहत सुदासमप्रियायत कुशिकेभिरिन्द्रः |||
verses.transliteration: mahān ṛṣirdevajā devajūto.astabhnāt sindhumarṇavaṃ nṛcakṣāḥ viśvāmitro yadavahat sudāsamapriyāyata kuśikebhirindraḥ

translations.griffith: The mighty sage, God-born and God-incited, who looks on men, restrained the billowy river.  When Viśvāmitra was Sudās's escort, then Indra through the Kuśikas grew friendly.

verses.sanskrit: हंसा इव कर्णुथ शलोकमद्रिभिर्मदन्तो गीर्भिरध्वरे सुते सचा देवेभिर्विप्रा रषयो नर्चक्षसो वि पिबध्वं कुशिकाः सोम्यं मधु |||
verses.transliteration: haṃsā iva kṛṇutha ślokamadribhirmadanto ghīrbhiradhvare sute sacā devebhirviprā ṛṣayo nṛcakṣaso vi pibadhvaṃ kuśikāḥ somyaṃ madhu

translations.griffith: Like swans, prepare a song of praise with pressing-stones, glad in your hymns with juice poured forth in sacrifice.  Ye singers, with the Gods, sages who look on men, ye Kutikas drink up the Soma's savoury meath.

verses.sanskrit: उप परेत कुशिकाश्चेतयध्वमश्वं राये पर मुञ्चता सुदासः राजा वर्त्रं जङघनत परागपागुदगथा यजाते वर आ पर्थिव्याः |||
verses.transliteration: upa preta kuśikāścetayadhvamaśvaṃ rāye pra muñcatā sudāsaḥ rājā vṛtraṃ jaṅghanat prāghapāghudaghathā yajāte vara ā pṛthivyāḥ

translations.griffith: Come forward, Kuśikas, and be attentive; let loose Sudās's horse to win him riches.  East, west, and north, let the King slay the foeman, then at earth's choicest place perform his worship.

verses.sanskrit: य इमे रोदसी उभे अहमिन्द्रमतुष्टवम विश्वामित्रस्यरक्षति बरह्मेदं भारतं जनम |||
verses.transliteration: ya ime rodasī ubhe ahamindramatuṣṭavam viśvāmitrasyarakṣati brahmedaṃ bhārataṃ janam

translations.griffith: Praises to Indra have I sung, sustainer of this earth and heaven. This prayer of Viśvāmitra keeps secure the race of Bharatas.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वामित्रा अरासत बरह्मेन्द्राय वज्रिणे करदिन नः सुराधसः |||
verses.transliteration: viśvāmitrā arāsata brahmendrāya vajriṇe karadin naḥ surādhasaḥ

translations.griffith: The Viśvāmitras have sung forth this prayer to Indra Thunder-aimed:  So let him make us prosperous.

verses.sanskrit: किं ते कर्ण्वन्ति कीकटेषु गावो नाशिरं दुह्रे न तपन्तिघर्मम आ नो भर परमगन्दस्य वेदो नैचाशाखं मघवन्रन्धया नः |||
verses.transliteration: kiṃ te kṛṇvanti kīkaṭeṣu ghāvo nāśiraṃ duhre na tapantigharmam ā no bhara pramaghandasya vedo naicāśākhaṃ maghavanrandhayā naḥ

translations.griffith: Among the Kikatas what do thy cattle? They pour no milky draught, they heat no caldron.  Bring thou to us the wealth of Pramaganda;give up to us, O Maghavan, the low-born.

verses.sanskrit: ससर्परीरमतिं बाधमाना बर्हन मिमाय जमदग्निदत्ता आ सूर्यस्य दुहिता ततान शरवो देवेष्वम्र्तमजुर्यम |||
verses.transliteration: sasarparīramatiṃ bādhamānā bṛhan mimāya jamadaghnidattā ā sūryasya duhitā tatāna śravo deveṣvamṛtamajuryam

translations.griffith: Sasarpari, the gift of Jamadagnis, hath lowed with mighty voice dispelling famine.  The Daughter of the Sun hath spread our glory among the Gods, imperishable, deathless.

verses.sanskrit: ससर्परीरभरत तूयमेभ्यो.अधि शरवः पाञ्चजन्यासु कर्ष्टिषु सा पक्ष्या नव्यमायुर्दधाना यां मे पलस्तिजमदग्नयो ददुः |||
verses.transliteration: sasarparīrabharat tūyamebhyo.adhi śravaḥ pāñcajanyāsu kṛṣṭiṣu sā pakṣyā navyamāyurdadhānā yāṃ me palastijamadaghnayo daduḥ

translations.griffith: Sasarpari brought glory speedily to these, over the generations of the Fivefold Race;  Daughter of Paksa, she bestows new vital power, she whom the ancient Jamadagnis gave to me.

verses.sanskrit: सथिरौ गावौ भवतां वीळुरक्षो मेषा वि वर्हि मा युगं वि शारि इन्द्रः पातल्ये ददतां शरीतोररिष्टनेमे अभि नः सचस्व |||
verses.transliteration: sthirau ghāvau bhavatāṃ vīḷurakṣo meṣā vi varhi mā yughaṃ vi śāri indraḥ pātalye dadatāṃ śarītorariṣṭaneme abhi naḥ sacasva

translations.griffith: Strong be the pair of oxen, firm the axles, let not the pole slip nor the yoke be broken.  May Indra, keep the yoke-pins from decaying: attend us, thou whose fellies are uninjured.

verses.sanskrit: बलं धेहि तनूषु नो बलमिन्द्रानळुत्सु नः बलं तोकाय तनयाय जीवसे तवं हि बलदा असि |||
verses.transliteration: balaṃ dhehi tanūṣu no balamindrānaḷutsu naḥ balaṃ tokāya tanayāya jīvase tvaṃ hi baladā asi

translations.griffith: O Indra, give our bodies strength, strength to the bulls who draw the wains,  Strength to our seed and progeny that they may live, for thou art he who giveth strength.

verses.sanskrit: अभि वययस्व खदिरस्य सारमोजो धेहि सपन्दने शिंशपायाम अक्ष वीळो वीळित वीळयस्व मा यामादस्मादव जीहिपो नः |||
verses.transliteration: abhi vyayasva khadirasya sāramojo dhehi spandane śiṃśapāyām akṣa vīḷo vīḷita vīḷayasva mā yāmādasmādava jīhipo naḥ

translations.griffith: Enclose thee in the heart of Khayar timber, in the car wrought of Sinsapa put firmness.  Show thyself strong, O Axle, fixed and strengthened: throw us not from the car whereon we travel.

verses.sanskrit: अयमस्मान वनस्पतिर्मा च हा मा च रीरिषत सवस्त्याग्र्हेभ्य आवसा आ विमोचनात |||
verses.transliteration: ayamasmān vanaspatirmā ca hā mā ca rīriṣat svastyāghṛhebhya āvasā ā vimocanāt

translations.griffith: Let not this sovran of the wood leave us forlorn or injure us.  Safe may we be until we reach our homes and rest us and unyoke.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रोतिभिर्बहुलाभिर्नो अद्य याच्छ्रेष्ठाभिर्मघवञ्छूर जिन्व यो नो दवेष्ट्यधरः सस पदीष्ट यमु दविष्मस्तमु पराणो जहातु |||
verses.transliteration: indrotibhirbahulābhirno adya yācchreṣṭhābhirmaghavañchūra jinva yo no dveṣṭyadharaḥ sas padīṣṭa yamu dviṣmastamu prāṇo jahātu

translations.griffith: With various aids this day come to us, Indra, with best aids speed us, Maghavan, thou Hero.  Let him who hatcth us fall headlong downward: him whom we hate let vital breath abandon.

verses.sanskrit: परशुं चिद वि तपति शिम्बलं चिद वि वर्श्चति उखा चिदिन्द्र येषन्ती परयस्ता फेनमस्यति |||
verses.transliteration: paraśuṃ cid vi tapati śimbalaṃ cid vi vṛścati ukhā cidindra yeṣantī prayastā phenamasyati

translations.griffith: He heats his very axe, and then cuts a mere Semal blossom off.  O Indra, like a caldron cracked and seething, so he pours out foam.

verses.sanskrit: न सायकस्य चिकिते जनासो लोधं नयन्ति पशु मन्यमानाः नावाजिनं वाजिना हासयन्ति न गर्दभं पुरो अश्वान नयन्ति |||
verses.transliteration: na sāyakasya cikite janāso lodhaṃ nayanti paśu manyamānāḥ nāvājinaṃ vājinā hāsayanti na ghardabhaṃ puro aśvān nayanti

translations.griffith: Men notice not the arrow, O ye people; they bring the red beast deeming it a bullock.  A sluggish steed men run not with the courser, nor ever lead an ass before a charger.

verses.sanskrit: इम इन्द्र भरतस्य पुत्रा अपपित्वं चिकितुर्न परपित्वम हिन्वन्त्यश्वमरणं न नित्यं जयावाजं परि णयन्त्याजौ |||
verses.transliteration: ima indra bharatasya putrā apapitvaṃ cikiturna prapitvam hinvantyaśvamaraṇaṃ na nityaṃ jyāvājaṃ pari ṇayantyājau

translations.griffith: These men, the sons of Bhārata, O Indra, regard not severance or close connexion.  They urge their own steed as it were another's, and take him, swift as the bow's string, to battle.

verses.sanskrit: इमं महे विदथ्याय शूषं शश्वत कर्त्व ईड्यय पर जभ्रुः शर्णोतु नो दम्येभिरनीकैः शर्णोत्वग्निर्दिव्यैरजस्रः |||
verses.transliteration: imaṃ mahe vidathyāya śūṣaṃ śaśvat kṛtva īḍyaya pra jabhruḥ śṛṇotu no damyebhiranīkaiḥ śṛṇotvaghnirdivyairajasraḥ

translations.griffith: To him adorable, mighty, meet for synods, this strengthening hymn, unceasing, have they offered.  May Agni hear us with his homely splendours, hear us, Eternal One, with heavenly lustre.

verses.sanskrit: महि महे दिवे अर्चा पर्थिव्यै कामो म इछञ्चरति परजानन ययोर्ह सतोमे विदथेषु देवाः सपर्यवो मादयन्ते सचायोः |||
verses.transliteration: mahi mahe dive arcā pṛthivyai kāmo ma ichañcarati prajānan yayorha stome vidatheṣu devāḥ saparyavo mādayante sacāyoḥ

translations.griffith: To mighty Heaven and Earth I sing forth loudly: my wish goes out desirous and well knowing  Both, at whose laud in synods, showing favour, the Gods rejoice them with the living mortal.

verses.sanskrit: युवोर्र्तं रोदसी सत्यमस्तु महे षु णः सुविताय पर भूतम इदं दिवे नमो अग्ने पर्थिव्यै सपर्यामि परयसा यामि रत्नम |||
verses.transliteration: yuvorṛtaṃ rodasī satyamastu mahe ṣu ṇaḥ suvitāya pra bhūtam idaṃ dive namo aghne pṛthivyai saparyāmi prayasā yāmi ratnam

translations.griffith: O Heaven and Earth, may your great law he faithful: he ye our leaders for our high advantage.  To Heaven and Earth I offer this my homage, with food, O Agni, as I pray for riches.

verses.sanskrit: उतो हि वां पूर्व्या आविविद्र रतावरी रोदसी सत्यवाचः नरश्चिद वां समिथे शूरसातौ ववन्दिरे पर्थिवि वेविदानाः |||
verses.transliteration: uto hi vāṃ pūrvyā āvividra ṛtāvarī rodasī satyavācaḥ naraścid vāṃ samithe śūrasātau vavandire pṛthivi vevidānāḥ

translations.griffith: Yea, holy Heaven and Earth, the ancient sages whose word was ever true had power to find you;  And brave men in the fightwhere heroes conquer, O Earth, have known you well and paid you honour.

verses.sanskrit: को अद्धा वेद क इह पर वोचद देवानछा पथ्या का समेति दद्र्श्र एषामवमा सदांसि परेषु या गुह्येषु वरतेषु |||
verses.transliteration: ko addhā veda ka iha pra vocad devānachā pathyā kā sameti dadṛśra eṣāmavamā sadāṃsi pareṣu yā ghuhyeṣu vrateṣu

translations.griffith: What pathway leadeth to the Gods? Who knoweth this of a truth, and who will now declare it?  Seen are their lowest dwelling-places only, but they are in remote and secret regions.

verses.sanskrit: कविर्न्र्चक्षा अभि षीमचष्ट रतस्य योना विघ्र्ते मदन्ती नाना चक्राते सदनं यथा वः समानेन करतुना संविदाने |||
verses.transliteration: kavirnṛcakṣā abhi ṣīmacaṣṭa ṛtasya yonā vighṛte madantī nānā cakrāte sadanaṃ yathā vaḥ samānena kratunā saṃvidāne

translations.griffith: The Sage who looketh on mankind hath viewed them bedewed, rejoicing in the seat of Order.  They make a home as for a bird, though parted, with one same will finding themselves together.

verses.sanskrit: समान्या वियुते दूरेन्ते धरुवे पदे तस्थतुर्जागरूके उत सवसारा युवती भवन्ती आदु बरुवाते मिथुनानि नाम |||
verses.transliteration: samānyā viyute dūreante dhruve pade tasthaturjāgharūke uta svasārā yuvatī bhavantī ādu bruvāte mithunāni nāma

translations.griffith: Partners though parted, with far-distant limits, on one firm place both stand for ever watchful,  And, being young for evermore, as sisters, speak to each other names that are united.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वेदेते जनिमा सं विविक्तो महो देवान बिभ्रती न वयथेते एजद धरुवं पत्यते विश्वमेकं चरत पतत्रि विषुणं वि जातम |||
verses.transliteration: viśvedete janimā saṃ vivikto maho devān bibhratī na vyathete ejad dhruvaṃ patyate viśvamekaṃ carat patatri viṣuṇaṃ vi jātam

translations.griffith: All living things they part and keep asunder; though bearing up the mighty Gods they reel not.  One All is Lord of what is fixed and moving, that walks, that flies, this multiform creation.

verses.sanskrit: सना पुराणमध्येम्यारान महः पितुर्जनितुर्जामि तन नः देवासो यत्र पनितार एवैरुरौ पथि वयुते तस्थुरन्तः |||
verses.transliteration: sanā purāṇamadhyemyārān mahaḥ piturjaniturjāmi tan naḥ devāso yatra panitāra evairurau pathi vyute tasthurantaḥ

translations.griffith: Afar the Ancient from of old I ponder, our kinship with our mighty Sire and Father,—  Singing the praise whereof the Gods by custom stand on the spacious far-extended pathway.

verses.sanskrit: इमं सतोमं रोदसी पर बरवीम्य रदूदराः शर्णवन्नग्निजिह्वाः मित्रः सम्राजो वरुणो युवान आदित्यासः कवयः पप्रथानाः |||
verses.transliteration: imaṃ stomaṃ rodasī pra bravīmy ṛdūdarāḥ śṛṇavannaghnijihvāḥ mitraḥ samrājo varuṇo yuvāna ādityāsaḥ kavayaḥ paprathānāḥ

translations.griffith: This laud, O Heaven and Earth, to you I utter: let the kind-hearted hear, whose tongue is Agni,  Young, Sovran Rulers, Varuṇa and Mitra, the wise and very glorious Ādityas.

verses.sanskrit: हिरण्यपाणिः सविता सुजिह्वस्त्रिरा दिवो विदथे पत्यमानः देवेषु च सवितः शलोकमश्रेरादस्मभ्यमा सुवसर्वतातिम |||
verses.transliteration: hiraṇyapāṇiḥ savitā sujihvastrirā divo vidathe patyamānaḥ deveṣu ca savitaḥ ślokamaśrerādasmabhyamā suvasarvatātim

translations.griffith: The fair-tongued Savitar, the golden-handed, comes thrice from heaven as Lord in our assembly.  Bear to the Gods this song of praise, and send us, then, Savitar, complete and perfect safety.

verses.sanskrit: सुक्र्त सुपाणिः सववान रतावा देवस्त्वष्टावसे तानि नोधात पूषण्वन्त रभवो मादयध्वमूर्ध्वग्रावाणो अध्वरमतष्ट |||
verses.transliteration: sukṛt supāṇiḥ svavān ṛtāvā devastvaṣṭāvase tāni nodhāt pūṣaṇvanta ṛbhavo mādayadhvamūrdhvaghrāvāṇo adhvaramataṣṭa

translations.griffith: Deft worker, skiful-handed, helpful, holy, may Tvaṣṭar, God, give us these things to aid us,  Take your delight, Ye Ṛbhus joined with Pūṣan: ye have prepared the rite with stones adjusted.

verses.sanskrit: विद्युद्रथा मरुत रष्टिमन्तो दिवो मर्या रतजाता अयासः सरस्वती शर्णवन यज्ञियासो धाता रयिं सहवीरं तुरासः |||
verses.transliteration: vidyudrathā maruta ṛṣṭimanto divo maryā ṛtajātā ayāsaḥ sarasvatī śṛṇavan yajñiyāso dhātā rayiṃ sahavīraṃ turāsaḥ

translations.griffith: Borne on their flashing car, the spear-armed Maruts, the nimble Youths of Heaven, the Sons of Order,  The Holy, and Sarasvatī, shall hear us: ye Mighty, give us wealth with noble offspring.

verses.sanskrit: विष्णुं सतोमासः पुरुदस्ममर्का भगस्येव कारिणो यामनि गमन उरुक्रमः ककुहो यस्य पूर्विर्न मर्धन्ति युवतयोजनित्रीः |||
verses.transliteration: viṣṇuṃ stomāsaḥ purudasmamarkā bhaghasyeva kāriṇo yāmani ghman urukramaḥ kakuho yasya pūrvirna mardhanti yuvatayojanitrīḥ

translations.griffith: To Viṣṇu rich in marvels, songs And praises shall go as singers on the road of Bhaga,—  The Chieftain of the Mighty Stride, whose Mothers, the many young Dames, never disregard him.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रो विश्वैर्वीर्यैः पत्यमान उभे आ पप्रौ रोदसी महित्वा पुरन्दरो वर्त्रहा धर्ष्णुषेणः संग्र्भ्या न आ भरा भूरि पश्वः |||
verses.transliteration: indro viśvairvīryaiḥ patyamāna ubhe ā paprau rodasī mahitvā purandaro vṛtrahā dhṛṣṇuṣeṇaḥ saṃghṛbhyā na ā bharā bhūri paśvaḥ

translations.griffith: Indra, who rules through all his powers heroic, hath with his majesty filled earth and heaven.  Lord of brave hosts, Fort-crusher, Vṛtra-slayer, gather thou up and bring us store of cattle.

verses.sanskrit: नासत्या मे पितरा बन्धुप्र्छा सजात्यमश्विनोश्चारु नाम युवं हि सथो रयिदौ नो रयीणां दात्रं रक्षेथे अकवैरदब्धा |||
verses.transliteration: nāsatyā me pitarā bandhupṛchā sajātyamaśvinoścāru nāma yuvaṃ hi stho rayidau no rayīṇāṃ dātraṃ rakṣethe akavairadabdhā

translations.griffith: My Sires are the Nāsatyas, kind tokinsmen: the Aśvins' kinship is a glorious title.  For ye are they who give us store of riches: ye guard your gift uncheated by the bounteous.

verses.sanskrit: महत तद वः कवयश्चारु नाम यद ध देव भवथ विश्व इन्द्रे सख रभुभिः पुरुहूत परियेभिरिमां धियं सातये तक्षता नः |||
verses.transliteration: mahat tad vaḥ kavayaścāru nāma yad dha deva bhavatha viśva indre sakha ṛbhubhiḥ puruhūta priyebhirimāṃ dhiyaṃ sātaye takṣatā naḥ

translations.griffith: This is, ye Wise, your great and glorious title, that all ye Deities abide in Indra.  Friend, Much-invoked! art thou with thy dear Ṛbhus: fashion ye this our hymn for our advantage.

verses.sanskrit: अर्यमा णो अदितिर्यज्ञियासो.अदब्धानि वरुणस्य वरतानि युयोत नो अनपत्यानि गन्तोः परजावान नः पशुमानस्तु गातुः |||
verses.transliteration: aryamā ṇo aditiryajñiyāso.adabdhāni varuṇasya vratāni yuyota no anapatyāni ghantoḥ prajāvān naḥ paśumānastu ghātuḥ

translations.griffith: Aryaman, Aditi deserve our worship: the laws of Varuṇa remain unbroken.  The lot of childlessness remove ye from us, and let our course be rich in kine and offspring.

verses.sanskrit: देवानां दूतः पुरुध परसूतो.अनागान नो वोचतु सर्वताता शर्णोतु नः पर्थिवी दयौरुतापः सूर्यो नक्षत्रैरुर्वन्तरिक्षम |||
verses.transliteration: devānāṃ dūtaḥ purudha prasūto.anāghān no vocatu sarvatātā śṛṇotu naḥ pṛthivī dyaurutāpaḥ sūryo nakṣatrairurvantarikṣam

translations.griffith: May the Gods’ envoy, sent to many a quarter, proclaim us sinless for our perfect safety.  May Earth and Heaven, the Sun, the waters, hear us, and the wide firmament and constellations.

verses.sanskrit: शर्ण्वन्तु नो वर्षणः पर्वतासो धरुवक्षेमास इळया मदन्तः आदित्यैर्नो अदितिः शर्णोतु यछन्तु नो मरुतः शर्मभद्रम |||
verses.transliteration: śṛṇvantu no vṛṣaṇaḥ parvatāso dhruvakṣemāsa iḷayā madantaḥ ādityairno aditiḥ śṛṇotu yachantu no marutaḥ śarmabhadram

translations.griffith: Hear us the mouatains which distil the rain-drops, and, resting firm, rejoice in freshening moisture.  May Aditi with the Ādityas hear us, and Maruts grant us their auspicious shelter.

verses.sanskrit: सदा सुगः पितुमानस्तु पन्था मध्व देवा ओषधीः सम्पिप्र्क्त भगो मे अग्ने सख्ये न मर्ध्या उद रायो अश्यां सदनं पुरुक्षोः |||
verses.transliteration: sadā sughaḥ pitumānastu panthā madhva devā oṣadhīḥ sampipṛkta bhagho me aghne sakhye na mṛdhyā ud rāyo aśyāṃ sadanaṃ purukṣoḥ

translations.griffith: Soft be our path for ever, well-provisioned: with pleasant meath, O Gods, the herbs besprinkle.  Safe be my bliss, O Agni, in thy friendship: may I attain the seat of foodful. riches,

verses.sanskrit: सवदस्व हव्या समिषो दिदीह्यस्मद्र्यक सं मिमीहि शरवांसि विश्वानग्ने पर्त्सु तञ जेषि शत्रूनहा विश्वा सुमना दीदिही नः |||
verses.transliteration: svadasva havyā samiṣo didīhyasmadryak saṃ mimīhi śravāṃsi viśvānaghne pṛtsu tañ jeṣi śatrūnahā viśvā sumanā dīdihī naḥ

translations.griffith: Enjoy the offering: beam thou strength upon us; combine thou for our good all kinds of glory.  Conquer in battle, Agni, all those foemen, and light us every day with loving kindness.

verses.sanskrit: उषसः पूर्वा अध यद वयूषुर्महद वि जज्ञे अक्षरं पदे गोः वरता देवानामुप नु परभूषन महद देवानामसुरत्वमेकम |||
verses.transliteration: uṣasaḥ pūrvā adha yad vyūṣurmahad vi jajñe akṣaraṃ pade ghoḥ vratā devānāmupa nu prabhūṣan mahad devānāmasuratvamekam

translations.griffith: AT the first shining of the earliest Mornings, in the Cow's home was born the Great Eternal.  Now shall the statutes of the Gods be valid. Great is the Gods’ supreme and sole dominion -

verses.sanskrit: मो षू णो अत्र जुहुरन्त देवा मा पूर्वे अग्ने पितरः पदज्ञाः पुराण्योः सद्मनोः केतुरन्तर्म... |||
verses.transliteration: mo ṣū ṇo atra juhuranta devā mā pūrve aghne pitaraḥ padajñāḥ purāṇyoḥ sadmanoḥ keturantarma...

translations.griffith: Let not the Gods here injure us, O Agni, nor Fathers of old time who know the region,  Nor the sign set between two ancient dwellings. Great is the Gods’ supreme and sole dominion.

verses.sanskrit: वि मे पुरुत्रा पतयन्ति कामाः शम्यछा दीद्ये पूर्व्याणि समिद्धे अग्नाव रतमिद वदेम म... |||
verses.transliteration: vi me purutrā patayanti kāmāḥ śamyachā dīdye pūrvyāṇi samiddhe aghnāv ṛtamid vadema ma...

translations.griffith: My wishes fly abroad to many places: I glance back to the ancient sacrifices.  Let us declare the truth when fire is kindled. Great is the Gods’ supreme and sole dominion.

verses.sanskrit: समानो राजा विभ्र्तः पुरुत्रा शये शयासु परयुतो वनानु अन्या वत्सं भरति कषेति माता म... |||
verses.transliteration: samāno rājā vibhṛtaḥ purutrā śaye śayāsu prayuto vanānu anyā vatsaṃ bharati kṣeti mātā ma...

translations.griffith: King Universal, born to sundry quarters, extended through the wood be lies on couches.  One Mother rests: another feeds the Infant. Great is the Gods’ supreme and sole dominion.

verses.sanskrit: आक्षित पूर्वास्वपरा अनूरुत सद्यो जातासु तरुणीष्वन्तः अन्तर्वतीः सुवते अप्रवीता म... |||
verses.transliteration: ākṣit pūrvāsvaparā anūrut sadyo jātāsu taruṇīṣvantaḥ antarvatīḥ suvate apravītā ma...

translations.griffith: Lodged in old plants, he grows again in younger, swiftly within the newly-born and tender.  Though they are unimpregned, he makes them fruitful. Great is the Gods’ supreme and sole dominion.

verses.sanskrit: शयुः परस्तादध नु दविमाताबन्धनश्चरति वत्स एकः मित्रस्य ता वरुणस्य वरतानि म... |||
verses.transliteration: śayuḥ parastādadha nu dvimātābandhanaścarati vatsa ekaḥ mitrasya tā varuṇasya vratāni ma...

translations.griffith: Now lying far away, Child of two Mothers, he wanders unrestrained, the single youngling.  These are the laws of Varuṇa and Mitra. Great is the Gods’ supreme and sole dominion.

verses.sanskrit: दविमाता होता विदथेषु सम्राळ अन्वग्रं चरति कषेति बुध्नः पर रण्यानि रण्यवाचो भरन्ते म... |||
verses.transliteration: dvimātā hotā vidatheṣu samrāḷ anvaghraṃ carati kṣeti budhnaḥ pra raṇyāni raṇyavāco bharante ma...

translations.griffith: Child of two Mothers, Priest, sole Lord in synods, he still precedes while resting as foundation.  They who speak sweetly bring him sweet addresses. Great is the Gods’ supreme and sole dominion.

verses.sanskrit: शूरस्येव युध्यतो अन्तमस्य परतीचीनं दद्र्शे विश्वमायत अन्तर्मतिश्चरति निष्षिधं गोर्म... |||
verses.transliteration: śūrasyeva yudhyato antamasya pratīcīnaṃ dadṛśe viśvamāyat antarmatiścarati niṣṣidhaṃ ghorma...

translations.griffith: As to a friendly warrior when he battles, each thing that comes anear is seen to meet him.  The hymn commingles with the cow's oblation. Great is the Gods’ supreme and sole dominion.

verses.sanskrit: नि वेवेति पलितो दूत आस्वन्तर्महांश्चरति रोचनेन वपूंषि बिभ्रदभि नो वि चष्टे म... |||
verses.transliteration: ni veveti palito dūta āsvantarmahāṃścarati rocanena vapūṃṣi bibhradabhi no vi caṣṭe ma...

translations.griffith: Deep within these the hoary envoy pierceth; mighty, he goeth to the realm of splendour,  And looketh on us, clad in wondrous beauty. Great is the Gods’ supreme and sole dominion.

verses.sanskrit: विष्णुर्गोपाः परमं पाति पाथः परिया धामान्यम्र्तादधानः अग्निष टा विश्वा भुवनानि वेद म... |||
verses.transliteration: viṣṇurghopāḥ paramaṃ pāti pāthaḥ priyā dhāmānyamṛtādadhānaḥ aghniṣ ṭā viśvā bhuvanāni veda ma...

translations.griffith: Viṣṇu, the guardian, keeps the loftiest station, upholding dear, immortal dwelling-places.  Agni knows well all these created beings. Great is the Gods’ supreme and sole dominion.

verses.sanskrit: नाना चक्राते यम्या वपूंषि तयोरन्यद रोचते कर्ष्णमन्यत शयावी च यदरुषी च सवसारौ म... |||
verses.transliteration: nānā cakrāte yamyā vapūṃṣi tayoranyad rocate kṛṣṇamanyat śyāvī ca yadaruṣī ca svasārau ma...

translations.griffith: Ye, variant Pair, have made yourselves twin beauties: one of the Twain is dark, bright shines the other;  And yet these two, the dark, the red, are Sisters. Great is the Gods’ supreme and sole dominion.

verses.sanskrit: माता च यत्र दुहिता च धेनू सबर्दुघे धापयेते समीची रतस्य ते सदसीळे अन्तर्म... |||
verses.transliteration: mātā ca yatra duhitā ca dhenū sabardughe dhāpayete samīcī ṛtasya te sadasīḷe antarma...

translations.griffith: Where the two Cows, the Mother and the Daughter, meet and give suck yielding their lordly nectar,  I praise them at the seat of law eternal. Great is the Gods’ supreme and sole dominion.

verses.sanskrit: अन्यस्या वत्सं रिहती मिमाय कया भुवा नि दधे धेनुरूधः रतस्य सा पयसापिन्वतेळा म... |||
verses.transliteration: anyasyā vatsaṃ rihatī mimāya kayā bhuvā ni dadhe dhenurūdhaḥ ṛtasya sā payasāpinvateḷā ma...

translations.griffith: Loud hath she lowed, licking the other's youngling. On what world hath the Milch-cow laid her udder?  This Iḷā streameth with the milk of Order. Great is the Gods’ supreme and sole dominion.

verses.sanskrit: पद्या वस्ते पुरुरूपा वपूंष्यूर्ध्वा तस्थौ तर्यविं रेरिहाणा रतस्य सद्म वि चरामि विद्वान म... |||
verses.transliteration: padyā vaste pururūpā vapūṃṣyūrdhvā tasthau tryaviṃ rerihāṇā ṛtasya sadma vi carāmi vidvān ma...

translations.griffith: Earth weareth beauties manifold: uplifted, licking her Calf of eighteen months, she standeth.  Well-skilled I seek the seat of law eternal. Great is the Gods’ supreme and sole dominion.

verses.sanskrit: पदे इव निहिते दस्मे अन्तस्तयोरन्यद गुह्यमाविरन्यत सध्रीचीना पथ्या सा विषूची म... |||
verses.transliteration: pade iva nihite dasme antastayoranyad ghuhyamāviranyat sadhrīcīnā pathyā sā viṣūcī ma...

translations.griffith: Within a wondrous place the Twain are treasured: the one is manifest, the other hidden.  One common pathway leads in two directions. Great is the Gods’ supreme and sole dominion.

verses.sanskrit: आ धेनवो धुनयन्तामशिश्वीः सबर्दुघाः शशया अप्रदुग्धाः नव्या-नव्या युवतयो भवन्तीर्म... |||
verses.transliteration: ā dhenavo dhunayantāmaśiśvīḥ sabardughāḥ śaśayā apradughdhāḥ navyā-navyā yuvatayo bhavantīrma...

translations.griffith: Let the milch-kine that have no calves storm downward, yielding rich nectar, streaming, unexhausted,  These who are ever new and fresh and youthful. Great is the Gods’ supreme and sole dominion.

verses.sanskrit: यदन्यासु वर्षभो रोरवीति सो अन्यस्मिन यूथे नि दधातिरेतः स हि कषपावान स भगः स राजा म... |||
verses.transliteration: yadanyāsu vṛṣabho roravīti so anyasmin yūthe ni dadhātiretaḥ sa hi kṣapāvān sa bhaghaḥ sa rājā ma...

translations.griffith: What time the Bull bellows in other regions, another herd receives the genial moisture;  For he is Bhaga, King, the earth's Protector. Great is the Gods’ supreme and sole dominion.

verses.sanskrit: वीरस्य नु सवश्व्यं जनासः पर नु वोचाम विदुरस्य देवाः षोळ्हा युक्ताः पञ्च-पञ्चा वहन्ति म... |||
verses.transliteration: vīrasya nu svaśvyaṃ janāsaḥ pra nu vocāma vidurasya devāḥ ṣoḷhā yuktāḥ pañca-pañcā vahanti ma...

translations.griffith: Let us declare the Hero's wealth in horses, O all ye folk: of this the Gods have knowledge.  Sixfold they bear him, or by fives are harnessed. Great is the Gods’ supreme and sole dominion.

verses.sanskrit: देवस्त्वष्टा सविता विश्वरूपः पुपोष परजाः पुरुधाजजान इमा च विश्वा भुवनान्यस्य म... |||
verses.transliteration: devastvaṣṭā savitā viśvarūpaḥ pupoṣa prajāḥ purudhājajāna imā ca viśvā bhuvanānyasya ma...

translations.griffith: Tvaṣṭar the God, the omniform. Creator, begets and feeds mankind in various manner.  His, verily, arc all these living creatures. Great is the Gods’ supreme dominion.

verses.sanskrit: मही समैरच्चम्वा समीची उभे ते अस्य वसुना नय्र्ष्टे शर्ण्वे वीरो विन्दमानो वसूनि म... |||
verses.transliteration: mahī samairaccamvā samīcī ubhe te asya vasunā nyṛṣṭe śṛṇve vīro vindamāno vasūni ma...

translations.griffith: The two great meeting Bowls hath he united: each of the Pair is laden with histreasure.  The Hero is renowned for gathering riches. Great is the Gods’ supreme and sole dominion.

verses.sanskrit: इमां च नः पर्थिवीं विश्वधाया उप कषेति हितमित्रो नराजा पुरःसदः शर्मसदो न वीरा म... |||
verses.transliteration: imāṃ ca naḥ pṛthivīṃ viśvadhāyā upa kṣeti hitamitro narājā puraḥsadaḥ śarmasado na vīrā ma...

translations.griffith: Yea, and on this our earth the All-Sustainer dwells like a King with noble friends about him.  In his protection heroes rest in safety. Great is the Cods' supreme and sole dominion.

verses.sanskrit: निष्षिध्वरीस्त ओषधीरुतापो रयिं त इन्द्र पर्थिवी बिभर्ति सखायस्ते वामभाजः सयाम म... |||
verses.transliteration: niṣṣidhvarīsta oṣadhīrutāpo rayiṃ ta indra pṛthivī bibharti sakhāyaste vāmabhājaḥ syāma ma...

translations.griffith: Rich in their gifts for thee are herbs and waters, and earth brings all her wealth for thee, O Indra.  May we as friends of thine share goodly treasures. Great is the Gods’ supreme and sole dominion.

verses.sanskrit: न ता मिनन्ति मायिनो न धीरा वरता देवानां परथमा धरुवाणि न रोदसी अद्रुहा वेद्याभिर्न पर्वता निनमे तस्थिवांसः |||
verses.transliteration: na tā minanti māyino na dhīrā vratā devānāṃ prathamā dhruvāṇi na rodasī adruhā vedyābhirna parvatā niname tasthivāṃsaḥ
