translations.griffith: NOT men of magic skill, not men of wisdom impair the Gods’ first steadfast ordinances.  Ne’er may the earth and heaven which know not malice, nor the fixed hills, be bowed by sage devices.

verses.sanskrit: षड भारानेको अचरन बिभर्त्य रतं वर्षिष्ठमुप गाव आगुः तिस्रो महीरुपरास्तस्थुरत्या गुहा दवे निहितेदर्श्येका ||
verses.transliteration: ṣaḍ bhārāneko acaran bibharty ṛtaṃ varṣiṣṭhamupa ghāva āghuḥ tisro mahīruparāstasthuratyā ghuhā dve nihitedarśyekā

translations.griffith: One, moving not away, supports six burthens: the Cows proceed to him the true, the Highest.  Near stand three Mighty Ones who travel swiftly: two are concealed from sight, one is apparent.

verses.sanskrit: तरिपाजस्यो वर्षभो विश्वरूप उत तर्युधा पुरुध परजावान तर्यनीकः पत्यते माहिनावान स रेतोधा वर्षभः शश्वतीनाम |||
verses.transliteration: tripājasyo vṛṣabho viśvarūpa uta tryudhā purudha prajāvān tryanīkaḥ patyate māhināvān sa retodhā vṛṣabhaḥ śaśvatīnām

translations.griffith: The Bull who wears all shapes, the triple-breasted, three-uddered, with a brood in many places,  Ruleth majestic with his triple aspect, the Bull, the Everlasting Ones' impregner.

verses.sanskrit: अभीक आसां पदवीरबोध्यादित्यानामह्वे चारु नाम आपश्चिदस्मा अरमन्त देवीः पर्थग वरजन्तीः परि षीमव्र्ञ्जन |||
verses.transliteration: abhīka āsāṃ padavīrabodhyādityānāmahve cāru nāma āpaścidasmā aramanta devīḥ pṛthagh vrajantīḥ pari ṣīmavṛñjan

translations.griffith: When nigh them, as their tracer he observed them: he called aloud the dear name of Ādityas.  The Goddesses, the Waters, stayed to meet him: they who were wandering separate enclosed him.

verses.sanskrit: तरी षधस्था सिन्धवस्त्रिः कवीनामुत तरिमाता विदथेषु सम्राट रतावरीर्योषणास्तिस्रो अप्यास्त्रिरा दिवो विदथे पत्यमानाः |||
verses.transliteration: trī ṣadhasthā sindhavastriḥ kavīnāmuta trimātā vidatheṣu samrāṭ ṛtāvarīryoṣaṇāstisro apyāstrirā divo vidathe patyamānāḥ

translations.griffith: Streams! the wise Gods have thrice three habitations. Child of three Mothers, he is Lord in synods.  Three are the holy Ladies of the Waters, thrice here from heaven supreme in our assembly.

verses.sanskrit: तरिरा दिवः सवितर्वार्याणि दिवे-दिव आ सुव तरिर्नो अह्नः तरिधातु राय आ सुवा वसूनि भग तरातर्धिषणे सातये धाः |||
verses.transliteration: trirā divaḥ savitarvāryāṇi dive-diva ā suva trirno ahnaḥ tridhātu rāya ā suvā vasūni bhagha trātardhiṣaṇe sātaye dhāḥ

translations.griffith: Do thou, O Savitar, from heaven thrice hither, three times a day, send down thy blessings daily.  Send us, O Bhaga, triple wealth and treasure; cause the two worlds to prosper us, Preserver!

verses.sanskrit: तरिरा दिवः सविता सोषवीति राजाना मित्रावरुणा सुपाणी आपश्चिदस्य रोदसी चिदुर्वी रत्नं भिक्षन्त सवितुः सवाय |||
verses.transliteration: trirā divaḥ savitā soṣavīti rājānā mitrāvaruṇā supāṇī āpaścidasya rodasī cidurvī ratnaṃ bhikṣanta savituḥ savāya

translations.griffith: Savitar thrice from heaven pours down abundance, and the fair-handed Kings Varuṇa, Mitra;  And spacious Heaven and Earth, yea, and the Waters, solicit wealth that Savitar may send us.

verses.sanskrit: तरिरुत्तमा दूणशा रोचनानि तरयो राजन्त्यसुरस्य वीराः रतावान इषिरा दूळभासस्त्रिरा दिवो विदथे सन्तु देवाः |||
verses.transliteration: triruttamā dūṇaśā rocanāni trayo rājantyasurasya vīrāḥ ṛtāvāna iṣirā dūḷabhāsastrirā divo vidathe santu devāḥ

translations.griffith: Three are the bright realms, best, beyond attainment, and three, the Asura's Heroes, rule as Sovrans,  Holy and vigorous, never to be injured. Thrice may the Gods from heaven attend our synod.

verses.sanskrit: पर मे विविक्वानविदन मनीषां धेनुं चरन्तीं परयुतामगोपाम सद्यश्चिद या दुदुहे भूरि धासेरिन्द्रस्तदग्निः पनितारो अस्याः |||
verses.transliteration: pra me vivikvānavidan manīṣāṃ dhenuṃ carantīṃ prayutāmaghopām sadyaścid yā duduhe bhūri dhāserindrastadaghniḥ panitāro asyāḥ

translations.griffith: MY thought with fine discernment hath discovered the Cow who wanders free without a herdsman,  Her who hath straightway poured me food in plenty: Indra and Agni therefore are her praisers.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रः सु पूषा वर्षणा सुहस्ता दिवो न परीताः शशयं दुदुह्रे विश्वे यदस्यां रणयन्त देवाः पर वो.अत्र वसवः सुम्नमश्याम |||
verses.transliteration: indraḥ su pūṣā vṛṣaṇā suhastā divo na prītāḥ śaśayaṃ duduhre viśve yadasyāṃ raṇayanta devāḥ pra vo.atra vasavaḥ sumnamaśyām

translations.griffith: Indra and Pūṣan, deft of hand and mighty, well-pleased have drained the heaven's exhaustless udder.  As in this praise the Gods have all delighted, may I win blessing here from you, O Vasus.

verses.sanskrit: या जामयो वर्ष्ण इछन्ति शक्तिं नमस्यन्तीर्जानते गर्भमस्मिन अछा पुत्रं धेनवो वावशाना महश्चरन्ति बिभ्रतं वपूंषि |||
verses.transliteration: yā jāmayo vṛṣṇa ichanti śaktiṃ namasyantīrjānate gharbhamasmin achā putraṃ dhenavo vāvaśānā mahaścaranti bibhrataṃ vapūṃṣi

translations.griffith: Fain to lend vigour to the Bull, the siste.. with reverence recognize the germ within him.  The Cows come lowing hither to the Youngling, to him endued with great and wondrous beauties.

verses.sanskrit: अछा विवक्मि रोदसी सुमेके गराव्णो युजानो अध्वरे मनीषा इमा उ ते मनवे भूरिवारा ऊर्ध्वा भवन्ति दर्शता यजत्राः |||
verses.transliteration: achā vivakmi rodasī sumeke ghrāvṇo yujāno adhvare manīṣā imā u te manave bhūrivārā ūrdhvā bhavanti darśatā yajatrāḥ

translations.griffith: Fixing with thought, at sacrifice, the press-stones, I bid the well-formed Heaven and Earth come hither;  For these thy flames, which give men boons in plenty, rise up on high, the beautiful, the holy.

verses.sanskrit: या ते जिह्वा मधुमती सुमेधा अग्ने देवेषूच्यत उरूची तयेह विश्वानवसे यजत्राना सादय पायया चा मधूनि |||
verses.transliteration: yā te jihvā madhumatī sumedhā aghne deveṣūcyata urūcī tayeha viśvānavase yajatrānā sādaya pāyayā cā madhūni

translations.griffith: Agni, thy meath-sweet tongue that tastes fair viands, which among Gods is called the far-extended,—  Therewith make all the Holy Odes be seated here for our help, and feed them with sweet juices.

verses.sanskrit: या ते अग्ने पर्वतस्येव धारासश्चन्ती पीपयद देव चित्रा तामस्मभ्यं परमतिं जातवेदो वसो रास्व सुमतिं विश्वजन्याम |||
verses.transliteration: yā te aghne parvatasyeva dhārāsaścantī pīpayad deva citrā tāmasmabhyaṃ pramatiṃ jātavedo vaso rāsva sumatiṃ viśvajanyām

translations.griffith: Let thy stream give us drink, O God, O Agni, wonderful and exhaustless like the rain-clouds.  Thus care for us, O Vasu Jātavedas, show us thy loving-kindness, reaching all men.

verses.sanskrit: धेनुः परत्नस्य काम्यं दुहानान्तः पुत्रश्चरति दक्षिणायाः आ दयोतनिं वहति शुभ्रयामोषस सतोमो अश्विनावजीगः |||
verses.transliteration: dhenuḥ pratnasya kāmyaṃ duhānāntaḥ putraścarati dakṣiṇāyāḥ ā dyotaniṃ vahati śubhrayāmoṣasa stomo aśvināvajīghaḥ

translations.griffith: THE Ancient's Milch-cow yields the things we long for: the Son of Dakṣiṇā travels between them.  She with the splendid chariot brings refulgence. The praise of Uṣas hath awoke the Aśvins.

verses.sanskrit: सुयुग वहन्ति परति वां रतेनोर्ध्वा भवन्ति पितरेव मेधाः जरेथामस्मद वि पणेर्महीषां युवोरवश्चक्र्मा यातमर्वाक |||
verses.transliteration: suyugh vahanti prati vāṃ ṛtenordhvā bhavanti pitareva medhāḥ jarethāmasmad vi paṇermahīṣāṃ yuvoravaścakṛmā yātamarvāk

translations.griffith: They bear you hither by well-orderd statute: our sacred offerings rise as if to parents.  Destroy in us the counsel of the niggard come hitherward, for we have shown you favour.

verses.sanskrit: सुयुग्भिरश्वैः सुव्र्ता रथेन दस्राविमं शर्णुतं शलोकमद्रेः किमङग वां परत्यवर्तिं गमिष्ठाहुर्विप्रासो अश्विना पुराजाः |||
verses.transliteration: suyughbhiraśvaiḥ suvṛtā rathena dasrāvimaṃ śṛṇutaṃ ślokamadreḥ kimaṅgha vāṃ pratyavartiṃ ghamiṣṭhāhurviprāso aśvinā purājāḥ

translations.griffith: With lightly-rolling car and well-yoked horses hear this, the press-stone's song, ye Wonder-Workers.  Have not the sages of old time, ye Aśvins, called you most prompt to come and stay misfortune?

verses.sanskrit: आ मन्येथामा गतं कच्चिदेवैर्विश्वे जनासो अश्विना हवन्ते इमा हि वां गोर्जीका मधूनि पर मित्रासो न ददुरुस्रो अग्रे |||
verses.transliteration: ā manyethāmā ghataṃ kaccidevairviśve janāso aśvinā havante imā hi vāṃ ghoṛjīkā madhūni pra mitrāso na dadurusro aghre

translations.griffith: Remember us, and come to us, for ever men, as their wont is, invocate the Aśvins.  Friends as it were have offered you these juices, sweet, blent with milk at the first break of morning.

verses.sanskrit: तिरः पुरू चिदश्विना रजांस्याङगूषो वां मघवाना जनेषु एह यातं पथिभिर्देवयानैर्दस्राविमे वां निधयो मधूनाम |||
verses.transliteration: tiraḥ purū cidaśvinā rajāṃsyāṅghūṣo vāṃ maghavānā janeṣu eha yātaṃ pathibhirdevayānairdasrāvime vāṃ nidhayo madhūnām

translations.griffith: Even through many regions, O ye Aśvins high praise is yours among mankind, ye Mighty-  Come, helpers, on the paths which Gods have travelled: here your libations of sweet meath are ready.

verses.sanskrit: पुराणमोकः सख्यं शिवं वां युवोर्नरा दरविणं जह्नाव्याम पुनः कर्ण्वानाः सख्या शिवानि मध्वा मदेमसह नू समानाः |||
verses.transliteration: purāṇamokaḥ sakhyaṃ śivaṃ vāṃ yuvornarā draviṇaṃ jahnāvyām punaḥ kṛṇvānāḥ sakhyā śivāni madhvā mademasaha nū samānāḥ

translations.griffith: Ancient your home, auspicious is your friendship: Heroes, your wealth is with the house of Jahnu.  Forming again with you auspicious friendship, let us rejoice with draughts of meath together.

verses.sanskrit: अश्विना वायुना युवं सुदक्षा नियुद्भिष च सजोषसा युवाना नासत्या तिरोह्न्यं जुषाणा सोमं पिबतमस्रिधा सुदानू |||
verses.transliteration: aśvinā vāyunā yuvaṃ sudakṣā niyudbhiṣ ca sajoṣasā yuvānā nāsatyā tiroahnyaṃ juṣāṇā somaṃ pibatamasridhā sudānū

translations.griffith: O Aśvins, Very Mighty ones, with Vāyu and with his steeds, one-minded, ever-youthful,  Nāsatyas, joying in the third day's Soma, drink it, not hostile, Very Bounteous Givers.

verses.sanskrit: अश्विना परि वामिषः पुरूचीरीयुर्गीर्भिर्यतमाना अम्र्ध्राः रथो ह वां रतजा अद्रिजूतः परि दयावाप्र्थिवी याति सद्यः |||
verses.transliteration: aśvinā pari vāmiṣaḥ purūcīrīyurghīrbhiryatamānā amṛdhrāḥ ratho ha vāṃ ṛtajā adrijūtaḥ pari dyāvāpṛthivī yāti sadyaḥ

translations.griffith: Aśvins, to you are brought abundant viands in rivalry with sacred songs, unceasing.  Sprung from high Law your car, urged on by press-stones, goes round the earth and heaven in one brief moment.

verses.sanskrit: अश्विना मधुषुत्तमो युवाकुः सोमस्तं पातमा गतं दुरोणे रथो ह वां भूरि वर्पः करिक्रत सुतावतो निष्क्र्तमागमिष्ठः |||
verses.transliteration: aśvinā madhuṣuttamo yuvākuḥ somastaṃ pātamā ghataṃ duroṇe ratho ha vāṃ bhūri varpaḥ karikrat sutāvato niṣkṛtamāghamiṣṭhaḥ

translations.griffith: Aśvins, your Soma sheds delicious sweetness: drink ye thereof and come unto our dwelling.  Your car, assuming many a shape, most often goes to the Soma-presser's place of meeting.

verses.sanskrit: मित्रो जनान यातयति बरुवाणो मित्रो दाधार पर्थिवीमुत दयाम मित्रः कर्ष्टीरनिमिषाभि चष्टे मित्राय हव्यंघ्र्तवज्जुहोत |||
verses.transliteration: mitro janān yātayati bruvāṇo mitro dādhāra pṛthivīmuta dyām mitraḥ kṛṣṭīranimiṣābhi caṣṭe mitrāya havyaṃghṛtavajjuhota

translations.griffith: MITRA, when speaking, stirreth men to labour: Mitra sustaineth both the earth and heaven.  Mitra beholdeth men with eyes that close not. To Mitra bring, with holy oil, oblation.

verses.sanskrit: पर स मित्र मर्तो अस्तु परयस्वान यस्त आदित्य शिक्षति वरतेन न हन्यते न जीयते तवोतो नैनमंहो अश्नोत्यन्तितो न दूरात |||
verses.transliteration: pra sa mitra marto astu prayasvān yasta āditya śikṣati vratena na hanyate na jīyate tvoto nainamaṃho aśnotyantito na dūrāt

translations.griffith: Foremost be he who brings thee food, O Mitra, who strives to keep thy sacred Law, Āditya.  He whom thou helpest ne’er is slain or conquered, on him, from near or far, falls no affliction.

verses.sanskrit: अनमीवास इळया मदन्तो मितज्ञवो वरिमन्ना पर्थिव्याः आदित्यस्य वरतमुपक्षियन्तो वयं मित्रस्य सुमतौ सयाम |||
verses.transliteration: anamīvāsa iḷayā madanto mitajñavo varimannā pṛthivyāḥ ādityasya vratamupakṣiyanto vayaṃ mitrasya sumatau syāma

translations.griffith: joying in sacred food and free from sickness, with knees bent lowly on the earth's broad surface,  Following closely the Āditya's statute, may we remain in Mitra's gracious favour.

verses.sanskrit: अयं मित्रो नमस्यः सुशेवो राजा सुक्षत्रो अजनिष्ट वेधाः तस्य वयं ... |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ mitro namasyaḥ suśevo rājā sukṣatro ajaniṣṭa vedhāḥ tasya vayaṃ ...

translations.griffith: Auspicious and adorable, this Mitra was born with fair dominion, King, Disposer.  May we enjoy the grace of him the Holy, yea, rest in his propitious loving-kindness.

verses.sanskrit: महानादित्यो नमसोपसद्यो यातयज्जनो गर्णते सुशेवः तस्मा एतत पन्यतमाय जुष्टमग्नौ मित्राय हविरा जुहोत |||
verses.transliteration: mahānādityo namasopasadyo yātayajjano ghṛṇate suśevaḥ tasmā etat panyatamāya juṣṭamaghnau mitrāya havirā juhota

translations.griffith: The great Āditya, to be served with wor. ship, who stirreth men, is gracious to the singer.  To Mitra, him most highly to be lauded, offer in fire oblation that he loveth.

verses.sanskrit: मित्रस्य चर्षणीध्र्तो.अवो देवस्य सानसि दयुम्नं चित्रश्रवस्तमम |||
verses.transliteration: mitrasya carṣaṇīdhṛto.avo devasya sānasi dyumnaṃ citraśravastamam

translations.griffith: The gainful grace of Mitra,. God, supporter of the race of man,  Gives splendour of most.glorious fame.

verses.sanskrit: अभि यो महिना दिवं मित्रो बभूव सप्रथाः अभि शरवोभिः पर्थिवीम |||
verses.transliteration: abhi yo mahinā divaṃ mitro babhūva saprathāḥ abhi śravobhiḥ pṛthivīm

translations.griffith: Mitra whose glory spreads afar, he who in might surpasses heaven,  Surpasses earth in his renown.

verses.sanskrit: मित्राय पञ्च येमिरे जना अभिष्टिशवसे स देवान विश्वान बिभर्ति |||
verses.transliteration: mitrāya pañca yemire janā abhiṣṭiśavase sa devān viśvān bibharti

translations.griffith: All the Five Races have repaired to Mitra, ever strong to aid,  For he sustaineth all the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: मित्रो देवेष्वायुषु जनाय वर्क्तबर्हिषे इष इष्टव्रताकः |||
verses.transliteration: mitro deveṣvāyuṣu janāya vṛktabarhiṣe iṣa iṣṭavratāakaḥ

translations.griffith: Mitra to Gods, to living men, to him who strews the holy grass,  Gives food fulfilling sacred Law.

verses.sanskrit: इहेह वो मनसा बन्धुता नर उशिजो जग्मुरभि तानि वेदसा याभिर्मायाभिः परतिजूतिवर्पसः सौधन्वना यज्ञियं भागमानश |||
verses.transliteration: iheha vo manasā bandhutā nara uśijo jaghmurabhi tāni vedasā yābhirmāyābhiḥ pratijūtivarpasaḥ saudhanvanā yajñiyaṃ bhāghamānaśa

translations.griffith: HERE is your ghostly kinship, here, O Men: they came desirous to these holy rites with store of wealth,  With wondrous arts, whereby, with schemes to meet each need, Ye gained, Sudhanvan's Sons! your share in sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: याभिः शचीभिश्चमसानपिंशत यया धिया गामरिणीत चर्मणः येन हरी मनसा निरतक्षत तेन देवत्वं रभवः समानश |||
verses.transliteration: yābhiḥ śacībhiścamasānapiṃśata yayā dhiyā ghāmariṇīta carmaṇaḥ yena harī manasā niratakṣata tena devatvaṃ ṛbhavaḥ samānaśa

translations.griffith: The mighty powers wherewith. ye formed the chalices, the thought by which ye drew the cow from out the hide,  The intellect wherewith ye wrought the two Bay Steeds,—through these, O Ṛbhus, ye attained divinity.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रस्य सख्यं रभवः समानशुर्मनोर्नपातो अपसो दधन्विरे सौधन्वनासो अम्र्तत्वमेरिरे विष्ट्वी शमीभिः सुक्र्तः सुक्र्त्यया |||
verses.transliteration: indrasya sakhyaṃ ṛbhavaḥ samānaśurmanornapāto apaso dadhanvire saudhanvanāso amṛtatvamerire viṣṭvī śamībhiḥ sukṛtaḥ sukṛtyayā

translations.griffith: Friendship with Indra have the Ṛbhus, fully gained: grandsons of Manu, they skilfully urged the work.  Sudhanvan's Children won them everlasting life, serving with holy rites, pious with noble acts.  4:In company with Indra come ye to the juice, then gloriously shall your wishes be fulfilled.  Not to be paragoned, ye Priests, are your good deeds, nor your heroic acts, Ṛbhus, Sudhanvan's Sons.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रेण याथ सरथं सुते सचानथो वशानां भवथासह शरिया न वः परतिमै सुक्र्तानि वाघतः सौधन्वना रभवो वीर्याणि च |||
verses.transliteration: indreṇa yātha sarathaṃ sute sacānatho vaśānāṃ bhavathāsaha śriyā na vaḥ pratimai sukṛtāni vāghataḥ saudhanvanā ṛbhavo vīryāṇi ca

translations.griffith: O Indra, with the Ṛbhus, Mighty Ones, pour down the Soma juice effused, well-blent, from both thy hands.  Maghalan, urged by song, in the drink-offerer's house rejoice thee with the Heroes, with Sudhanvan's Sons.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्र रभुभिर्वाजवद्भिः समुक्षितं सुतं सोममा वर्षस्वा गभस्त्योः धियेषितो मघवन दाशुषो गर्हे सौधन्वनेभिः सह मत्स्वा नर्भिः |||
verses.transliteration: indra ṛbhubhirvājavadbhiḥ samukṣitaṃ sutaṃ somamā vṛṣasvā ghabhastyoḥ dhiyeṣito maghavan dāśuṣo ghṛhe saudhanvanebhiḥ saha matsvā nṛbhiḥ

translations.griffith: With Ṛbhu near, and Vāja, Indra, here exult, with Saci, praised of many, in the juice we pour.  These homes wherein we dwell have turned themselves to thee, -devotions to the Gods, as laws of men ordain.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्र रभुमान वाजवान मत्स्वेह नो.अस्मिन सवने शच्या पुरुष्टुत इमानि तुभ्यं सवसराणि येमिरे वरता देवानां मनुषश्च धर्मभिः |||
verses.transliteration: indra ṛbhumān vājavān matsveha no.asmin savane śacyā puruṣṭuta imāni tubhyaṃ svasarāṇi yemire vratā devānāṃ manuṣaśca dharmabhiḥ

translations.griffith: Come with the mighty Ṛbhus, Indra, come to us, strengthening with thy help the singer's holy praise;  At hundred eager calls come to the living man, with thousand arts attend the act of sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्र रभुभिर्वाजिभिर्वाजयन्निह सतोमं जरितुरुप याहि यज्ञियम शतं केतेभिरिषिरेभिरायवे सहस्रणीथोध्वरस्य होमनि |||
verses.transliteration: indra ṛbhubhirvājibhirvājayanniha stomaṃ jariturupa yāhi yajñiyam śataṃ ketebhiriṣirebhirāyave sahasraṇīthoadhvarasya homani

translations.griffith: Missing line from Griffith.

verses.sanskrit: उषो वाजेन वाजिनि परचेता सतोमं जुषस्व गर्णतो मघोनि पुराणी देवि युवतिः पुरन्धिरनु वरतं चरसि विश्ववारे |||
verses.transliteration: uṣo vājena vājini pracetā stomaṃ juṣasva ghṛṇato maghoni purāṇī devi yuvatiḥ purandhiranu vrataṃ carasi viśvavāre

translations.griffith: O Uṣas, strong with strength, endowed witli knowledge, accept the singer's praise, O wealthy Lady.  Thou, Goddess, ancient, young, and full of wisdom, movest, all-bounteous! as the Law ordaineth.

verses.sanskrit: उषो देव्यमर्त्या वि भाहि चन्द्ररथा सून्र्ता ईरयन्ती आ तवा वहन्तु सुयमासो अश्वा हिरण्यवर्णां पर्थुपाजसो ये |||
verses.transliteration: uṣo devyamartyā vi bhāhi candrarathā sūnṛtā īrayantī ā tvā vahantu suyamāso aśvā hiraṇyavarṇāṃ pṛthupājaso ye

translations.griffith: Shine forth, O Morning, thou auspicious Goddess, on thy bright car awaking pleasant voices.  Let docile horses of far-reaching splendour convey thee hitherward, the goldencoloured.

verses.sanskrit: उषः परतीची भुवनानि विश्वोर्ध्वा तिष्ठस्यम्र्तस्य केतुः समानमर्थं चरणीयमाना चक्रमिव नव्यस्या वव्र्त्स्व |||
verses.transliteration: uṣaḥ pratīcī bhuvanāni viśvordhvā tiṣṭhasyamṛtasya ketuḥ samānamarthaṃ caraṇīyamānā cakramiva navyasyā vavṛtsva

translations.griffith: Thou, Morning, turning thee to every creature, standest on high as ensign of the Immortal,  To one same goal ever and ever wending now, like a wheel, O newly-born, roll hi ther.

verses.sanskrit: अव सयूमेव चिन्वती मघोन्युषा याति सवसरस्य पत्नी सवर्जनन्ती सुभगा सुदंसा आन्ताद दिवः पप्रथ आ पर्थिव्याः |||
verses.transliteration: ava syūmeva cinvatī maghonyuṣā yāti svasarasya patnī svarjanantī subhaghā sudaṃsā āntād divaḥ papratha ā pṛthivyāḥ

translations.griffith: Letting her reins drop downward, Morning cometh, the wealthy Dame, the Lady of the dwelling;  Bringing forth light, the Wonderful, the Blessed hath spread her from the bounds of earth and heaven.

verses.sanskrit: अछा वो देवीमुषसं विभातीं पर वो भरध्वं नमसा सुव्र्क्तिम ऊर्ध्वं मधुधा दिवि पाजो अश्रेत पर रोचना रुरुचे रण्वसन्द्र्क |||
verses.transliteration: achā vo devīmuṣasaṃ vibhātīṃ pra vo bharadhvaṃ namasā suvṛktim ūrdhvaṃ madhudhā divi pājo aśret pra rocanā ruruce raṇvasandṛk

translations.griffith: Hither invoke the radiant Goddess Morning, and bring with reverence your hymn to praise her.  She, dropping sweets, hath set in heaven her brightness, and, fair to look on, hath beamed forth her splendour.

verses.sanskrit: रतावरी दिवो अर्कैरबोध्या रेवती रोदसी चित्रमस्थात आयतीमग्न उषसं विभातीं वाममेषि दरविणं भिक्षमाणः |||
verses.transliteration: ṛtāvarī divo arkairabodhyā revatī rodasī citramasthāt āyatīmaghna uṣasaṃ vibhātīṃ vāmameṣi draviṇaṃ bhikṣamāṇaḥ

translations.griffith: From heaven, with hymns, the Holy One was wakened: brightly to both worlds came the wealthy Lady.  To Morning, Agni, when she comes refulgent, thou goest forth soliciting fair riches.

verses.sanskrit: रतस्य बुध्न उषसामिषण्यन वर्षा मही रोदसी आ विवेश मही मित्रस्य वरुणस्य माया चन्द्रेव भानुं वि दधे पुरुत्रा |||
verses.transliteration: ṛtasya budhna uṣasāmiṣaṇyan vṛṣā mahī rodasī ā viveśa mahī mitrasya varuṇasya māyā candreva bhānuṃ vi dadhe purutrā

translations.griffith: On Law's firm base the speeder of the Mornings, the Bull, hath entered mighty earth and heaven.  Great is the power of Varuṇa and Mitra, which, bright, hath spread in every place its splendour.

verses.sanskrit: इमा उ वां भर्मयो मन्यमाना युवावते न तुज्या अभूवन कव तयदिन्द्रावरुणा यशो वां येन समा सिनं भरथः सखिभ्यः |||
verses.transliteration: imā u vāṃ bhṛmayo manyamānā yuvāvate na tujyā abhūvan kva tyadindrāvaruṇā yaśo vāṃ yena smā sinaṃ bharathaḥ sakhibhyaḥ

translations.griffith: YOUR well-known prompt activities aforetime needed no impulse from your faithful servant.  Where, Indra-Varuṇa, is now that glory wherewith ye brought support to those who loved you?

verses.sanskrit: अयमु वां पुरुतमो रयीयञ्छश्वत्तममवसे जोहवीति सजोषाविन्द्रावरुणा मरुद्भिर्दिवा पर्थिव्या शर्णुतं हवम्मे |||
verses.transliteration: ayamu vāṃ purutamo rayīyañchaśvattamamavase johavīti sajoṣāvindrāvaruṇā marudbhirdivā pṛthivyā śṛṇutaṃ havamme

translations.griffith: This man, most diligent, seeking after riches, incessantly invokes you for your favour.  Accordant, Indra-Varuṇa, with Maruts, with Heaven and Earth, hear ye mine invocation.

verses.sanskrit: अस्मे तदिन्द्रावरुणा वसु षयादस्मे रयिर्मरुतः सर्ववीरः अस्मान वरूत्रीः शरणैरवन्त्वस्मान होत्रा भारती दक्षिणाभिः |||
verses.transliteration: asme tadindrāvaruṇā vasu ṣyādasme rayirmarutaḥ sarvavīraḥ asmān varūtrīḥ śaraṇairavantvasmān hotrā bhāratī dakṣiṇābhiḥ

translations.griffith: O Indra-Varuṇa, ours be this treasure ours be wealth, Maruts, with full store of heroes.  May the Varūtrīs with their shelter aid us, and Bhāratī and Hotrā with the Mornings.

verses.sanskrit: बर्हस्पते जुषस्व नो हव्यानि विश्वदेव्य रास्व रत्नानि दाशुषे |||
verses.transliteration: bṛhaspate juṣasva no havyāni viśvadevya rāsva ratnāni dāśuṣe

translations.griffith: Be pleased! with our oblations, thou loved of all Gods, Bṛhaspati:  Give wealth to him who brings thee gifts.

verses.sanskrit: शुचिमर्कैर्ब्र्हस्पतिमध्वरेषु नमस्यत अनाम्योज आचके |||
verses.transliteration: śucimarkairbṛhaspatimadhvareṣu namasyata anāmyoja ācake

translations.griffith: At sacrifices, with your hymns worship the pure Bṛhaspati—  I pray for power which none may bend—

verses.sanskrit: वर्षभं चर्षणीनां विश्वरूपमदाभ्यम बर्हस्पतिंवरेण्यम |||
verses.transliteration: vṛṣabhaṃ carṣaṇīnāṃ viśvarūpamadābhyam bṛhaspatiṃvareṇyam

translations.griffith: The Bull of men, whom none deceive, the wearer of each shape at will,  Bṛhaspati Most Excellent.

verses.sanskrit: इयं ते पूषन्नाघ्र्णे सुष्टुतिर्देव नव्यसी अस्माभिस्तुभ्यं शस्यते |||
verses.transliteration: iyaṃ te pūṣannāghṛṇe suṣṭutirdeva navyasī asmābhistubhyaṃ śasyate

translations.griffith: Divine, resplendent Pūṣan, this our newest hymn of eulogy,  By us is chanted forth to thee.

verses.sanskrit: तां जुषस्व गिरं मम वाजयन्तीमवा धियम वधूयुरिव योषणाम |||
verses.transliteration: tāṃ juṣasva ghiraṃ mama vājayantīmavā dhiyam vadhūyuriva yoṣaṇām

translations.griffith: Accept with favour this my song, be gracious to the earnest thought,  Even as a bridegroom to his bride.

verses.sanskrit: यो विश्वाभि विपश्यति भुवना सं च पश्यति स नः पूषाविता भुवत |||
verses.transliteration: yo viśvābhi vipaśyati bhuvanā saṃ ca paśyati sa naḥ pūṣāvitā bhuvat

translations.griffith: May he who sees all living things, see, them together at a glance,—  May he, may Pūṣan be our help.

verses.sanskrit: तत सवितुर्वरेण्यं भर्गो देवस्य धीमहि धियो यो नः परचोदयात |||
verses.transliteration: tat saviturvareṇyaṃ bhargho devasya dhīmahi dhiyo yo naḥ pracodayāt

translations.griffith: May we attain that excellent glory of Savitar the God:  So May he stimulate our prayers.

verses.sanskrit: देवस्य सवितुर्वयं वाजयन्तः पुरन्ध्या भगस्य रातिमीमहे |||
verses.transliteration: devasya saviturvayaṃ vājayantaḥ purandhyā bhaghasya rātimīmahe

translations.griffith: With understanding, earnestly, of Savitar the God we crave  Our portion of prosperity.

verses.sanskrit: देवं नरः सवितारं विप्रा यज्ञैः सुव्र्क्तिभिः नमस्यन्ति धियेषिताः |||
verses.transliteration: devaṃ naraḥ savitāraṃ viprā yajñaiḥ suvṛktibhiḥ namasyanti dhiyeṣitāḥ

translations.griffith: Men, singers worship Savitar the God with hymn and holy rites,  Urged by the impulse of their thoughts.

verses.sanskrit: सोमो जिगाति गातुविद देवानामेति निष्क्र्तम रतस्य योनिमासदम |||
verses.transliteration: somo jighāti ghātuvid devānāmeti niṣkṛtam ṛtasya yonimāsadam

translations.griffith: Soma who gives success goes forth, goes to the gathering place of Gods,  To seat him at the seat of Law.

verses.sanskrit: सोमो अस्मभ्यं दविपदे चतुष्पदे च पशवे अनमीवा इषस करत |||
verses.transliteration: somo asmabhyaṃ dvipade catuṣpade ca paśave anamīvā iṣas karat

translations.griffith: To us and to our cattle may Soma give salutary food,  To biped and to quadruped.

verses.sanskrit: अस्माकमायुर्वर्धयन्नभिमातीः सहमानः सोमः सधस्थमासदत |||
verses.transliteration: asmākamāyurvardhayannabhimātīḥ sahamānaḥ somaḥ sadhasthamāsadat

translations.griffith: May Soma, strengthening our power of life, and conquering our foes,  In our assembly take his seat.

verses.sanskrit: आ नो मित्रावरुणा घर्तैर्गव्यूतिमुक्षतम मध्वा रजांसि सुक्रतू |||
verses.transliteration: ā no mitrāvaruṇā ghṛtairghavyūtimukṣatam madhvā rajāṃsi sukratū

translations.griffith: May Mitra-Varuṇa, sapient Pair, bedew our pasturage with oil,  With meatb the regions of the air.

verses.sanskrit: उरुशंसा नमोव्र्धा मह्ना दक्षस्य राजथः दराघिष्ठाभिः शुचिव्रता |||
verses.transliteration: uruśaṃsā namovṛdhā mahnā dakṣasya rājathaḥ drāghiṣṭhābhiḥ śucivratā

translations.griffith: Far-ruling, joyful when adored, ye reign through majesty of might,  With pure laws everlastingly.

verses.sanskrit: गर्णाना जमदग्निना योनाव रतस्य सीदतम पातं सोमं रताव्र्धा |||
verses.transliteration: ghṛṇānā jamadaghninā yonāv ṛtasya sīdatam pātaṃ somaṃ ṛtāvṛdhā

translations.griffith: Lauded by Jamadagni's song, sit in the place of holy Law:
